Experience with technical design process and models.
Experience with requirements specification and development, such as process/functional requirements definition methods, JAD/RAD sessions, use case development, process flow diagrams.
Knowledge of SDLC / SW development processes, such as Unified Modeling Language ("UML") and / or Rational Unified Process ("RUP"), Agile, Waterfall).
Experience using consulting skills and developing client relationships.
Experience using analytical skills, tools and techniques to investigate information and to draw conclusions.
Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics.
Master's Degree or MBA.
Experience with SDLC / SW development processes, such as Unified Modeling Language ("UML") and / or Rational Unified Process ("RUP"), Agile, Waterfall).
Experience in identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems.
Experience in Financial Services

Job Description:

Bring Your Passion to the Forefront:
Supply Chain Analyst
Join one of the nation’s most comprehensive academic medical centers, UChicago Medicine. The Supply Chain Department seeks an experienced Business Systems Analyst to formulate and define systems scope and objectives.
Job Summary
Under general supervision, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications. Competent to work at the highest technical level of most phases of systems analysis while considering the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. Performs daily operational tasks in ERP and other supply chain information systems.
Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities
Analyze business and user needs
Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives
Document Requirements
Revising existing (problematic) system logic
Evaluate most business implications of technology on the current business environment
Able to correlate business, management and information technology functions
You'll thrive in this position if you:
Deliver Results – you identify issues, problems and opportunities; pro-actively recognize the need for improvement. You work with others to develop a sense of common purpose; understand different perspectives on issues; gathers and examines information available. You generate alternatives - Create relevant options, including financial and resource implications, for addressing problems and opportunities. You select appropriate action - Formulate clear decision criteria; evaluates options by considering implications and consequences; chooses an effective option. You commit to implementation and work with a sense of urgency and a bias for action to implement the decision.
Embrace Change – you treat change and new situations as opportunities for learning or growth; identifies the benefits and risks of change. You quickly modify behavior to deal effectively with changes; remains effective during times of ambiguity and uncertainty. You honor the need in others to ask questions; helps others overcome resistance.
Act with Courage & Conviction – you look at interactions, activities and processes to maximize the patient, customer and employee experience; speaks up for point of view with confidence even when the topic is controversial; shares point of view in a manner that builds support. You alert the right person when expectations or standards are not met or when UCMC’s values are at risk. You ensure proper resolution is achieved and an explanation is received; escalates appropriately if needed.
Communicate with Impact – you focus on the message of others, provide undivided attention, and defer judgment. You convey messages logically, simply, and with confidence. You check for understanding by asking questions, seeking clarity and responding accordingly
Qualifications
Associate or Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant certification in information systems, supply chain management (with focus on information systems), or other related majors, is required
Experience with multiple software applications, systems analysis/design, Integration/design, or web applications/design
Ability to prioritize, organize, and assess work in order to meet aggressive deadlines and to cope in a fast-paced environment
Capable of working well in a diverse, multi-disciplinary team and successfully interacting with others at all levels of the organization, including remote teams
Solid skills in documenting and analyzing business processes
Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills and effective presentation skills
Experience developing presentations for project work
Ability to plan and facilitate meetings with diverse participants
Ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor in both normal and pressure situations
Proven skills in problem solving
Ability to query and analyze data from ERP, Inventory and Requisitioning systems, Data Warehouse, and other supply chain information systems
Ability to manage, optimize, and automate information flow in supply chain information systems
Proven skills in using Tableau, Excel, Access, SQL, and other Business Intelligence tools
Familiarity with tools and concepts of process improvement desired, including the following: methods analysis, work sampling, statistical analysis, financial analysis, and systems analysis
Must comply with Ingalls Memorial Hospital's COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.

We’ve been at the forefront of medicine since 1899. We provide superior healthcare with compassion, always mindful that each patient is a person, an individual. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. OVERVIEW
Experience the possibilities of our progressive, omnichannel approach to beauty retail. At Ulta Beauty, our Marketing team is applying the latest technologies to personalize the buying experience of true beauty enthusiasts—in ways that surprise and delight. Building love and loyalty, one communication, one experience, one brilliant idea at a time. We represent the perfect blend of strategy and creativity. Of tactics and analytics. To make Ulta Beauty a brand guests will advocate for. Growing share of heart. Delivering with disciplined consistency. Whether your deepest passion is for design or content, strategy or data, or some combination of all things marketing, Ulta Beauty will provide significant latitude to explore your talents and passions, with opportunities to stretch and deepen, to grow and build. Truly, the possibilities are beautiful.
THE IMPACT YOU CAN HAVE:
The Guest Data Analyst is part of a business-enabling team that executes day-to-day activities of master data of the customer domain – enabling Ulta Beauty to leverage its capabilities to drive engagement with our most valuable customers.
This position will support the guest data steward for the customer master domain as well as data tied to the guest. This position will work closely with a cross-functional group to ensure data alignment as well as research and resolve Customer Data MDM (Master Data Management) issues and Guest Escalation issues.
CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Researches, tracks, communicates, escalates and resolves customer data quality issues using multiple platforms.
Performs adhoc customer master data requests.
Generate adhoc queries across tool set for research and resolution of issue, as well as for QA purposes.
Manage issues and communication across multiple ticketing/tracking platforms.
Helps monitor data quality measurements.
Works closely with the business users, technical teams and the Data Governance team to support adherence of customer principles and process standards.
Support the Data Steward in the creation of or updating documentation of business and data MDM requirements and executing acceptance testing for customer master domain projects and updates/enhancements.
Supports the Data Steward as needed in the development and maintenance of master data management policies, standards, and processes.
Working closely with other business users and IT, supporting the development and implementation of changes including issue resolution and planning for enhancements, upgrades including new data sources.
THE ESSENTIALS FOR SUCCESS:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Marketing / Business / IT / Math)
2-3 years work experience with data management in an environment with large, complex databases or customer master data management.
Knowledge of customer MDM rules and related customer attributes as well as the customer hierarchies.
MDM Informatica experience preferred.
Knowledge of best practices in data management i.e. defining and managing data and related processes.
Knowledge of relational database structures and ability to query relational databases using SQL.
Intermediate Microsoft Excel and report tools such as Tableau.
Knowledge of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools.
Knowledge of navigating issue management ticketing systems.
Exhibits strong analytic skills that bridge business and IT.
Understanding of capture, update, usage and other core business processes that influence the data lifecycle.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines while using analytical and problem solving capabilities.
Ability to define opportunities and problems, collect and analyze data, establish facts and make valid conclusions.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and program management skills.
Innovative, critical thinker capable of operating both in a strategic capacity (big-picture perspective, asks "why") and a hands-on/execution capacity (detail-oriented).
Strong sense of ownership, initiative, and urgency in addressing issues and following up.


COLORADO PAY RANGE

At this time, Colorado residents are not eligible for this position.

ABOUT
At Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ: ULTA), the possibilities are beautiful. Ulta Beauty is the largest North American beauty retailer and the premier beauty destination for cosmetics, fragrance, skin care products, hair care products and salon services. We bring possibilities to life through the power of beauty each and every day in our stores and online with more than 25,000 products from approximately 500 well-established and emerging beauty brands across all categories and price points, including Ulta Beauty’s own private label. Ulta Beauty also offers a full-service salon in every store featuring—hair, skin, brow, and make-up services.
We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest records, conviction records, or other criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act.

We're transforming the grocery industry

Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we've been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.

Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it's more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.
OVERVIEW

At Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers who deliver groceries and to the many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart's Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform.

We are looking for a Sr. Data Analyst of Data Operations to join the Media/Advertising Analytics team within the Brand Partnership Universe, that is fast growing and in the spotlight with focus to turn rich data into actionable insights. This team is responsible for serving some of the largest advertisers in the world by helping them better understand and improve the performance of their multi-million-dollar media budgets. This role interfaces across the organization and focuses on content ingestion, data quality, data governance, custom reporting, and enriching data. The Sr. Data Analyst will also work closely with Analytics and Product Management teams, in providing actionable insights and support for strategic initiatives. The scope involves both technically rigorous work, tapping into one of the largest pools of first-party data and 3rd party data in the grocery ecommerce space

 ABOUT THE JOB

Develop new frameworks to collect data including automated data collection
Assess/query large datasets to determine the relevant data needed
Collaborate with Data Warehouse and Engineering teams to manage relevant datasets within the Instacart data warehouse
Work closely with account managers and insights leads of various CPG/Brand portfolios to resolve data issues, troubleshooting and analysis, and bug fixes
Develop reports and presentations for various business stakeholders
Support project stakeholders in developing and reviewing business case submissions
Work with teams across Instacart on data enrichment and data quality

 ABOUT YOU

4+ years work experience in a quant role at a product company
Experience with programming languages such as Python
Familiarity with Database interface tools, SQL, and Programming concepts
Experience with Data mapping, Data architecture, Data integration, ETL, and working on large datasets deployed in a complex distributed environment
Relevant experience within the Retail space along with Snowflake is a plus
Eagerness to learn, flexibility to pivot when needed, savviness to navigate and thrive in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset needed to build a successful team and company
Bachelor's degree or equivalent

Overview
PDI helps convenience retailers and petroleum wholesalers thrive through digital transformation and enterprise software that enables them to grow topline revenue, optimize operations and unify their business across the entire value chain.
Over 1,500 customers in more than 200,000 locations worldwide count on our leading payments, marketing & insights cloud, ERP, logistics, fuel pricing, and security solutions to provide insights that increase volume, margin, and customer loyalty, all while connecting the digital ecosystem and protecting data. For more than 35 years, our comprehensive suite of solutions and unmatched expertise have helped customers reimagine their enterprise and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Backed by the investment of TA Associates, Genstar, and Insight Capital Partners, PDI is embarking upon an aggressive expansion strategy through internal investment in development as well as intensive M&A activity. The result will be a broader, more powerful, global company that serves customers across the entire supply chain.
Job Summary
The overarching responsibilities for this role are (i) own the relationship with various customers and be their go-to PDI Insights Cloud contact, (ii) understand and analyze clients’ data to provide valuable insights, and (iii) on-board new clients successfully and efficiently, including training on the Insights Cloud platform.
Responsibilities
Serve as lead Business Intelligence Analyst for a portfolio of retailer & Consumer Packaged Goods clients.
Help clients best utilize the Insights Cloud platform to answer key business questions.
Drive adoption and usage of the platform through client trainings, ongoing engagement with multiple contacts within an organization, effective communication, and relationship building.
Develop an expertise on each clients’ individual business needs and identify ways to create and deliver value-add analyses through the Insights Cloud platform and/or ad hoc projects.
Write SQL code to support ad-hoc requests or BI projects, as well as investigate explicit issues.
Create presentations delivering insights and actionable recommendations.
Oversee new client onboardings by working closely with both the client and the internal data operations and engineering teams.
Work with clients and with the help of internal teams to mitigate any potential concerns.
Using client feedback, work with the Product team to continuously develop and improve product offerings and the user experience.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
2-3 years of professional experience in an analytical and/or client-facing role, preferably in retail or CPG industry.
Proven superb written and oral communication skills.
Outstanding analytical skills and a passion for problem solving.
Advanced in SQL, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Phenomenal organizational skills and one who naturally thrives in a multi-tasking environment with the ability to effectively manage priorities with limited oversight.
Experience with customer relationship management is a plus.
High emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills
Strong team player with an opportunistic and self-starting mindset

Criminal Research Analyst

Requisition ID: 00126346

Organization: Sheriff's Department

Job Posting: Oct 15, 2021, 4:45:03 PM Closing Date: Oct 29, 2021, 11:59:00 PM
Full-time A.M. P.M.
Posting Salary: $53,095 - $57,507
Cook County
Sheriff

Job Code: 4112

Job Title: Criminal Research Analyst II

Grade: 18

Department: Sheriff’s Office Strategic Operations Center

 Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
In accordance with the Cook County Sheriff’s Office’s duty to provide and maintain a workplace reasonably free from known or recognized hazards, it adopts this mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to better safeguard the health of Sheriff’s Office members and their families, visitors who spend time in Sheriff’s Office facilities, and the community at large from the risks associated with COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2). This policy complies with applicable state and federal laws and is based on relevant public health guidance. Except for individuals granted an accommodation as required by law, the Cook County Sheriff’s Office requires full COVID-19 vaccination of all members, both existing and new, to provide and maintain a workplace reasonably free from known or recognized hazards.

Characteristics of the Position

General Overview

The Cook County Sheriff’s Office (CCSO) is seeking a full time Criminal Research Analyst. Working within the Sheriff’s Office Strategic Operations Center (SOC), the Criminal Research Analyst will perform detailed research and analysis of confidential criminal intelligence information, including developing links between criminals and criminal organizations through criminal information databases, social media, and other open source data repositories. The Criminal Research Analyst will utilize various techniques and procedures to understand and compile data, draft reports, and will be privy to confidential records. The Criminal Research Analyst will work with SOC staff to assist with projects as directed, will be responsible for performing specialized administrative work which may include a wide range of administrative duties, will assist in the coordination of various units or activities of the department, and must demonstrate a comprehensive knowledge of various aspects of support operations within SOC.

Key Responsibilities and Duties

Performs advanced, detailed research and analysis of confidential criminal intelligence information from a variety of sources, including field interview reports, intelligence sources, crime bulletins and other law enforcement agencies in order to study and analyze crime series, patterns and trends.

Collects, evaluates and tracks intelligence crime data, paying close attention to detail to identify patterns, similarities or unique occurrences in order to generate reports that support appropriate actions; attends meetings of law enforcement, Corrections and Courts personnel to share and receive information on crime series and trends, wanted suspects, major cases and new methodologies.

Facilitates the appropriate exchange of tactical and criminal intelligence information within the Cook County Sheriff’s Office and other law enforcement agencies.
Prepares case files for further investigation by investigators; analyzes and prepares case reports in compliance with established policies and procedures, including reviewing, editing and drafting concise summaries of criminal activity.

Utilizes intelligence and law enforcement databases, information systems, including geographic information systems and open source data repositories to conduct research and correlate information between databases.

Prepares a variety of reports, including crime information and bulletins, monthly and quarterly activity summaries, department annual reports and specific statistical/research reports, as needed.

Makes written and oral presentations utilizing maps, charts and graphs to inform Sheriff’s Office law enforcement personnel of emerging or existing crimes, patterns, trends and suspect and victim profiles.
Provides offender, victim and modus operandi pattern research to provide assistance to patrol and/or investigative units for an incident.

Creates profiles of known offenders/arrestees, researching past crimes through multiple databases or other available sources to establish a modus operandi; analyzes the modus operandi of known offenders and establishes timelines to perform suspect/crime correlation to provide leads and targets for surveillance or directed patrol.

Assists in the development and implementation of information strategies through the management, deployment and use of key information sources, including resource identification’s and data maintenance.
Responds in a timely manner to requests from the Cook County Sheriff’s Office management staff and other law enforcement agencies for assistance in criminal and administrative investigations and briefings.

Performs various administrative and clerical functions, including providing support for staff members, answering and managing telephone calls, sorting documentation, filing, assisting in verifying, organizing, typing and reviewing data and managing office supplies.

Performs highly specialized administrative and/or clerical work independently including the composition of letters, memoranda and reports; skill in planning, developing and completing complex assignments with minimal direction; accurate judgment in making decisions, reorganizing established precedents and in meeting new problems.

Handles a wide variety of complex administrative situations and conflicts within the department requiring discreet and authoritative intervention; oversees the operations of various interactive clerical and secretarial support units; functions as a key facilitator to ensure that critical administrative support is forthcoming in a timely and efficient manner.

Manages projects from conception to completion and generates status reports of all projects; performs backups on all computer data entered.
Ensures that all sensitive and restricted information and materials are handled with complete confidentiality and discretion.

Possesses a thorough working knowledge of or ability to quickly and effectively grasp and utilize the policies, protocols, systems, procedures, and technical vernacular of the agency, department and County, as they are applicable to assigned duties and responsibilities.

Maintains a high level of interactive communication with professional staff, supervisors and managers in order to properly assess the clerical, secretarial and administrative needs and urgencies of the department.

Utilizes standard keyboard to apply various computer or software application to assigned tasks and to process information, or may so direct others as required.
In the supervisor’s absence, ensures that requests for action or information are relayed to the appropriate staff member as needed; interprets requests and helps implement action; makes sure that information is furnished in timely manner; decides whether supervisor should be notified of important or emergency matters.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Requires knowledge and skill in the use of law enforcement databases, techniques of procedural analysis, criminal investigation analysis, and criminal case organization.
Knowledge of software applications, with the ability to create, edit and analyze data; ability to collect, analyze and evaluate evidence, statistics and other information to draw logical conclusions.

Advanced proficiency in the use of Microsoft Word and Excel, ability to prepare graphs, charts, tables and other illustrative documents.
Excellent report writing skills.

Knowledge of statistical analysis.

Good attention to multifarious detail, ability to proof, verify and edit complex data, transcribe and cross reference data from personal computer and documents; ability to follow-up in a thorough and timely manner relative to unresolved business.

A high level of skill and proficiency in maintaining detailed work related records.

Skill in interacting with others to investigate, gather and review confidential materials, information and incidents of record.

Ability to exercise sound judgment and to make sound decisions and carry out programs affecting one’s own work and the work of others in a changing work environment.

Skill and knowledge, as may be pertinent to the area of assignment, in connection with correct technical, legal and other language usage, punctuation and grammar, and their proper application to business forms, letters and records.

Skill and accuracy in the control, organization and maintenance of files and records according to various methods.

Excellent communication skills; ability to exercise diplomacy, gather information from others and make inquiries; ability to get along well with others.

Skill in the application of complex instructions, written and verbal; ability to accurately relate such instructions in full or part to other staff.

Ability to coordinate several tasks at one time and perform well under pressure; ability to fill in for and perform the duties of other unit support staff as needed; ability to relieve management of certain administrative functions.

Ability to understand and follow through on oral and written instructions.

Maintain a professional appearance and attitude at all times.

Possesses the ability to remain composed at all times for the purpose of gathering and dispatching information accurately and efficiently.

Ability to sit for extended periods of time working at a computer terminal.

Ability to work any shift assigned, including days, afternoons or midnights; capable of working Holidays and weekends; capable of working an additional eight (8) hours of mandatory overtime, as required.

Ability to travel to work assignments by providing own means of transportation.
Minimum Qualifications

Possession of a High School Diploma or General Education Development (G.E.D) test certificate.

Possession of a Bachelor’s or higher degree, from an accredited college or university, in Criminal Justice, Justice Studies, Public Administration, Political Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Predictive Analytics or a related field.

Three (3) or more years of related work experience, within a Criminal Justice, Public Administration, Research Analysis, and/or a related field, obtained within the last four (4) years.

Advanced proficiency and/or certification in one (1) or more of the following: Intelligence Analyst Notebook, Accurint, Thompson Ruters Clear, Arc Map, CPD Clear or LEADS 2000.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

Possession of a Law Enforcement Agencies Data System LEADS certification or the ability to receive it within sixty (60) days of hire.
Typing skills (35 w.p.m. with 90% accuracy) and familiarity with computer keyboards and data inputting.
 Ability to work any shift assigned, including days, afternoons or midnights; must be capable of working Holidays and weekends; must be capable of working an additional eight (8) hours of mandatory overtime, as required.

Must successfully pass background investigation(s) with results showing no past criminal record of conviction for a felony or misdemeanor.

Preferred Qualifications

Extensive operating knowledge of Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) applications.

Proficiency in Microsoft Publisher, PowerPoint, Outlook and social networking internet sites.

Experience in develops statistical data resources to assist in proactive and targeted investigations; develops and implements new strategies to assist in combating criminal activity.

** Skill Assessment will be administered for proficient in Microsoft Office and related job requirements**

Data Management Analyst-ACT0000OQ
Description


Job Summary

The Actuarial Data Management team works collaboratively with our internal customers to deliver in all aspects of data, reporting, and analytics. Under broad supervision deploys table changes and/or engages in data analysis and processing activities associated with financial actuarial and corporate processing/reporting applications. Supports corporate standards and coding structures in accordance with CNA's products and services external (statutory regulatory and financial [GAAP]) and internal reporting requirements. Engages in control activities to ensure data quality and adherence to enterprise data policy.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Executes approved changes to finance actuarial and/or corporate application table values.
Ensures data integrity by executing controls and requisite processes around the flow of data.
Works with technical staff and subject matter advisors to understand business issues troubleshoot problems and participate in the development of cost-effective data solutions.
Verifies accuracy of table changes and the results of data transformation processes. Participates in testing of changes prior to deployment as appropriate.
Maintains tables which support data transformation processes within and between applications.
Utilizes technology to analyze data and/or metrics from applicable systems to review data processes research issues and escalate problems that require data system or process improvements.
Participates in data-related projects using data visualization tools and technology with supervision.
Reporting Relationship

Reports to Supervisor or above.
Skills Knowledge and Abilities
1. Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
2. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with project teams.
3. Ability to produce in a fast-paced dynamic workforce.
4. Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
5. Willing to learn new system applications/functions with assistance.
6. Readily adapts to change.
7. Experience using analytical tools such as Qlikview, Tableau or SQL preferred, but not required

RAY • ALLEN is looking for a detail-oriented, creative problem solver for our full-time Business Intelligence Analyst I position. Through effective, accurate, and efficient interpretation of data, you will improve the company’s overall business acumen.
You are someone who is eager to learn and seeks out new challenges. You have a knack for problem-solving and consider yourself a creative, curious, and out-of-the-box thinker. Create dashboards, stories, and processes primarily using Qlik Sense

Gather and build requirements documents and task out projects

Interact with and proactively communicate with teams regarding issues and new ideas
Support tools and processes for data analysis and reporting
Document standards and procedures when creating reports

Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., nested logical and lookup functions, pivot tables, macros)
Beginner to Intermediate SQL skills

Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills with open-ended problems

Very detail-oriented and highly organized
Knowledge of data modeling

Leadership and/or Project Management skills a plus

positionName: HIM Coord Systems Analyst (Part Time Evenings & Weekends)
company: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital
description:
Overview:

Monitors and coordinates all activities across the enterprise that relates to the integrity of the patient record and of the Enterprise Master Patient Index (EMPI). Ensures the quality of the data in the health record by auditing, compiling, analyzing and reporting findings. Exceeds patient and staff expectations by achieving and maintaining leadership in quality service through communication and teamwork. Work reflects dedication, knowledge, accuracy and consideration for the privacy of the patients we serve.
Responsibilities:
Accounts for the daily monitoring, maintenance and integrity of the Enterprise Master Patient Index data base (EMPI), following all health data best practices for data integrity.
Leads the EMPI integrity process by monitoring best practices, analyzing, evaluating and implementing electronic medical record tools. Performs merges, contact moves and other related processes to ensure record integrity for our patient’s safety.
Analyzes reports of data duplicates, data integrity issues, documentation errors and other system errors to provide ongoing appropriate communication and daily or weekly data reports to system users: internal and external.
Accounts for the daily monitoring, guidance and technical support of interface error status and performs corrective actions on the interface related to scanning and transcription.
Performs quality checks of data – reviews, corrects and analyzes data of EMPI activity, deficiency analysis, and delinquency processes ensuring that documentation is completed following Joint Commission, CMS and IDPH standards and requirements. Reports finding respectively to hospital managers and the Chief Medical Office and helps operational leaders in developing and implementing action plans.
Reviews higher record review for accuracy, compliance and completeness before sending for review to external parties, work with Compliance, Risk, Finance and the Clinicians to resolve issues prior to release.
Provides technical guidance, user training and serves as primary resolution point to internal and external end-users for issues related to system functionality and all process related questions and issues as they relate to the integration, documentation and management of patient data.
Maintains full knowledge and understanding of Epic functionality and HIM applications as it relates to all implemented applications and future implementations. This includes assisting in developing and testing of upgrades of any new system functionality, and review of Release Notes with consideration for future impacts to the record, EMPI integrity and workflows.
Stays up-to date with changing documentation and privacy standards and ensures the appropriate dissemination and communication of all regulations, policy, and guideline changes to affected staff personnel.
Conducts tracer reviews assessing compliance with documentation, HIM, IM, Privacy, and security standards. Has a breath of knowledge of all standard’s so the he/she can serve as backup for communication and education for other team members during tracers.
Serves as a resource to the clinicians to assure that all documentation procedures are consistent with established protocols and applicable regulations and requirements, reports deficiencies weekly and to the HIM Committee, Accreditation Readiness Team and the Physician Advisory Council as applicable.
12. Works with the Accreditation Readiness Team and the HIM committee to develop recommendations and action plans fo resolution of areas of non-compliance. Reports to the Physician Advisory Committee and he Chief Medical Officer as appropriate.
13. Runs and analyzes privacy reports to identify patient data breeches. Works with the manager and/or Human Resources to report findings. Reports aggregate findings to HIM Committee and the HIPAA Task Force.
14.Supports and facilitates HIM Committee meetings, prepares agenda, meeting materials, minutes, and communication follow-up. Adheres to HIPAA regulations for security and confidentiality.
15.Performs job functions adhering to service principles with customer service focus of innovation, service excellence and teamwork to provide the highest quality care and service to our patients, families, co-workers and others.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Health Information Management, Information Technology, Health Care or related field required.
A minimum of two years of related experience preferred.
Requires in-depth knowledge and understanding of complex medical record management concepts and data integrity. Knowledge of health information standards and regulations.
Analytical thinking for effective problem determination and resolution.
Ability to work independently, make decisions under pressure, while providing timely and responsive services.
Skills in managing, collecting, interpreting, and analyzing the quality and integrity of healthcare data.
Ability to articulate facts and ideas clearly and concisely.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. Excellent analytical and written communication skills.
Must work as an effective team member.
Ability to maintain high level of integrity and confidentiality relating to employee/patient and hospital information.

Summary of Position: The Data Specialist is responsible for report writing and database development and administration. The primary function is to ensure that all levels of the agency have the data collection/maintenance tools, and the reporting, to perform their functions in accordance with agency best practices.
Specific Duties:
Reporting
Produce monthly, quarterly, and yearly reports. Provide in-depth data analysis, data summarization, and data visualization. Document and standardize procedures for providing information to requesting entities.
Work with management staff to respond to ad hoc reporting requests. Evaluate requirements, build queries, check data, deploy reports. Document data report requirements.
In consultation with senior management, create agency dashboards for both internal and external use, synthesizing data from all agency sources.
Evaluate current systems for report delivery (Teams, Outlook, etc.) and determine the best platforms for management, staff, board, and outside entities.
Administer agency Data Quality analysis and report issues to managers and directors.
Collaborate with Program Directors on the proper use and development of operating procedures regarding data for their staff.

Database Administration and Development
Use internal and external data to create, update, and maintain databases. Recommend procedures for the collection and coding of new and/or existing data elements.
Maintain proprietary internal databases, including Drop-In Log, Internal Referral System, Outcomes databases, etc.

positionName: Senior Data Analyst, Customer Engagement & Retention
description:
GoHealth is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join its Customer Engagement & Retention department. You will play an integral role in our quickly-growing Analytics Team by providing leadership with data-driven insights that drive strategic decision-making and maximize company value. Using real-time reporting, forecasting, and advanced analytics, you will be responding in real-time to the needs of the business. Day-to-day responsibilities include supporting both the analytical and reporting needs of a key team within the department, as well as the progress of other analysts on the team. Due to the dynamic nature of the department, we seek an entrepreneurial candidate with a desire to hit the ground running and derive analytical insights from a variety of business contexts.

Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. GoHealth encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. No one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application.

Responsibilities:
Develop, build, and own relationships with key stakeholders; ensure your efforts and projects align with the needs of the company
Partner with functional leads and analysts to understand business objectives, data and reporting requirements; translate these efforts into KPIs
Build out data pipelines and utilize data visualization best practices to develop reliable, automated dashboards to monitor those KPIs
Lead key analytical projects and processes to deliver actionable insights and recommendations for enhancing products, growing audiences and maximizing revenues across Customer Engagement
Proactively identify areas of opportunity and/or improvements based on trends in the data; use these insights to inform new products and/or operational improvements
Review accuracy of all data, results and conclusions of team, coaching team members to reach a high standard of analytical rigor while maintaining digestibility
Continually think of new ways to improve and/or optimize available reports in company's reporting repository

Skills and Experience:

BS/ BA degree or equivalent professional work experience required
4+ years of experience guiding strategic decision-making in a business context through a combination of descriptive and diagnostic analytics
Proven ability to transform raw data into dashboards and visualizations within Tableau that are dynamic, intuitive, and easily interpretable for a range of user types
Solid understanding of data pipelines, ETL, and other data connection concepts
Expert in manipulation and accurate analysis of complex, high volume, high dimensionality data from various sources
Desire to join a growing company tasked with bringing change to the healthcare market
Passion for problem-solving and desire to get your hands dirty in data

Benefits & Perks:

Open vacation policy
401k program with company match
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits
Flexible spending accounts
Commuter and transit benefits
Professional growth opportunities
Casual dress code
Generous employee referral bonuses
Happy hours, ping-pong tournaments, and more company-sponsored events
Subsidized gym memberships
GoHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer

About the Role
As a Business Analyst in Customer Support, you will support Uber’s Community Operations team through in-depth data analysis and insights that drive increased efficiency and improved customer experience. You’ll work independently and in partnership with senior leaders to create impactful plans from large sets of dynamic data.
What You'll Do

Perform weekly and ad hoc data analysis to keep the nerve center of our operations engine running at full speed
Utilize various data analysis platforms to critically evaluate complex information from multiple sources; synthesize findings into digestible and meaningful content for senior decision makers
Create, maintain, and continually optimize dashboards as well as weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting
Push analysis on projects/experiments and use insights to inform strategic decisions that improve the support experience for customers and partners
Become a subject matter expert on assigned projects and customer support verticals
Basic Qualifications

2+ years of work experience in business intelligence, analytics, strategy, or a related field

Ability to self-serve, investigate, and tell meaningful stories from large datasets

About the Team
This role is part of the Business Operations & Support team that sits within the US & Canada Field Operations team, including both Greenlight Hubs and Centers of Excellence. Greenlight Hubs are a network of 37 in-person centers that serve drivers across the US and Canada. The Centers of Excellence (COEs) are contact management centers dedicated to providing world-class customer support for our community’s toughest issues types, as well as incubating support modalities and processes for new products and services.

Overview:

Who we are
Eicoff is a Chicago-based, full-service advertising agency, integrating the disciplines of media, analytics and creative into innovative TV, video and audio solutions for our clients. We believe in giving our team members the freedom to develop their careers as they see fit, the encouragement to implement new ideas, access to both big, established clients and cutting-edge startups, and a commitment to the belief that we all do better work when work isn’t all we do.
What we’re looking for
Motivated individuals who like to identify and solve problems. Working across all departments and teams to collaborate on projects that create improved processes, efficiencies and value through analytical thinking.
Analysts are part mathematician, part creative thinker, and part resident expert who provide performance insights and media research in support of the buying and planning of Direct Response Advertising for Eicoff’s clients.
We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our Operations team.

What you’ll do

Wrangling unstructured data for more sophisticated analysis or downstream applications.
Quality Assurance for data sets and general ETL.
Uncovering insights and presenting information when necessary.

Strong Excel skills (sorting/cleaning data, pivot tables, graphs, vlookups).
Additional desirable skills include database programming (SQL/MySQL), statistics background, Tableau or other dashboard software, and Google Analytics.
Ability to present and explain technical material to a non-technical audience.
What we offer

Outstanding benefits including 401k matching and access to family support services, such as behavior and emotional support programs, childcare services, domestic partner insurance coverage
A beautiful new office within the WPP campus at 333 N. Green, in the heart of the Fulton Market District
Access to WPP and Ogilvy’s extensive Learning & Development opportunities
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
We recognize the power of a workplace that reflects the richness of the world around us. We believe diversity makes us healthier as individuals and as an organization, sparks creativity and innovation, and attracts superior talent.
We will understand the power of diversity by committing to reflection, education and dialogue. We will unleash the power of diversity through our hiring practices, our ideas, our vendor and partner selections, our cultural initiatives.
We will hold ourselves and one another accountable, at every level, at every step along the way.

Data Analyst, Epidemiology (Job Number: 210002O2)
Description

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.
 The Office of Student Health and Wellness (OSHW) aims to eliminate health-related barriers to learning and promote health equity. OSHW is seeking an epidemiologist to support ensuring health and wellness initiatives are data driven and effective. They will be responsible for analyzing data under supervision in collaboration with content leads in OSHW to support decision making on program implementation and priorities.

The Data Analyst, Epidemiology will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:
 Typical Duties/Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports for health related priorities.
Monitor and assess disease risk in CPS populations.
Support data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality including surveys and data management systems.
Analyzes student health data to track the cause, effect, and course of epidemics (e.g., prevalence,incidence, time trends, risk factors on various populations)
Uses various software programs (e.g., SAS) to generate complex data summaries, tables, charts, and graphic displays or to perform difficult manipulation of data
Researches epidemiological and peer-reviewed literature to obtain information for inclusion in reports and studies recommending methods for promoting health equity in the student population.
Develops and implements procedures for ensuring data quality and modifies databases used to document research
Evaluates health promotion programs and recommends program changes to improve student health and wellness and academic achievement.
Works with internal departments and city departments to collaborate on data and evaluation projects.
Identifies, applies and advises for relevant grants.
Responds to requests for epidemiological data as required.
Other duties as assigned.
In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Job Title must possess the following qualifications:
 Type of Education Required:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Statistics, Mathematics, or other directly related field
Master's degree in Public Health, Statistics, Mathematics, or a directly related field preferred
Type of Experience Required:
Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience; 1 year of relevant work experience with a Master’s degree in epidemiological data analysis and/or relevant statistical analysis work.
 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of statistical computer software packages and applications.
Knowledge of epidemiological research and analytical practices and procedures
Knowledge of applicable federal, state and local laws, regulations and guidelines that impact health in education.
Knowledge of public health trends that impact student achievement.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing with a wide range of stakeholders.
Ability to use a range of technology and tools, including but not limited to InDesign, SAS, Microsoft Office, and Google.
Ability to work independently as well as to function effectively and collaboratively in a team environment with attention to detail.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to effectively multi-task.
Understand the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making and the ability to communicate findings.
Demonstrate reliability, responsibility, and dependability and fulfill obligations
Residency Requirement:
As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and must maintain residency throughout their employment with the district.

Company Description
About Digitas
Digitas is the Connected Marketing agency, built on the principle that there are better ways for brands to connect with people. We leverage comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities to deliver Media-Fueled Creativity via connected Solutions that include Connected Campaigns, Social Marketing, Brand Experience, CRM & Loyalty, and Marketing Transformation. A Leader in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Global Marketing Agencies for six consecutive years, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 4,000 employees across over 30 countries and 50 offices. For more information visit www.digitas.com.

Job Description
Senior Analyst – Data & Analysis
We are the connected marketing agency, a full-service agency with modern creative & media, data, and technology services all under one roof. We are connected in the way we think and the way we work. At the heart of our company are great people that we call Unicorns. Our Unicorns are open, bold, and curious and love to solve complex problems for clients in unique ways
The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.
To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.
What you’ll do:
As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.
Day-to-day, your role includes:
Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clients
Connecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requests
Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals

Qualifications
We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:
3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategy
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.
Digitas is an equal opportunity employer.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

At SMS Assist, we’re not just in the business of fixing properties—we’re fixing an entire industry. Typically, facilities maintenance is tough work—both in the nature of the job (plumbing, HVAC, snow removal) and the lack of clarity throughout the experience. We decided a better way wasn’t only possible, but essential. Through our award-winning technology platform, built and powered by SMSers, we connect local contractors to our customers and help manage an experience that surpasses expectations.
Recognized on Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500, Chicago Crain’s Top Tech Employers, and more, SMS Assist manages more than 186,000 properties where people live and work. Our customers’ livelihoods are in our hands—think a restaurant manager whose only fryer goes down on a busy Friday night or a family in Florida without power after a hurricane. We work across the industries that make up your community, including retail, food service, banking, residential, and more, and we help them find the right provider in our network (we call them Affiliates) in more than 45 trades.
We’re innovators, disruptors, and out-of-the-box thinkers. We set each other up for success in the office and for the perfect spike on the volleyball court during an intramural game. MBA, MS or MIS a plus
Background preferably in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or related discipline
Tableau desktop certification a plus
Experience in Facilities or Supply Chain a plus
Industry trade knowledge : HVAC, electrical, plumbing, gen. maintenance, etc
Experience related to strategy, analytics, implementation, or operations experience
Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities, and schedule may change at any time with or without notice.
SMS Assist is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reasons prohibited by law.

Partners with clients to design, develop, implement and maintain business solutions regarding data management, analysis. This includes database administration, data consolidation, data analysis and management reporting. Utilizes software to generate metrics and develops actionable recommendations. Collaborates with various function teams such as marketing, research, and IT to achieve business results.
The Research Analytics unit is a newly-created resource within the Office for Research (OR), designed to serve and collaborate with other OR units to support their analytics and reporting needs.
The Senior Research Data Analyst will work closely with the Director of Research Analytics, to respond to stakeholder needs by gathering requirements and translating them into reports, visualizations, and dashboards that fulfill project requirements. The position will work with institutional data from a variety of sources, including but not limited to research IT systems, finance, human resources, facilities, bibliometrics, and publicly available data sets. The position will advise Research Information Technology on database and technical needs for reporting and analytics projects.
The creation of deliverables for this position will rely upon expertise with and utilization of data visualization software, primarily the Tableau software suite. The Senior Research Data Analyst will be required to create data visualizations and analytics within the software, including the design and maintenance of user-facing dashboards for publishing to the web along with all appropriate data security measures. The Senior Research Data Analyst will be expected to bring creativity to collaborations with the Designer in the Research Analytics unit to ensure dashboards are user-friendly, create design templates that reflect University branding standards, and comply with best practices in user experience and user interface design.
The Senior Research Data Analyst will be tasked with both creating new resources for analytics and reporting, as well as maintenance and refinement of these resources to ensure they continue to meet the needs of end user stakeholders.
The Senior Research Data Analyst will support the OR mission and values by exhibiting the following: understand empathy, model accountability, ensure fairness, embrace community and value creativity. The incumbent will strive to provide excellent service when performing job responsibilities.
Specific Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning
Manages and plans for data/analysis requests and projects.
Provides consultation to customers on appropriate data management, methodological issues and statistical analyses.
Collaborates with technical staff explaining needs of functional users. Serve on committees related to data structure and governance.
Administration
Reviews reports before presentation to ensure quality and accuracy.
Develops and maintains documentation of process for quality assurance and reporting methodology
Defines, develops and communicates new standards and best practices.
Development
Develops queries and quality metrics.
Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex statistical analysis.
Determines data structure for local datasets.
Performance
Develops and documents standards for data quality and regulatory compliance pertaining to reporting.
Ensures quality and compliance by reviewing reports
Supervises
Manages projects ensuring timelines and deliverables are met and meet expectations.
Miscellaneous
Performs other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications:
Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree; OR appropriate combination of education and experience.
4 years data analysis/report writing or similar experience required.
Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities)
Demonstrated knowledge and familiarity with Tableau software (Desktop, Prep Builder, Server).
Ability to use and understand data from a variety of sources with an emphasis on data accuracy and integrity.
Ability to quickly learn new data-sets and data management systems.
Ability to quickly produce analyses, ranging from simple to complex, sometimes constrained by time.
Familiarity with and ability to use the latest data visualization technologies and preparation of presentations for diverse audiences.
Ability to work with sensitive information, often of a confidential nature.
Ability to maintain a collaborative relationship with a diverse body of stakeholders and work together to find solutions to challenges.
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters or professional degree OR appropriate combination of education and experience.
Work experience in a university research environment.
Experience with graphical design and best practices for user experience/user interface design.
Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities)
Advanced Tableau skills, specifically those related to data access and filtering based on user roles.
Knowledge of institutional data sets in a university research environment.
Familiarity with Northwestern enterprise data and reporting systems including but not limited to Cognos, InfoEd, eIRB+, LUMEN, Facilities Connect, Northwestern Scholars, PeopleSoft.
Knowledge of external databases and data sets related to the higher education research enterprise, including but not limited to InCites, Academic Analytics, federal databases, and similar.
The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.

AHEAD builds platforms for digital business. By weaving together advances in cloud infrastructure, automation and analytics, and software delivery, we help enterprises deliver on the promise of digital transformation.
AHEAD is seeking a Data Analyst to join our internal IT Business Solutions team at our Chicago headquarters. This position contributes to the successful delivery of software solutions that enable AHEAD employees to track and process business information while providing exceptional service to clients.
The data analyst is responsible for a deep understanding of database fields and mappings across a variety of company applications, including a highly customized Salesforce ERP environment. A typical day will include working closely with internal and external stakeholders to interpret new data integration and transformation needs. This individual in this role will produce data and automated workflow specifications with acceptance criteria for custom API applications to be built in MuleSoft. Frequent interaction with the application development team will be required to assure quality deliverables.
Reporting directly to our Lead Business Analyst, the ideal candidate must be a professional, collaborative team player who is comfortable working with people at all levels of the organization and able to follow complex business processes. Applicants should possess exceptional analytical, communication, follow up and customer service skills along with an understanding of Agile team practices.
Responsibilities
Facilitate discussions with key business stakeholders, elicit data integration, transformation, and report requirements
Develop detailed data specifications and templates in the form of user stories with testable acceptance criteria
Ensure that prioritized user stories are fully documented and approved by stakeholders in advance of bi-weekly sprint planning meetings
Ensure that user stories are clearly understood by the development team
Collaborate with the development team by running acceptance tests and providing quality assurance feedback
Assist in the documentation of final deliverables and system integrations
Present stakeholders with final product, as required
Participate in with sprint backlog planning and product backlog refinement as needed
Qualifications
Demonstrated experience eliciting and documenting data requirements for custom APIs
4+ years of professional experience as a data, business, or report analyst in an ERP environment
Detail-oriented and analytical with excellent oral and written communication skills
Proficiency with diagramming software such as Visio or Lucid Chart
Familiarity with Agile practice and Scrum framework
Work experience at a technology reseller or professional services firm preferred
Education
Bachelor’s Degree
CAP, IIBA-CBAP or PMI-PBA certifications a plus
Why Ahead?
Transparent management
Work alongside and collaborate with industry experts
Investment in training & development
Incentives for certifications
Ability to make an immediate impact
Unlimited PTO
Outstanding lab

positionName: SENIOR ANALYST - WORLD OF HYATT FINANCIAL DATA
description:
Summary
Hyatt is seeking a World of Hyatt Financial Data Sr. Analyst. The successful candidate for this position will demonstrate strong critical-thinking skills, excellent communication skills, and a high level of initiative and resourcefulness while producing high quality work in a fast-paced environment. It is critical this person can understand complex business processes related to the financial management of the loyalty program. This position will assist all colleagues working on Hyatt’s loyalty program with budgeting and forecasting programs revenues and expenses. They will work closely with other finance and loyalty operating groups to bring together a holistic view of the health of the financial operations of the program.
Responsibilities
Responsible for the accurate budgeting and forecasting of program’s revenues and expenses
Provide monthly quantitative and qualitative updates on key financial metrics. Including variance analysis of revenue, expenses, point issuances, revenue per point, cost per point etc.
Monthly monitoring of program financial operation metrics including retro requests, transaction processing, manual processes etc. with the goal of reducing cost associated with these items
Assist the loyalty team in making business cases for program initiatives. Including defining the financial structure and impact of new initiatives
Identify opportunities to optimize financial processes
Qualifications
Experience
Three or more years’ experience in financial analysis, related field, or course work
Education
Bachelor’s degree required
Computer Skills Needed to Perform this Job
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, Intermediate skills for other Microsoft Office applications required
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to produce actionable recommendations
Experience with data mining a plus

Additional Comments and Requirements
Strong project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities
Excellent communication skills including writing and presentations
Ability to collaborate across a highly matrixed organization
Creative/innovative approach to problem solving
Previous hospitality experience in a finance or accounting role a plus

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
Analyst, Data Management and Delivery

JLL, an international real estate management company, is seeking an analyst to join our Data Management team in JLL Technologies organization. We are seeking candidates that are self-starters who can work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our team immediately.

Key Responsibilities
Develops, executes and monitors simple to moderately complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.
Assists in the development and maintenance of production data management, data integration and reporting processes.
Tests and monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.
Manages the identification, prioritization and remediation of data quality issues.
Engages with colleagues and internal customers to understand business requirements, and to support the accurate business usage and interpretation of JLL data.
Develops documentation and data flow diagrams to maintain accurate metadata and data lineage.
Participates in the design and development of technical solutions to ensure that business requirements are satisfied.
Performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships in new data sources.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in science, business, or social science. Advance degree and/or 1-3 years of experience in the fields of information science, computer science or analytics preferred.
Knowledge of standard analytical, reporting and programming languages and their application (such as SQL, Python, PySpark, Spark, Databricks, etc.)
Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyze data to develop actionable business information deliverables.
Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.
Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual with can-do attitude, capable of executing on multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.
Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.

What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

When you join Darwin, you're joining a team with 30+ years of experience working in ad tech and management consulting who's eager to share that experience with those eager to learn. You're joining a team using advanced AI to pioneer the advertising methodologies of tomorrow, supported by experts who are the best and brightest in the industry.You're also joining the Darwin family. You will also work with a team of designers, use data to identify new creative opportunities for clients, and provide feedback on new creative to ensure it meets client branding standards and Darwin creative standards.At the end of the day, you’ll be the primary driving force behind our client’s social marketing strategies. You’re comfortable managing multiple clients and competing priorities. You're competitive - you love the thrill of winning and hate to lose.You enjoy working collaboratively with our clients to test new ideas or creatives and are excited by the adtech space.
