Bonus points for experience analysing and critiquing creative outputExcited by the opportunity to work with clients, preferably with prior client services experienceInterest in optimization methods and techniques in digital and social advertisingBased in or around Chicago and able to commute to the Loop routinely once safe to do soJob Type:  Full-timePay:  $45,000 base salary per year + profit sharing based on client performance (estimated up to $15,000 per year, uncapped)Darwin provided remote work tools:  Computer (PC or Mac), second monitor, keyboard, mouse, and any needed office supplies needed will be provided by Darwin for your useFor the health and safety of our team, Darwin AI will be working remotely until it is safe to return to the office.Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $45,000.00 - $60,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:We are allowing employees to work from home during Covid-19. Employees should use their own judgement when sick if they shouldn't come to the office and work from home instead. Darwin provides face masks, hand sanitizer and disinfectant wipes.Ability to commute/relocate:Chicago, IL 60606: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Experience:Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19Work Location: One location

Job Details
Description
JOB SUMMARY

The role of the Data Analyst is to support management decision-making processes through the provision of data and analyst regarding the proposal’s products and services, subsidiaries, joint ventures, and partnerships. The role includes utilizing various decision support databases including the data repository/data warehouse to obtain necessary data; active participation in the databases; and significant involvement in the development of cost of services. The analyst will also work alongside leadership for continually updating and managing the financial plan and will record all revenues, receivables, submissions, and the development of the annual operating and budgets for the subsidiaries, partnerships and joint community ventures, as needed; assisting in the accounting department through the provision of various reports identifying discounts, denials, free care or other receivables issues; as well as other projects assigned.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Essential Functions

Assist with high-level financial analysis for financial support: decisions regarding growth or contraction of existing services; the development of new products and services; and profitability of joint ventures, partnerships, and contractual arrangements. This includes utilizing system, data repository and other systems to report on department, program, product or service historical financial performance and utilization; gather external data as required to assist with the analysis; utilizing financial models to estimate future performance or outcome based on a set of assumptions (including estimates for covered lives and assumptions from the 4.5 proposal financial plan); and measuring expected financial performance through the computation of rate of return.
Responsible for the development of fully allocated fixed and variable costs for all proposal services on a timely basis, in accordance with established deadlines. This involves: obtaining all data and supporting documentation to feed into the cost accounting model; working with and updating the complex, macro-driven PC-based cost and overhead allocation models to compute both budgeted and actual costs for each major product line classification. Working with management to update the fixed and variable cost percentages as necessary; reconciling the total computed costs to financial statements; and managing the cost model update process with any outside community partners.
Primary function is to develop and extract data through the utilization and creation of reports that report routine database; loading of cost factors; and appropriate table/queries; payment formulas; and reconciling revenues to the proposal’s associated financial statements.
Compute and record estimates for contractual allowances on revenues as well as determine and record the net collectable valuation of accounts receivables. Responsible for making appropriate adjustments to the general ledger to record bad debts, contractual allowances and appropriate evaluation for each branch of reporting within the proposal.
Provide daily and monthly reports reflecting the detail behind the denials, free care, discounts and other allowances to better assist with further analysis and follow-up on those issues. Will assume primary responsibility for being the person to provide detail behind monthly reports for accounts receivables, including analysis of changes within the proposal’s associated goals. Reporting and analysis of all account transfers on month to month basis.
Complete surveys, data requests, and other projects as needed and appropriate
Maintain working knowledge of all database programs utilized for the decision support system.
Maintain working knowledge of healthcare reimbursement policies and procedures, including knowledge of managed care contract terms.
Develop analysis and reporting capabilities alongside community leadership members.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency, and quality. Acquire data from all data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs and locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Demonstrates a commitment to the mission of Swedish Hospital and demonstrates a service orientation and adheres to all responsibilities and standards of the organization.

QUALIFICATION/BASIC JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education: Bachelor’s Degree or 5+ Years’ Experience
Certification: N/A

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION

N/A

INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL CONTACTS

Existing relationships with local community organizations a plus

ENVIRONMENT.

Sitting and works an computer more than 90% of the time.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

positionName: Senior Data Analyst - Digital Customer Experience - Discovery and Personalization
description:
Job Description
**This role is with our team in Chicago, however, if you live in a hub location that include Denver, Seattle, Los Angeles or Atlanta you may work remotely. If you live outside of these areas, you would need to relocate to Chicago** Nordstrom is a specialty retailer offering the very best in fashion and customer service since 1901. We live by five simple values that guide how we work together day to day and how we deliver results: we are customer-obsessed, we are owners at heart, we are curious and ever-changing, we extend ourselves to our peers and our customers, and we’re here to win! Digital Customer Experience Discovery and Personalization is a growing, multidisciplinary team within a larger analytical sciences organization that thrives on collaboration and community. We use the power of data and AI to enrich the customer product discovery experience; improve and accelerate decision making; and bring Nordstrom’s fashion authority into the digital space. We are committed to building teams that reflect the diversity of our customers, and active inclusion is core to how Nordstrom wins. We’re an equal opportunity employer and encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. The Analytical Sciences organization at Nordstrom seeks self-starters and strong technical contributors who love to find new solutions to business problems using data. Position Summary As an integral part of our Discovery and Personalization team, the Senior Data Analyst is responsible for the analysis, development, and presentation of insights in support of improved decision making across the organization. The ideal candidate can think strategically about the needs of the business, build productive relationships with a diverse array of stakeholders, and possesses the skills to unlock rich, nuanced insights from complex data sources. A day in the life… Partner with key stakeholders to define success and develop measurement frameworks Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital feature and AI model performance Collaborate with team members and business partners to deliver high quality solutions and recommendations to a variety of problems across the digital domain Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise You own this if you have… 5+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations. 5+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL 5+ years of applied data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, ggplot). Strong coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language to import, summarize, and analyze data. Experience with statistical and machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, classification and/or clustering). Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills. Bachelor of Science or equivalent experience preferred. This range may vary for candidates hired to work in locations other than Colorado. Minimum = $94,300/annually Maximum = $155,700/annually
We’ve got you covered…
Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
A few more important points...
The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.
Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.
Nordstrom Careers Privacy Policy: https://careers.nordstrom.com/#/contact-us/privacy
© 2021 Nordstrom, Inc.

CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We’re small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .
Lead Data Licensing Quality Assurance and Business Analyst
The Lead Data Platform Analyst will be at the heart of CME’s Data Services business, helping drive growth and innovation while maintaining quality in the functional areas of data customer onboarding, data licensing, and data billing technology across CME Group’s diverse suite of data products. This unique, quality-focused role is responsible for business/technical requirements gathering and consensus building, as well as development and execution of comprehensive user acceptance strategies as they relate to new data offerings and updates to existing CME Data policies designed to stimulate data revenue and data user growth globally.
The successful candidate will drive all analysis and planning efforts related to data related enhancements and innovation. This includes building strong relationships with key stakeholders to help understand high-level business requirements, then translate and presentation them as workable technical requirements for approval and development. Projects include the development of new and enhanced licensing/onboarding capabilities for CME Group data customers through the Data Service Platform, broadening of CME Group’s data billing capabilities, and building out next-generation data entitlement, reference data, and usage reporting models.
Ideally the candidate is a high-performing, multi-talented individual located in Chicago or New York, who can make immediate contributions towards enhancing our data licensing platform for 2021 and beyond. This position requires a thorough understanding of data licensing concepts and the global data industry, in general. The candidate shall be expected to ensure quality through comprehensive requirement gathering and test planning efforts as they relate to both small- and large-scale data licensing and billing projects at CME Group. This includes evolving CME Group’s online data licensing strategies even further, as well as building new and innovative tools to help drive new efficiencies across our large and diverse data client base.
Principal Accountabilities:
Working with stakeholders to help interpret high level requirements for complex and large-scale initiatives
Translating project-focused detailed requirements into well thought out use cases/scenarios and user acceptance plans
Actively leading and documenting testing strategy and execution on behalf of key Data Service Product and Policy stakeholders
Serving as a competency specific subject matter expert, with abilities to communicate out details and provide training with regards to new and complex data licensing, reporting, and billing functionality.
Escalating complex challenges, issues and risks, as well as proposed mitigating actions as required to management and team members
Owning requirements refinement, making the necessary updates to existing business requirements documentation, assistance in the creation of technical documentation for software development, and creating traceability between agreed upon business requirements to related technical requirements and resulting test cases.
Essential Criteria:

About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

The Data Analyst is a dedicated position with the Client Services team that is responsible for providing insight and innovation to a customer’s business by identifying savings opportunities and recommendations for operational efficiencies. The Data Intelligence Team focuses on all data types (i.e., invoice, manifest, sales order, transit, etc.) to drive deep insights into the customer’s business and continuous improvement using analytics and reporting.


The ideal candidate has advanced analytical skills and is passionate about working with clients to add value to their shipping operations.

Company Overview
StrategIQ Commerce (SIQC) is a strategic analytics partner for high volume shippers. We apply actionable analytics that enable our clients to increase cost efficiency with savings and operational efficiencies. SIQC provides a critical enterprise data layer to help shippers manage and optimize their delivery networks.

We operate at an exciting juncture of essential business and data science. With e-commerce becoming the primary sales channel for many businesses, shipping has evolved from a routine expense to a point of strategic value differentiation as it drives customer experience – whether a package is delivered on time. SIQC’s real-time NOW services help identify emerging bottlenecks in their networks for earlier intervention with carriers over “at-risk” packages.

Roles and Responsibilities
The Data Intelligence Senior Analyst serves as the initial reviewer of requests by thoroughly scoping out the project, defining steps required for completion, and provides quality control support. The role is client-facing and requires the ability to manage response times and communicate professionally. A successful Data Intelligence Senior Analyst proactively creates efficiencies, provides leadership to the team, and can both interpret and speak to complex client data.
Provide insightful data analytics to maximize savings opportunities and drive supply chain or marketing strategies for clients
Develop and build advanced/custom reports and metrics via Microsoft Excel and Excel MDX
Use KPI metrics to manage recurring and ad hoc requests from clients to provide insightful, accurate and thought-provoking results
Collaborate with a small team and provide team members with technical and directional support to ensure project accuracy, efficiency, and timeliness
Work with the Director of Client Services and Client Services team members to review new developments and issues
Strategize with other departments to ensure all customer and internal deliverables are successfully delivered
Standardize processes and train department members
Bring forth insight and innovation and devise strategies for continuous growth of the program
Be a critical player in moving forward new and existing technology
Key Success Factors
We dedicate training and development programs that enhance our employees’ skills and ensure they have the tools to succeed professionally. SIQC employees possess the following key success factors that help all of us achieve our respective goals.

Must-Have Skills
Strong analytical skills
Ability to organize and manage simultaneous projects across multiple customers and deliver them on-time
Ability to interact with clients in a productive and professional manner and provide excellent customer service
Ability to both have accountability for individual work and collaborate successfully in a team
Ability to interpret, report on, and explain complex data
Ability to think critically; troubleshoot and solve problems
Ability to provide guidance and support to fellow Data Intelligence team members and other SIQC staff members
Nice-to-Have Skills
Intermediate to advanced VBA and/or SQL knowledge
Prior experience with Logistics, Data Analytics, or Data Mining
Education and Experience:
BA/BS (preferably within Finance, Economics, Statistics, or Mathematics)
4+ years of work experience with parcel analytics and contracts
Thorough critical thinking and analytical ability
Highly Organized and able to able to manage a lot of details
Proficient Microsoft User (especially Excel and Outlook)

Company Description
Hi there! We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives. Join us at razorfish.com.

Job Description
WEB ANALYTICS SENIOR ASSOCIATE
Job Description
Razorfish is seeking a full-time Senior Associate of Data Analytics for our New York office. Candidates should be proficient in digital/website KPI frameworks, reporting, insight, and analysis. Day-to-day instruments include Adobe Analytics and Excel/PowerPoint.
Responsibilities:
Analysis & Insights
Analyze website performance data (overall trends, clickstream, pathing, UX) to uncover meaningful insights, across a variety of global markets for a prominent e-commerce site
Create and maintain bi-weekly and monthly reporting
Build ad-hoc analyses as needed to unearth page, experience, or market-level learnings
Independently prioritize analytical needs of team and business, based on complexity, timing, and visibility
Perform basic statistical analysis, such as calculating statistical significance, distributions, etc.
Effectively communicate complex ideas to primary client contacts, both verbally and in writing
Qualifications
The applicant should have at least 2-4 years of work experience in a business environment, with a minimum of 12 months successfully working with or adjacent to websites, such as in digital media or an intensively client-focused model such as an external consulting or marketing services firm
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Statistics or equivalent experience
1+ year Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics experience preferred
A storyteller, be able to make sense of data and extrapolate meaningful and actionable insights
Experience in creating and delivering presentations using PowerPoint
Experience in the any or multiple areas below would be a plus:
SQL querying
Basic knowledge of website tagging or tag management systems (Adobe Launch, Google Tag Manager, etc)
Paid or owned media campaign knowledge that would drive to a website
Advertising (both online and offline)
Website design/customer experience

Who we are: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.
Job Description Summary: The Compensation Analyst will have primary responsibility for carrying out activities in support of PayPal’s annual rewards cycle, the market pricing function, and job architecture design and maintenance.
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Support the annual and ongoing global rewards cycle in Workday including requirements documentation, system and program administration, user acceptance testing, data audits, rewards letters.
Participate in annual global market pricing activities, analyzing market data to develop and maintain salary ranges, short-term incentive targets and equity ranges based on established compensation strategy. Develop employee impact and costing analysis.
Conduct ad hoc benchmarking analysis as needed for new or changing roles or to address specific market concerns.
Prepare and submit data to multiple third-party surveys, collect data output, manage invoicing and payment.
Serve as day-to-day owner of compensation software MarketPay. Update, maintain, and ensure the accuracy of data. Create reports and analytics to meet internal needs.
Partner with the Compensation Operations team to ensure Workday is updated to reflect needed changes to job profiles, salary structures, bonus and equity targets, etc.
Serve as project team member in support of job architecture and leveling project and initiatives, including analytical and systems support on any changes to the career level framework.
Lead or participate in other compensation-related project and activities.
Requirements:
5 + years of compensation related experience preferably within the technology industry
Proven success in market pricing and knowledge of global job architecture mechanics
Experience with job analysis, benchmarking and market pricing. Experience with Radford a plus
Advanced Excel skills are required to analyze data and create meaningful, understandable models and reports; ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-making
Must be organized with the ability to multi-task and prioritize
Strong communication skills and ability to partner and work cross-functionally
Experience supporting internal customers, such as compensation partners and HRBPs to support business initiatives
Preferred:
Experience with Workday especially the advanced compensation module
Experience with MarketPay
Experience working with a multinational company
CCP certification
For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

The Organization: IFF improves the world by strengthening nonprofits and the communities they serve. As a mission-driven lender, real estate consultant, and developer, IFF helps communities thrive by creating opportunities for low-income communities and persons with disabilities. Key to our success has been a deep sense of purpose, a broad perspective, and a relentless focus on achieving positive results. Across the Midwest, we help clients from every sector, including human service agencies, health centers, schools, affordable housing developers, and grocery stores. Staff contributes its extensive business experience with an unrivaled connection to the mission of IFF and the nonprofit clients it serves.IFF is looking for candidates with a commitment to the work it does and can demonstrate their creativity, detail-orientation, diligence, efficiency, enthusiasm, flexibility, organization, thoughtfulness, and sense of humor.Our staff of over 100 professionals works from our Chicago headquarters, and we also serve the Midwest from six regional offices: Indianapolis, IN; Detroit, MI; Kansas City, MO; St. Louis, MO; Columbus, OH; and Milwaukee, WI.Basic Job Function: The Senior Community Data Analyst identifies, prepares, and analyzes community datasets and extracts insights to solve real-world community development challenges for IFF and our community partners throughout the Midwest. As part of the Community Data Insights team, the Senior Community Data Analyst leads the development and implementation of quantitative data analysis plans and methods, including building relationships with community data stewards; researching national, regional, and local data sources; collecting and cleaning data; conducting quantitative data analysis, with an emphasis on spatial analysis; developing data visualizations; extracting actionable insights from data trends, patterns and spatial relationships; contributing to the development of presentations and reports; and designing and developing web apps and tools. The Senior Community Data Analyst must be a collaborative team player, intellectually curious, an advocate for the use of data to inform strategic decision making, and able to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Job Duties and Responsibilities: 1. Acquires and prepares quantitative data from secondary sources to support internal and external projects. 2. Develops and fosters ongoing partnerships with data owners, stewards, and analysts at the national, regional, state, and local level, including universities, community data centers, school districts, and government agencies.3. With minimal supervision, develops and executes quantitative/spatial analysis plans and methodologies in support of mid-size to large internal and external projects with minimal supervision.4. Leads small internal and external projects that incorporate secondary data analysis.5. Designs and produces data visualizations including maps, charts, and graphs that are easily consumed, aesthetically appealing, and visually impactful.6. Contributes to the development of reports, publications, and proposals. May occasionally be called upon to participate in presentations.7. With minimal supervision, designs and develops innovative web apps, data tools, and resources that support strategic decision making and learning for IFF and our partners.8. Participates on inter-departmental teams to complete multi-disciplinary projects that provide insights and solutions for internal and external clients.9. Develops and completes annual professional development plan, in consultation with supervisor.10. Attends and participates in required educational programs and staff meetings.11. Carries out other related tasks, requests, and other duties as assigned.Performance Measures: 1. Successful delivery of high-quality data analysis, insights, and data visualizations. Written drafts, outlines, analyses, visualizations, tools, reports and presentations are complete, accurate, comprehensive, and clear.2. Consistent focus on high-impact, actionable research. Innovates to support clients and IFF as learning organizations.3. Successful completion of project tasks according to budget, timeframe and goals set forth at the beginning of each project and department’s policies and procedures.4. Engagement with colleagues, clients, sectors, and projects embodies value of life-long learning and professional development.5. Cultivates a culture of openness in information sharing. Encourages open communication, cooperation, and the sharing of knowledge.6. Models personal accountability that promotes ownership and engagement.7. Builds and maintains effective working relationships with colleagues, peers, partners, and team members measured by high satisfaction on IFF team evaluation and client surveys.8. Values and supports differences in others, contributing to an inclusive work environment. Demonstrates the ability and willingness to communicate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and experiences to create a collaborative, collegial, and caring community.Position Qualifications: : Education: Bachelor’s Degree required.Previous Experience: Demonstrated advanced proficiency in quantitative data analysis, GIS software and geospatial analysis. Minimum of five years relevant experience is required.Special Knowledge & Skills: 1. Interest in, knowledge of, experience with, and willingness to learn about nonprofits, community development and issues facing low-income communities and communities of color is essential.2. Advanced proficiency in ArcPro and ArcGIS Online with demonstrated ability to build custom online applications and sophisticated online GIS tools.3. Advanced proficiency with statistical software programs such as SPSS, Stata or R Studio.4. Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Python preferred.5. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite required.6. Exceptional data management and analysis skills using geographic, demographic, socio-economic, healthcare, education, housing, real estate, and economic data.7. Advanced critical-thinking skills exhibited by the ability to take information from a wide variety of sources and synthesize/analyze the information in the context of a research project.8. Ability to translate technical data into insights and visualizations meaningful to a broad audience. Effective and confident communicator.9. Ability to set and meet deadlines.10. Good relational skills, including with people from a diverse range of backgrounds, and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.Unusual Requirements: Travel within the Midwest may be required. Occasional evening and weekend workApplication Instructions: Please submit a cover letter, resume and salary requirements to careers@iff.org with “Senior Community Data Analyst” : in the subject line.IFF values equity, diversity and inclusion as part of its mission to strengthen nonprofits and the communities they serve. IFF is an equal opportunity employerJob Type: Full-timeWork Location: Multiple Locations

Evive people are game-changers.

Evive was founded by two people who wanted to challenge the status quo...and did. Since 2007, that spirit has defined our culture. The work we do is redefining how people use their employee benefits, with SaaS-based services that help people to improve their lives and Fortune 1000 enterprises to optimize their benefits investments. We strive every day for the ideal of #benefitslove. Are you one of us?

We're looking for a Detailed-Oriented Data Operations Analyst. Is it you?

As a member of our Technology Operations team, your primary focus is on the integration and ongoing maintenance of data that support Evive's customers and their solutions. An ideal candidate for this position enjoys working in a fast-paced team environment, embraces problem-solving challenges, has a strong attention to detail, and is comfortable with a variety of technology platforms & tools.

Here's what a Data Operations Analyst does at Evive (for people who like bullet lists):

Direct ownership of data file, SSO, API, and maintenance across Evive solutions.
Collaborate with internal teams to understand project scope and timelines, pinpoint areas of risk, and define the technical & data requirements for achieving project goals.
Work with customers and vendor partners to drive the data acquisition process and resolve data integrity issues as needed.
Create and maintain system-related documentation around data flows and integration.
Design, create, and execute ETL processes for loading data into Evive's platform.
Perform extensive data validation/QA analysis within large datasets.
Monitor data integration processes and maintain system data health for Evive customers.
Create and track metrics that support trend analysis and drive improvement across teams and solutions.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements, such as automating manual processes that minimize errors and promote scalability.
Assist on a multitude of cross-team projects that help achieve our organizational goals.
All other duties as assigned.

You bring a lot to the table.

Bachelor's or Master's degree in CS, MIS, Business, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data engineering, technology support, or related field.
Experience working with open source software and tools (SQL, R, JSON).
Experience in data integrations and establishing ETL processes.
Understanding of SAML and SSO concepts.
Exceptional critical thinking analytical skills; ability to troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Ability to interpret and explain technical concepts and results to functional / non-technical audiences.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to own and handle multiple projects concurrently, prioritize and execute a large number of tasks, and resolve issues quickly.
Bring a positive and energetic presence to working in a team environment.

Evive takes care of its teammates. Here are our current benefits:

Laid-back office, casual attire—jeans and a t-shirt are always okay!
Weekly catered lunch + daily stocked kitchen with drinks, fresh fruit, and a variety of other snacks
Competitive salaries with annual bonus pay
Paid Time Off—both for vacation and volunteering
Paid Sick Time
Employer-paid medical insurance + subsidized vision, dental, and short-term disability insurance
Voluntary life and AD&D insurance
401(k) with up to 2% company match
Student loan assistance program
Employee assistance program
Pre-tax commuter benefit + convenient location (right off the CTA blue line and Union Station)
Treadmill desks: walk and work!
Company-sponsored book club

If you're prepared to go big, go bold, and go beyond, you're ready to go Evive.

Apply now!

Residential Services serves over 4,000 students in on-campus housing and utilizes a number of applications and systems to provide an excellent student experience. We are seeking a dynamic Business Analyst to provide technology guidance and oversee the applications, systems, workflows and processes that are essential to the daily operations of Residential Services.
Day to day this role will collaborate with stakeholders to determine long-term solutions and propose solutions to enrich the student experience. This role assists in the design, development, implementation, testing, documentation and maintenance of applications and systems that support Residential Services. Initial priorities include documenting the application of business practices and developing sustainable and effective ways for staff to contribute. This role designs and implements solutions using low-code platforms and workflow-oriented tools, and is responsible for analyzing business practices, writing documentation, providing training, and process improvement. The dual seat in Student Affairs Information Technology and Residential Services will afford the BA opportunities to be informed about best practices in both spheres.
The successful candidate will demonstrate strengths in strategic thinking, curiosity, and critical thinking.
Strategic Thinking – This person will aide in setting a vision for the use of technology within Residential Services, including identifying potential growth opportunities.
Curiosity – The BA should be observant and able to ask critical questions to prompt staff members to reflect on their needs and the needs of students.
Critical Thinking – With proper training, this person should be able to understand how different processes impact different units within RS and identify growth areas.
Please note: May work nights, weekends and holidays.
Specific Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning
Partners with senior analysts, end users and peers to document and analyze functional requirements, identify gaps and alternative approaches to meet requirements, and ensure all deliverables completed (adhering to approved methodology and documentation standards).
Partners with functional users and technical and reporting staff to determine best approaches, ensuring that approved solutions are implemented in a timely and correct fashion.
Performance
Assists in software evaluation and enters moderate to complex configurations to meet user needs.
Collects feedback from users on application performance and escalates moderate to complex critical performance issues with technical resources and management.
Collaborates with technical resources to analyze and resolve moderate to complex production issues in a timely manner. Provides input into possible solutions based on prior system knowledge and basic analytical skills.
Administration
Drafts accurate documentation of process, procedure, and system/application configuration.
Formulates and executes test scripts, implementation project plans, roll out communications and training materials.
Outlines medium complexity use cases.
Development
Designs and implements solutions for moderate to complex use cases using low-code platforms, reporting, data visualization and workflow-based tools.
Formulates test scripts and performs detailed testing for moderate to complex use cases to ensure that the implemented software functions correctly.
Participates in and may facilitate iterative feedback processes among users, developers, and analysts to ensure software functionality aligns with requirements. Draws on prior implementation experience to engage in discussions.
Supervision
May provide work direction and/or supervise staff such as subordinates, contractors, vendors, students, etc.
May manage basic projects or work packets ensuring timelines, deliverables and expectations are met
Miscellaneous
Performs other duties as assigned.

Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree; OR appropriate combination of education and experience.
Two years functional/business/system analysis or other relevant experience required.

Must possess excellent interpersonal communication, organization, administration, supervision skills and experience as well as a commitment to diversity and student development.

Primary Role
This position is responsible for developing and design of analytical tools that drive improvement of operational and financial performance across all segments of the Field Operations function. The Senior Analyst will lead strategic planning initiatives by providing data-driven strategy recommendations, develop proposals for achieving strategic cost savings and opportunities to capitalize on business performance opportunities. Responsible for but not limited to reporting on performance, fraud trends, performance metrics, strategy performance analytics, and development of new reporting tools.
Key Accountabilities
Perform detailed financial analysis including budget and forecast variance analysis, profitability analysis, and key performance indicator calculations highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variances. • Assist Claims Manager and Business Planning in budgeting and reforecasting budget for COGS throughout the year and assist with financial modeling for reasonableness and consistency suggesting changes to assumptions when appropriate. • Prepare monthly and ad-hoc reporting for the business utilizing analytical skills and tools to determine opportunities to identify provider or customer behavior and trends for helpful and harmful factors related to COGS. • Design and provide materials to present to various teams and management in digestible pieces in clear and concise manner of the opportunities relevant to process owners and drive recommended actions. Act as the liaison between teams to assist with building a project around the identified opportunity then execute and measure the success of implementation of the enhancements. • Proactive in identifying, assessing and measuring areas of concern and demonstrating initiative, independently and collaboratively recommending corrective courses of action and work to meet shared objectives. • Support the Claims Management team and other Field Operations functions in leading “deep dives” conducting analysis, generating insights and developing strategies and leading implementation for productivity and cost improvement opportunities. • Define requirements and perform testing of system enhancements that provide data elements for reporting include those of automatic generation of reports updates covering strategy performance metrics.
Knowledge/Skills

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to think creatively. • Ability to function independently and efficiently in carrying out assigned tasks of interpreting large amounts of data to accurately identify business needs, delivering recommendations for different audiences into digestible material. • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and driven with a strong work ethic and demonstrated teamwork skills. • Self-starter with the ability to multitask and work effectively in a dynamic environment with fluctuating workload and aggressive timelines while promptly delivering timely and accurate analysis. • Exceptional strategic acumen, problem-solving skills, analytical capabilities, and instill trust through honesty, integrity, and authenticity • Able to be accountable for making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.

7-10 years as a Strategy Analyst, Financial Analyst, or Financial reporting, planning and analysis • 5-7 years of experience using data analysis tools (SQL Server, Tableau), data query reporting, in addition, intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel is required • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Bi or other analytical tools.

Experience/Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent experience.

Travel Requirements

10%

Other

This role must be able to occasionally work after hours.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Engineering USA is a dynamic and growing organization and we are seeking a self-driven individual to complement our growing team.

As a Data Analyst, you will work as part of the simulation team. You will be working productively with Consultants, Engineers, Project Managers, and other internal & external interfaces to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. You will be responsible for translating business requirements into specific process aligned designs and analytic solutions based on multi-product/multi-industry domain knowledge and best practices. You will play a key role in helping Engineering USA deliver market leading solutions and provide value to our customers.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Project Analysis:
Assist in the elicitation and building of business, functional and technical requirements
Assist in the design specification phase and building the design specification document
Project execution:
Conduct data cleaning and analysis during simulation model development and experimental runs. Includes distribution fitting and statistical analysis of simulation results
Develop & troubleshooting analytic/statistical models and overall supervision of system modifications
Develop dashboards and reports
Unique point of contact from the technical team to report on progress
Lead resolution of technical issues, including solution development, product releases, and engineering tasks
Owns the testing process
Lead end-user training and solution acceptance
Ensures current applications are updated and align with the implementation of new applications and analyzing end users' needs
Evaluate the team's work processes and best practices and implement changes to streamline operations
Assist in creating and implementing risk mitigation processes and conduct security/performance audits to determine weaknesses in applications
Create an inclusive and supportive environment for all personnel within the project team and actively support team members.

 KNOWLEDGE/ SKILL REQUIREMENTS

Excellent grasp of statistical techniques to clean, process and manage data of all sizes
Experience using statistical packages and tools (SAS, Python, Excel)
Experience with dashboarding and reporting tools (Tableau, Python, Excel)
Preferred: Knowledge of discrete event simulation methodology and tools (Siemens Tecnomatix, Anylogic, SIMIO, Flexsim, ARENA etc..)
Preferred: Experience with data science/machine learning and optimization techniques
Knowledge of programming languages (VBA/VBScript, Python)
Knowledge of software release management on multiple environments (e.g. DEV, QA, PROD) including but not limited to handling of pool requests, merge operations, solution building, deployment, unit testing, and regression testing
Strong partnership skills to work alongside team members and customers
Strong communication and consulting skills to communicate with internal team and interact with customers
Passion for exceeding customer expectations and spearhead customer adoption
Strong time management skills
Must display a high degree of adaptability in order to learn new technologies as needed and successfully manage the daily challenges of a technical environment

RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

Must be legally able to work in the United States for Engineering USA
Minimum 5 years of experience in engineering and/or manufacturing processes for design and development of analytic solutions
Ability to effectively communicate progress, status and issues to internal and external customers
Ability to obtain and meet Business goals and results
Ability to work independently, as well as on a team
Proficient with Standard MS Office applications, such as Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.
Willingness and ability to travel up to 50%

Education:

Bachelor's Degree in Data Science or Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Technology

About the role

If you enjoy working with others, problem-solving using technology to create high-quality solutions, and watching your ideas impact the business positively, this might be the role for you! As a BA/QA on our Software Development team, you will work with the stakeholders to assess project requirements, output acceptance criteria, and create a high-quality test plan to ensure we design solutions that solve everyday business problems. You'll partner with your team members on IT to continually groom project backlogs, decompose work into user stories, monitor project progress, and deliver high-quality, well-tested products - ensuring our deliverables meet business expectations at go-live.

Our IT team is based in Chicago, Illinois, but we're open to remote hires in the continental U.S., as long as we have at least 6 hours of overlap between 8:30 am and 5 pm central time.

Your typical daily tasks will include:

Write and update project documentation including user stories, acceptance criteria, test plans, test cases, and assist with training materials as needed.
Interaction with Stakeholders to define, gather, and document business requirements into Agile User Stories for the development team.
Conduct interviews and requirements gathering workshops. Coordinate requirements for new and existing applications. Ensures sign-off of all artifacts.
Prioritize requirements with input from stakeholders and serve as a liaison between them and the development team.
Work with the development team to ensure that they understand the specifications.
Conduct test planning, writing of test cases and scripts, and testing resource activities
Create and execute detailed QA Test Plans to ensure products are built to specifications. This includes end to end testing, integration testing, and performance testing
Work directly with development, operations, product owners, and other stakeholders to ensure any issues identified in QA testing are resolved.
Monitor project progress by tracking activity, publishing progress reports, and recommending changes to the system to improve efficiency and the user experience.

 Qualifications:

Basic understanding of Software Engineering Principles, Software Development Lifecycle, and Software Testing Life Cycle
Understanding of Agile development methodology
Familiarity with Azure DevOps or similar project management tools such as Jira
Track record of successfully gathering and defining requirements
An inquisitive and innovative nature, integrity, willingness to step into new roles, deadline and team-focused mentality, and a commitment to continuous learning and improving
Excellent written and verbal communication at both the business and technical level
Bachelor's degree in a Computer, Software, IT, or Business-related field (A college degree is also acceptable along with sufficient skills or experience).
Basic understanding of SQL or willingness to learn in the first six months.
Experience with Salesforce and/or FinancialForce is a huge plus, but not required.

Plus Skills:

Experience with Salesforce and/or FinancialForce is a huge plus.
Software Development Lifecycle testing methodology experience
Hands-on experience using a Task Management & Test Tracking environment
Familiar with JavaScript, HTML, JSON, and XML or other web services languages
Salesforce and/or project management certifications

Citi Retail Services Technology is looking for IT Business Data Analysts with broad experience and an interest to develop and Implement data management strategy. In this role, you will collaborate with Data Governance team and other analytical users for developing the data strategy and solutions. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a distributed team and work independently as well as in tight collaboration with the Data Stewards, analytical users and other shared service technology teams. We'll need you to be a great communicator and influencer, and, especially, a collaborator. You will regularly collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver technology guidance, requiring a clear understanding of the desired outcomes and a solid grasp of the overall technology roadmap.
This role is a Lead IT Business Analyst that will support the implementation of the Citi Data Management Policy and Standards (CDMP). The CDMP establishes minimum requirements for the implementation of a consistent and controlled approach to create and use data as a critical corporate asset across Citi. The Policy also establishes a Governance Model for Data Management, Governance and Quality across Citi. This positions requires extensive data analysis expertise and past experience in managing and/or supporting applications from a technology perspective. This role will directly interact and partner closely with Data Custodians (IT – Application Owners) for the implementation of Data Quality rules within application(s)

Serve as a Technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) with knowledge of reporting and analytics data along with business rules, ETL processes as it flows through the different systems.

Perform the root cause analysis for the Data Quality issues and Implement the solutions to remediate the issues.
Shared accountability and responsibility with Data Custodians to ensuring mapping to accurate and controlled data sources; including safe, accurate and controlled sourcing, transport, transformation, and storage of data.
Provide analyst support to document and maintain end-to-end data level linage, implementation of data controls, and documenting/maintaining technical metadata for in-scope processes and organizational objectives.
Collaborate with Data Stewards, Data Custodians, and other stakeholders to maintain Data Dictionaries.
Ensure Data Quality standards/ process are met and supported.
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
Actively drive simplification of Technology environment by eliminating specific/duplicative platforms leveraging the Global platforms where appropriate.
Enforce a consistent strategy, roadmap, and standard platforms documentation.
Works with Product Managers to document translate business strategy into technology roadmaps and coordinating them with internal IT team and vendors.
Work with partners to develop business cases to justify initiatives, and develop tracking mechanism to track finance request and tracking throughout the lifecycle of the program MIS

Job Description:
Wedbush Securities is one of the largest securities firms and investment banks in the nation. We provide innovative financial solutions through our Wealth Management, Capital Markets, Futures and Advanced Clearing & Prime Services divisions. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California with over 100 offices and more than 80 correspondent offices, our commitment to providing relentless, customized service is the foundation of our consistent growth.
Our IT department is seeking a Business Analyst which is a highly technical and hands-on role responsible for development of new products and resolving issues with existing products. The position is responsible for creating BRDs, user stories and other supporting requirements documentation such as high-level wire-frames and process-flow diagrams. The position works with project managers, QA staff, and software engineers to build high quality technical solutions and also function as a subject matter expert or product owner of core IT systems.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Function as a business analyst and product owner within the Agile SCRUM development cycle
Create business and technical specifications such as user stories, process-flow diagrams, wire-frames
Develop business requirement documents (BRDs) including functional and non-functional requirements
Translate business requirements and operational workflows into technical solutions
Analyze and gain expertise around existing software solutions and processes
Conduct User Acceptance Testing and ensure solutions meet business requirements
Perform basic data analysis using T-SQL
Conduct user training and product demos
Work directly with business users to analyze existing operational procedures
Assist in developing ROI and feasibility of proposed technical solutions
Perform other tasks and duties as required and assigned

Required Experience:

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university, preferably in Business/Econ, Computer Science or other related fields
3+ years experience working as a Business Analyst
2+ years related experience in financial services, broker/dealer environment
Working knowledge of relational databases and SQL queries
Experience in requirements gathering and documentation, such as BRDs and User Stories
Experience in Agile software development methodologies such as SRUM, Kanban
Knowledge of the software development cycle (SDLC)
Experience with Atlassian JIRA and Confluence
Understanding of various software architectures (web applications, client-server and mainframe systems)
Experience documenting workflow processes using process-flow or activity diagrams
Ability to translate business requirements into a technical solution
Excellent communication and presentation skills, including user presentations and training material, with the ability to communicate effectively across various departments and levels of the organization
Knowledge and experience around Financial Services business operations
Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner

The Field Museum is a not-for-profit museum located on Chicago’s Museum Campus. In the over 125 year history of the Field, which started in 1893 at the World’s Columbian Exposition in the “White City,” we have engaged in research on all seven continents, cultivated a collection of over 40 million specimens and objects, engaged with hundreds of thousands of students from Chicago and the surrounding areas, and welcomed millions of visitors to the Museum each year. We accomplish this through the efforts of our dynamic and diverse staff of not only scientists and educators, but also front line staff in Visitor Services and Membership, Protection Services, Facility Planning and Operations, as well as behind the scenes support staff.
The Field Museum is in search of a full-time AP Vendor Relations Data Analyst to join our team!
The AP Vendor Relations Data Analyst is responsible for various aspects of vendor activity, including maintaining data, reporting on vendor activity, and tax reporting. This position will also be responsible for maintaining customer records.
Duties and Responsibilities

Manage vendor files. Responsible for reviewing and maintaining vendor data forms, including Vendor Application, W-9, W-8, Independent Contractor Evaluation, and Certificate of Insurance
Create vendor records in the financial system and update records as necessary
Prepare and file the annual 1099 and 1042-S tax reporting to both the payees and IRS
Work with departments regarding visiting Foreign Nationals and Foreign Vendors to assure receive necessary paperwork to process payments
Review and approve foreign vendor bills in the financial system. Assess what portion is taxable and identify the tax rate based on applicable tax treaties
Assist with Museum Purchasing and act as a liaison to suppliers as needed. Use P-Card for one time vendor payments or other payments over $5,000 that can be made with the P-Card and reconciliation
Manage Customer database in financial software for accounts receivable
Maintain a separate database (Windstar) to assist with Foreign Vendor payment tracking and tax reporting
Represent the Museum at purchasing networking events
Prepare reports on vendor activity for internal and external constituents
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree
3 to 5 years of 1099 and 1042-S tax reporting experience preferred
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize many tasks required
Computer skills required including a working knowledge of an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system and mid-level knowledge of the electronic spreadsheets
Proficient in ERP (NetSuite) or able to learn the system quickly
Organized and able to meet daily, weekly, and monthly deadlines
Strong knowledge of 1099 and 1042-S tax
Able to work collaboratively with Finance team and other Museum staff
Able to communicate positively with vendors, consultants, and other external agencies
General filing of vendor information and may require some lifting of boxes by moving them from the office to an on-site storage locations

Request for exemptions for medical reasons or based on a sincerely held religious belief will be considered. However, even if an exemption is granted, we cannot guarantee that we will be able to provide an accommodation for anyone who has not been vaccinated.

The Opportunity

Teladoc Health is transforming how people access and experience healthcare. Recognized as the world leader in virtual care, we are partnering with over a thousand clients to serve hundreds of thousands (soon millions!) of people living with chronic conditions every day. Teladoc Health offers a whole person virtual care platform that empowers all people everywhere to live their healthiest lives by transforming the healthcare experience, from acute and primary care to chronic care, mental health, and specialty care. Our team of data scientists aggregate and interpret substantial amounts of health data and information to create actionable, personalized, and timely health signals for our members. This approach delivers better clinical and financial outcomes while creating a different and better healthcare experience for people everywhere.

Come help us execute on mission-critical projects that will secure Teladoc's position as the market leader in the exciting, red-hot digital healthcare field. As a contractor in the role of Data Operations Analyst you'll be responsible for the intake, processing, and analytics of external data files that drive far-reaching business metrics, enrollment, and revenue. Typically, our contractor stints last for 3-5 months, with a high percentage of contractors converting to full time once they reach the 5-month point.

In this role you'll be a key contributor on the team that develops and manages the system for efficient and effective data processing and warehousing. This is a collaborative role, working with several internal departments as well as client stakeholders, so we're looking for a people-person who can effectively converse with partners and clients on our data needs, while effectively tracking details, assuring data integrity, and gaining insights from data. We're looking for candidates with strong technical competence and relevant experience.

Enjoy great variety, challenge and learning opportunities as you manage a mix of responsibilities that involve data analysis, ETL, automation, data visualization, client interaction, and much more! At Teladoc there is no limit to what you can learn and what you can achieve. Take advantage of this exciting stepping-stone in your career as you enjoy the innovative and collaborative environment of a company that Fortune has named one of the Best Places to Work in healthcare!

Responsibilities
Implement the ingestion of a wide variety of medical data feeds through our ETL
Medical/provider claims data
Pharmacy benefit management/pharmacy claims
Wellness programs and biometric data
Eligibility and census data
Create new monitoring tools and data visualizations for our inbound file feeds
Ensure data integrity and unlock key insights using our vast data sets
Monitor and triage critical alerts to enforce business rules and ensure data integrity for all downstream systems
Develop automation scripts using Python or R to gain efficiencies in existing processes
Engage with partners, clients, and benefit management vendors to obtain pertinent data files
Work with technical and non-technical client stakeholders to explain data concepts and enforce data requirements
Establish strong relationships with partners and clients with a goal of standardizing data file templates
Partner with Teladoc's client-facing teams to establish and maintain required data source feeds
Collaborate with Product, Reporting, Clinical, Engineering, and other Operational teams on developing data-driven solutions
Candidate Profile
1-3 years' experience with data processing and analytics
Strong SQL skills (Redshift, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL)
Strong communications, project management, and organizational skills
Some experience with Python or similar scripting
Data warehousing and ETL experience
Data visualization or similar BI experience
Experience developing and maintaining operational processes
A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Impress us even more:

Experience in the healthcare industry
Experience working with medical or pharmacy claims data
Why Join Teladoc Health?

A New Category in Healthcare: Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.

Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person's health journey.

Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.

Focus on PEOPLE: Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment.

Diversity and Inclusion: At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.

Growth and Innovation: We've already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members.

Company Description
Reverb is the largest online marketplace dedicated to buying and selling new, used, and vintage musical instruments. Since launching in 2013, Reverb has grown into a vibrant community of buyers and sellers all over the world. By focusing on inspiring content, price transparency, musician-focused eCommerce tools, a music-savvy customer service team, and more, Reverb has created an online destination where the global music community can connect over the perfect piece of music gear.
We believe that music makes the world a better place, which is why our mission is to make the world more musical. Through Reverb Gives, a portion of every sale provides youth music education programs across the world with instruments they need to make music.

Job Description
As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll work closely with our in-house Marketing team as a trusted partner to analyze the performance of marketing channels and campaigns. Our ideal candidate is driven by understanding customer behavior and is passionate about contributing to the development of marketing strategies, which are informed by data and focused on outcomes. In this role, you’ll surface insights to improve customer acquisition for Reverb’s marketplace. You’ll create testing frameworks and reporting partnering with the MarTech and Data Engineering teams. You will report into Analytics and collaborate with other analysts on the development and administration of business intelligence platforms serving the company.
This is a full-time position located (eventually) in Chicago, reporting to the Director of Analytics. While all of our employees are currently remote, our future of work plan will offer flexible workplace policies that can accommodate work from home candidates who are comfortable traveling to the office location 2-3 times per week.
Responsibilities:
Build reporting and analytics, collaborating directly with the Performance Marketing team
Design, analyze, and uncover insights from A/B tests and other marketing experiments using the appropriate statistical techniques
Partner on campaign optimization, testing, and the day-to-day performance of campaigns across paid search, paid social, email, online video, and social media
Build self-service dashboards for important metrics so that marketing team members can perform repeatable analyses themselves
Explore Reverb’s marketing data, uncovering new insights and opportunities to improve audience engagement and product catalog segmentation.

Qualifications
Proven ability in an analytics role, with ecommerce, B2C, ad agency, or marketplace experience a plus
Proficiency in using SQL and desire to grow skill set for solving business problems using BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or PowerBI
Experience working with paid performance marketing metrics
Familiarity with statistical tests used to measure the incremental impact of Marketing activities, such paid media campaigns.
Ability to communicate and present insights to a range of internal partners, including the CMO, Marketing Managers, and other Analysts.
Experience using marketings analytics tools including Google Analytics, Amplitude, Braze, or similar
Understanding of Marketing concepts and Key Performance Indicators from different channels using products such as Google Adwords, Facebook Ads, or similar.
Familiarity with marketing attribution models and tools a plus
Additional Information

Senior Business Analyst(Job Number: 210002WH)
Description
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.
 Reporting to the Director of Capital Operations, the Senior Business Analyst position will be the primary contact for Capital Planning and Finance group and the CPS ITS Oracle team. This position will direct the management of Oracle financial data in e-Builder and manage the district’s Spatial Technology including all applications that depend on CPS’s GIS resources. This multi-functional position will be responsible for assisting the Capital Finance group’s strategic use of e-Builder data and will be required to be responsive to and prioritize the needs of the Capital Finance group and the e-Builder PMO users. The Senior Business Analyst position will liaise with the e-Builder steering committee and end users to implement any required account level modifications, which could include modifications of data fields, reports, dashboards and templates ensuring that all proposed changes are in sync with the Oracle financials.

The Senior Business Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:
e-Builder Capital Program Management
Responsible for maintaining data integrity between Oracle Finance and Accounting data to e-Builder interface.
Maintain data integrity between e-Builder and Oracle Financial suite.
Direct user Provisioning and Account Configuration Changes.
Manage the onboarding and training of new users and user Technical Support.
Enhance optimization through the review of monthly and quarterly product release notes and education of CPS user base regarding new functionality and product enhancements.
Support e-Builder system administrator with ongoing e-Builder user training.
Coordinate writing requirements for steering committee review.
Develop and maintain specific support documentation.
Assist with user acceptance testing of major changes in e-Builder and the downstream Oracle changes.
Coordinate with e-Builder steering committee to develop and enforce system wide project document filing and retention policies.
Resolve all invoice documentation integration discrepancies between Oracle and e-Builder.
Oracle Data Management
Manage all aspects of Capital Planning and Facilities information in Oracle.
Monitor database to minimize downtime.
Assist in the planning, implementation, integration and maintenance of the hardware and software infrastructure supporting a wide variety of customer applications.
Collaborate with customer personnel to maintain the integrity of the customer databases.
Maintain the technical evaluation of new database versions and features.
Coordinate Ad Hoc reporting.
Manage Facilities and Transportation Contractor CPS Single Sign-on Google Accounts.
Oracle Project Accounting
Request payment of pending debts.
Investigate and reconcile unbilled costs.
Perform core application control functions.
Ensure vendors are paid correctly for services performed/ delivered.
Assist with developing cash flow projections.
Must be proficient with mathematics and interpreting financial data.
Coordinate Ad hoc reporting.
Spatial Technology Management
Liaise with Facilities department, ITS, Planning and Data Management, and Transportation to manage CPS’s Enterprise Spatial Technology.
Develop and manage the enterprise of spatial technology tools (ESRI GIS) for the district.
Develop and manage integrations with other district Business Intelligence Systems: Student Info. System (Aspen), School Locator, Facilities and Transportation.
Assist with development and analysis for yearly enrollment projections and space use reports.
Manage the End of Year/Beginning of School year spatial data and boundary creation.
Support during off-hours as required to facilitate installation, change and on-call incident response.
In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Senior Business Systems Analyst must possess the following qualifications:
Type of Education Required:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university
Type of Experience Required:
Minimum of two (2) years managing and using e-Builder or other Capital and/or construction management software.
Minimum of five (5) years’ experience with Oracle financials that include but not limited to: Project Accounting, i-Procurement, Accounts Payables.
Minimum of two (2) years’ experience with Spatial Technology – ESRI Enterprise GIS
Prior experience with CPS data protocols.
