Columbia College Chicago is an acclaimed undergraduate and graduate institution that provides a comprehensive education in the arts, communications and public relations. We constantly aim to reach our full potential as an educational innovator, incubator of new creative practice and generator of real-world success for young creatives. We are located in the heart of Chicago, across the street from historic Grant Park, and housed in some of the most iconic buildings in the South Loop.
Columbia College Chicago a private urban institution of over 6,000 undergraduate and graduate students, four-year College offering a distinctive curriculum that blends liberal arts, creative and media arts and business is currently searching for a Data Analyst.

POSITION SUMMARY
Under the general direction of the Director of Institutional Research and Reporting, the Data Analyst is responsible for importing, cleaning, transforming, validating or modeling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from data for decision making purposes. This includes presenting data in charts, graphs, tables, while also designing, connecting, and developing relational databases for collecting data. The Data Analyst should have the ability to write SQL commands, and be responsible for improving data quality and designing or presenting conclusions gained from analyzing data using statistical tools like Microsoft Excel, SPSS, and others programs. The Data Analyst should understand relational databases, and work independently to extract, clean and analyze data in a timely manner with particular attention to detail, efficiency, and accuracy. The Data Analyst should have a background in technology, information management, relational database design and development, business intelligence, data mining or statistics.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist with the development of the data warehouse and reporting.
Extract data efficiently and accurately from college databases using business intelligence applications such as SQL Server, Hyperion, or Crystal Reports.
Analyze data utilizing standard statistical methods.
Prepare written reports of research results and methods.
Maintain documentation related to projects.
Assist in identifying information needs of the College community.
Design new research projects and information products for the College community.
Perform other related duties and/or responsibilities as assigned or required.

Qualifications

Master’s with applied research training or related field.
Knowledge of practices and processes of higher education and/or institutional research preferred.
Knowledge and experience in Microsoft SQL Server, Hyperion Interactive Reporting, Crystal Reporting, or other business intelligence software.
3-5 years of experience performing statistical analysis and creating statistical reports.
3-5 years of experience in business intelligence data extraction and analysis.
Demonstrated skills at data extraction and manipulation using business intelligence applications.
Demonstrated skills at statistical analysis and interpretation.
Ability to use a statistical software package, such as SPSS, SAS, or R.
Demonstrated ability to prepare statistical and written reports for a non-technical audience.
Ability to write SQL commands and perform data manipulation.
Ability to use spread sheet, word processing and ERP systems.
For best considersation please submit your cover letter along with a resume.
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee and is subject to change based on the needs of the department and/or college.

SUMMARY

As a member of the Fund Data Reporting and Analytics Team ("Fund Data Team") within Grosvenor's Finance Department, the Analyst will focus primarily on preparing portfolio performance reports and analyses in support of GCM Grosvenor's client reporting, business development and marketing initiatives for our Private Equity, Infrastructure, and Real Estate investment verticals.


The Fund Data Team works closely with our Client Services, Marketing, Corporate, and Investment teams, which submit recurring and ad hoc requests for performance and benchmarking reports, pro forma portfolio analyses, and other portfolio metrics. Furthermore, the Fund Data Team works closely with our Fund Finance team and our administrators to obtain the information necessary to prepare the requested reports and analyses. The role operates in a fast-paced, dynamic, deadline-driven environment, so the ideal candidate must be a well-organized, thoughtful team player who operates well under pressure and has excellent analytical and communication skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The individual will be involved in the following critical activities:

Analyze data related to fund and co-investments across all of our private equity, infrastructure, credit, and real estate-focused portfolios.
Prepare, analyze, and report performance information for client reporting, business development and marketing purposes as well as for GCM Grosvenor's investment team and senior management.
Prepare forecasts of management fees, carried interest, and expenses.
Generate portfolio construction models/analyses and cash flow models.
Perform complex data management and analysis including investment portfolio analytics and investment modeling.
Manage multiple requests simultaneously, ensuring that deadlines are met.
Regularly interact with our Fund Finance team and administrators to obtain information required to prepare the requested reports and analyses.
Provide guidance and manage our offshore business process outsourcing (BPO) provider on a project by project basis in order to deliver reports and analyses in a timely manner.
Routinely handle confidential information and apply strict confidentiality and sensitivity in the dissemination of this information; and perform various ad-hoc and long-term projects and as assigned.


EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics with outstanding academic credentials is required. A Master's degree in Business, Finance or Economics is preferred.
2-4 years of relevant experience, including an understanding of accounting and finance is required.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills are required. The ideal candidate will have the ability to articulate complex thoughts in a clear and concise manner.
Exceptional Microsoft Excel skills and a demonstrated aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis are required. Experience with Investran is preferred.
A candidate must have the ability to work with and develop financial models
A strong attention to detail and concern for the quality and accuracy of final work products is critical.
Alternative investment industry experience, particularly private equity, and an understanding of the concepts and data relating to investment performance, assets under management, asset allocation and risk exposure are strongly preferred.
Experience working with IHS Markit iLevel is preferred, but not required
Excellent project management and organizational skills are required, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under pressure in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
The highest degree of integrity and the ability to maintain confidential information is absolutely necessary.
The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic, a high level of energy and the flexibility to work extended hours at times to accommodate specific projects.


In terms of cultural fit, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and energized by working amongst a group of thoughtful, smart and successful colleagues. He or she will enjoy being part of an organization focused on excellence and will be a naturally collaborative person who enjoys interacting with individuals at all levels. Additionally, he or she will be a strong team player with a proactive approach and the ability to exercise discretion and judgment.


ABOUT THE FIRM

GCM Grosvenor (NASDAQ: GCMG) is a global alternatives investment firm with approximately $62 billion in assets under management in private equity, infrastructure, real estate, credit, absolute return strategies, and multi-asset class opportunistic investments. We have specialized in alternatives since 1971, and we are dedicated to unlocking value for our clients by leveraging our cross-asset class and flexible investment platform.


Our experienced team of approximately 500 professionals from diverse backgrounds serves a global client base of institutional and high net worth investors. GCM Grosvenor is headquartered in Chicago, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Seoul.


A diverse, engaged team is critical to our ability to successfully create and deliver value to our clients. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where diverse professionals can thrive professionally, and we are dedicated to training, retaining and promoting minorities, women, LGBTQ employees, veterans and individuals with disabilities. 57% of GCM Grosvenor employees and 40% of executive management are women and/or ethnically diverse individuals. In addition, we seek to drive a more diverse, inclusive industry through our partnership with diverse professionals organizations and by consciously working with subcontractors and vendors that are certified as minority-, women-, or persons with disabilities-owned businesses


For more information, visit www.gcmgrosvenor.com.

Persistence in following up to drive deliverables
Strong and proven technical aptitude
Demonstrated leadership skills with strong decision-making capability and judgment.

Skill in applying critical thinking, analysis and problem-solving methods
Skill in attention to detail and data validation

Process Automation, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence practices (knowledge of how advancing digital tools and techniques are applied in enterprise data and analytics strategies and roadmaps)
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (minimum of 12 years), or an Associate degree with a minimum of 6 years of equivalent work experience.
Bonus points if you have:
Cloud experience

Senior Data Analyst(Job Number: 200001U6)
Description
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third largest school district in the United States, serving over 350,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission we make three commitments to our students, their families and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership and continuous learning.
Within the Office of Diverse Learners Supports and Services, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for managing the collection and evaluation of data to ensure that ODLSS is driving toward District goals.
The Data Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:
Perform analysis on complex data sets to provide meaningful information.
Evaluate data for structural integrity and consistency.
Understand data and extract information to meet business requirements.
Identify trends/anomalies in the data collected to understand the source of data inaccuracies.
Summarize metrics and produce visualizations to help guide ODLSS unit leaders, as well as networks and schools.
Partner with the business and subject matter experts to identify additional data needs.
Ensure that resources that are paid with Diverse Learning funds are performing only duties consistent with their job descriptions.
Assist in the development and manage of projects, when necessary
In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Senior Data Analyst must possess the following qualifications:
Type of Education Required:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in a Finance, Math or Business is required; Master’s degree preferred.
Type of Experience and Number of Years:
At least 5 years of data mining and data analysis experience
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to bring projects to a close with minimal supervision
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet continuous critical deadlines
Knowledge of SAS, Python, SQL or R is desirable
Expert user of Microsoft and Google office suites
Ability to write advanced queries, produce reports and strong analytical, organizational and communication skills required
Familiarity of CPS data systems is also a plus
Residency Requirement:
As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and must maintain residency throughout their employment with the district.

positionName: Strategy Execution Consultant - Business Analyst Level, Summer 2022 Start Date
description:
We are hiring Business Analysts to start their BTS careers in the summer of 2022 in the following offices: New York, NY, Chicago, IL, and San Francisco, CA. If you are interested in more than one location, you'll be able to indicate your location preferences in the application and you do not need to apply more than once.

What you´ll do at BTS
At BTS, we partner with clients to enable strategy execution. We provide the skills, tools, and knowledge so people understand how their daily work impacts business results. We are experts in behavior change, care deeply about delivering results, and inspire people do the best work of their lives.
As a BTS consultant, you’ll work directly with leaders from some of the world’s leading corporations. Global 100 and 500 largest companies. You’ll learn how their business works and what their strategies are, and you’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of their senior management. A BTS consultant also cultivates the skills of thousands of developing leaders across the globe.
We work in small teams to develop customized business simulations and other learning solutions. Think board games with financial models, or app-based digital learning. And then we facilitate learning journeys directly with our clients in a workshop setting that incorporates humor, fun, and competition. In the world we are currently in, these workshops are virtual.
There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you will have all the variety you want in your clients and work. You’ll be staffed on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams.
When you’re not facilitating a program with your teammates, you’ll spend your time designing these amazing experiences we provide for our clients. Interviewing clients, conducting research and analysis, testing programs, laughing. You’ll laugh a lot and have a lot of fun. And this is all done in a team-based setting where our entrepreneurial culture of freedom and responsibility empowers you to contribute from your first day. As your skills and career grow, you’ll have the ability to manage client relationships, find new clients and opportunities, and grow the careers of others BTSers.
As we mentioned above, right now we are doing our work virtually. Eventually, and hopefully soon, we will return to working in our offices as much as we want, as well as facilitating in-person programs with our clients. For us, that’s when we travel – when we are in front of our clients leading them through the simulations and workshops we’ve created. And when we get back to “normal,” you can expect that you’ll travel around 40-50% of the time, going to different cities to facilitate the incredible experiences you’ve designed.


What we are looking for
Curiosity. Resourcefulness. A humble and inclusive spirit. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.
We are also looking for entrepreneurial drive and diligence. Intellectual horsepower with strong business acumen. The courage and desire to present to a (Zoom) room that might have 50+ smart, eager people in it.
We do have a few requirements: solid business acumen and strong written and verbal communication skills. Eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship is also a requirement.

ABOUT US

We build tools for 100+ brands and retailers in the e-commerce space that help them offer free two-day shipping, same-day delivery, and product expansion into new marketplaces - keeping them several steps ahead of the curve in a rapidly changing industry.

We are a purpose and culture driven organization that prides ourselves on connectivity, equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to our people as a service-oriented company as our people are at the heart of everything we do.

We are Headquartered in Chicago, with offices in New York, Conshohocken, PA (Philly area), and Krakow, Poland and we operate as a subsidiary of FedEx Services. Though we're working remotely currently, we do plan to return to a hybrid schedule in 2022, so candidates local to Chicago are preferred. Unfortunately, visa sponsorship is not being offered for this role.

ABOUT THE ROLE

ShopRunner's SaaS products support online shoppers, retailers, and payment partners to improve shopping and shipping experiences. Every week, we track more than a billion interactions with shoppers across our network of merchants. Our analytics team uses this data to help make decisions about the effectiveness of our services to retailers and consumers.

The analyst, reporting to the Customer Journey Analytics Manager, will become the owner and key developer of ShopRunner customer segmentation. Day-to-day, the analyst will utilize their sharp analytical skills and exercise a creative lense to drive new hypotheses about the customer. The analyst should be comfortable regularly communicating with internal and potentially external stakeholders around segmentation findings. Additionally, the analyst should be comfortable with ambiguity, with the willingness to deep dive into the unknown and present findings even when there are limitations within the data. Long term, the analyst should have an iterative mind set with an eye for optimization and improvement of customer segmentation. Additionally, they should be able to think beyond the day-to-day and understand how customer segmentation fits into the overall ShopRunner customer journey.

This role reports to the Customer Journey Analytics Manager and works day-to-day as part of a large, cross-functional team.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Leverage membership data, behavioral data along with 3rd party data to create actionable consumer segments that will be operationalized and improved over time.
Build reporting and/or dashboards that tracks customer segments to understand how customer segment behavior changes over time and identify channels and/or levers driving positive and negative trends.
Ideate and develop A/B and/or MV tests that will inform hypotheses around customer segmentation.
Use test findings to develop recommendations on how we should better engage, retain, and drive value for customer segments.
Present findings on customer segmentation to marketing and partner success teams. Use feedback from internal terms to further develop customer segmentation.
Assist in the development of the Consumer Insights Platform through aggregating data from disparate data sources.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Required:

4+ years of data analyst experience at a consumer facing company.
BS or equivalent experience in a technical field like Marketing Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics.
Fluent with complex SQL queries on millions of rows (joins, subqueries, window functions).
Experience in employing customer segmentation techniques as well as working with email and customer interaction data.
Experience with data visualization tools, like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI (we use Looker).
Willingness to programmatically clean messy data sets (deduping, string parsing, JSON and XML parsing)
Experience in developing hypotheses and building A/B test requirements that would help inform hypotheses.
Experience in communicating data findings to internal/external stakeholders and explaining analyses to stakeholders who are not as data savvy.
Confidence to share the limitations of your analysis when the data isn't perfect.
Advanced Excel proficiency (you should be comfortable with pivot tables and lookups to summarize results).

Preferred:

Experience with ecommerce and web data.
Familiarity with statistical techniques that pertain to segmentation, targeting, and A/B testing.
Basic understanding of prediction and personalization algorithms (e.g. purchase and churn propensity models, product recommendations). This role will not build production models, but it will help if you understand how those models generally operate in connection to CRM and testing initiatives.
Experience setting up processes to monitor datasets for anomalies.

We want you to bring your whole human self to work every single day. We accept you for who you are and consider everyone on an equal opportunity basis without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Solutions driven success.
XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO Logistics, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.
As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you’ll be responsible for designing analytics-based tools which are technically sophisticated yet easy to understand and use by business teams, in support of strategic initiatives and ongoing business processes for XPO Logistics. You’ll develop solutions that leverage and expand upon the company Business Intelligence (BI) platform, with deliverables ranging from description and diagnostic reporting to predictive and prescriptive decision automation. Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Join us in this critical role and position both yourself and XPO for long-term success.
Pay, benefits and more.
We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.
What you’ll do on a typical day:
Enter Identify, lead, and deliver efforts to build reports, visualizations, and dashboards using BI tools and practices, with solution designs that leverage statistical approaches, machine learning, and related disciplines using industry standard tools, libraries, and approaches
Engage with stakeholders across the organization to align priorities, communicate solution design tradeoffs and recommendations, and build and execute development plans
 Design user interfaces, tool screens, and end user workflows to maximize understandability of information, ease of use, and alignment with XPO aesthetic and usability standards
Continuously improve technical design patterns, workflows, and tools—defining and enforcing standards when necessary to sustain the platform’s effectiveness and sustainability; and, experimenting with and promoting adoption of new tools and approaches when appropriate
Proactively generalize and share technical approaches and best practices among other developers; simplify and communicate success stories to broader audiences across the company
Support end users to ensure they have reliable access to and understanding of data they need to trust to do their jobs effectively.
What you need to succeed at XPO:
At a minimum, you’ll need:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent related work or military experience
1 or more years’ experience in business intelligence and data analytics
Experienced in analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), BI Tools (Looker, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.), programming languages (e.g. Python,R, Java, Scala, etc.).
It’d be great if you also have:
Solid understanding of Data Warehouse concepts
Experience with Cloud Platforms such as Google Cloud Platform and Google Big Query
MBA or master’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Be part of something big.
XPO is a leading provider of world-class solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make XPO a great place to work.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

XPO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with XPO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.
All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review XPO's candidate privacy statement here.

2022 Analyst Program – Management Consulting
The Organization
We help society’s foundational institutions—healthcare and higher education—to achieve their full potential in service to others.
 We are our clients’ trusted partners in ever-changing times. For more than 30 years, Kaufman Hall has provided independent, objective insights grounded in sound data and analysis to help clients fulfill their missions, achieve their goals, and tackle their toughest problems.
 Kaufman Hall provides world-class management consulting in strategic financial planning (a concept we created); performance improvement; partnerships, mergers, and acquisitions; and treasury and capital markets. Kaufman Hall’s consulting is supported by a deep foundation of benchmarking and software tools.
 At Kaufman Hall, we believe that sustained success is never an accident. It is the result of sound decision making, based on data-driven analysis and disciplined thinking, and guided by the fundamental principles of corporate finance.
The Position
Kaufman, Hall & Associates, LLC, is seeking self-motivated, intellectually curious professionals with a genuine interest in healthcare to join our Kaufman Hall Associate Program. This program will introduce incoming Analysts to each of our advisory services: Strategic Financial Planning, Partnerships, Mergers & Acquisitions, and Treasury & Capital Markets.
 Following an intensive three-week training, candidates will choose one of two paths to specialize. Rotation Option #1: Strategic Financial Planning (Financial Planning, Performance Improvement, Strategy, Physician Enterprise) or Rotation Option #2: Partnerships, Mergers & Acquisitions and Treasury Capital Markets (transaction side of business). Over the course of the program, Analysts will rotate within their practice area gaining experience on multiple projects. Mentorship and learning come in a variety of forms including structured classroom training and an apprenticeship model, working hands-on with senior leaders and Managing Directors receiving real-time feedback on the efforts put forth.
 During the 11 month KH Analyst Program, Analysts will have exposure to multiple areas of specialty while working with multiple clients and leaders at any given time, attending on-site meetings with hospital and system-level senior management and Board members as appropriate. Upon completion of the 11 month program, they will eligible for promotion to Associate.
 The essential functions of the position include:
Creating and applying industry-leading solutions to the most challenging strategic and organizational issues facing our clients
Researching and development of sound hypothesis and recommendations for clients on strategic and financial planning and optimization, leveraging Kaufman Hall subject matter experts, proprietary software and resources
Developing, analyzing and interpreting financial, valuation and debt and derivative models
Keep Managers apprised of projects to ensure critical milestones are met, timelines are adhered to and changes are properly communicated
Build presentations and completed work product to be presented to clients and Board members
Support the needs of the practice beyond client-specific work as required
Qualifications
We are seeking highly motivated individuals with a strong history of academic excellence and leadership, personally and professionally. In addition, the successful candidate will possess the following attributes:
Highly intelligent and intellectually curious
Excellent and professional presentation and communication skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
Excellent analytical, quantitative, and financial modeling skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and other analytic tools
Team focused; supportive and accountable to colleagues
Self-motivated; ability to take initiative on assigned project components
Committed to integrity and high ethical standards
Willingness and ability to travel, sometimes on short notice, on a limited basis
Current permanent US work authorization (required)
Education:
Bachelor’s degree from a top tier University with a concentration in corporate finance, accounting, economics and/or healthcare administration is strongly preferred
Physical Requirements
 Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations.
Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.
 Work Environment
 Travel Required is based on practice area: Performance Improvement 60-80%, TCM, PM&A, FP, Strategy 0-10%.
The role is based in Chicago.
Work is regularly performed in an office setting, and routinely uses standard office equipment.
It may require the maintenance of a home office and proximity to an airport for work related travel.
Kaufman Hall is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. We recruit, hire, train, promote, pay, and administer all employment actions without regard to actual and also perceived or assumed protected group status as defined by law of an individual or that individual’s associates or relatives. Our policies and the law prohibit employment discrimination against any employee or applicant on the basis of any legally protected status.

Company Description
We are Hawkeye. We orchestrate experiences across people’s journey—leveraging human insight, the world’s best data, empathic creativity, and world-class technology—to drive business results and create more meaningful connections between humans and brands. We strive to ensure that every message we send to a consumer is a meaningful one, and that it represents what they need, where and when they need it. From digital experiences to videos, from emails to print — what matters most is that we send the best next message to each consumer at every point along the way.

Our flexible geographic work environment enables our organization to be agile, move at the speed of culture, and build Connections Designed to Matter®.
We’re Hawkeye, a one-of-a-kind human experience agency….

This role will be very hands on and requires detail knowledge of data import export framework in Dynamics AX 2012 and functional knowledge of different AX modules. Creating functional and technical specifications.
Documentation of business process, data migration methodology, data quality enhancement, validation and reconciliation process.
 Master data management concepts.
Good team player and able to work flexible hours.

Introduction
Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.

Your Role and Responsibilities
START DATES FOR THIS POSITION ARE MAY 2022 AND LATER

The Entry Level Business Analyst takes business requirements from offering managers, and groups them into well-scoped feature increments for development teams. They take a lead role in building consensus around scope and risk and high-level estimates, so that there is a groomed backlog for development teams to elaborate into stories and technical approaches. The candidate for this position will perform business analysis and solution definition activities working across multiple teams and business functions to ensure that solutions are designed to fully meet market needs in all requirements dimensions – functional/non-functional, operational, architectural, etc. They will serve as subject matter expert on one or more domains or suites of products/offerings/solutions at the business unit or market segment level. They will ensure the market requirements are clearly translated into a product specification which provides clear scope to the product development team. The candidate will also be expected to interact with and present to various levels of management for various business functions

Primary Responsibilities
Work closely with product/offering management, Business Solution Architects and product development to interview, research, analyze, and derive business, functional and technical requirements.
Develop an in-depth understanding of the product and underlying data assets and models/methods.
Working with relevant stakeholders, define the solution concept design for custom solutions leveraging platform components, reusable modules and existing product capabilities.
Working with relevant stakeholders, create conceptual data models for the solutions.
Working with product owners and other relevant stakeholders, help to clarify and translate market requirements into functional and non-functional specifications, and collaborate in the product development process.
Assist in the planning process by making important tradeoff recommendations between functionality, resources and timing.
Drive the user experience needs of the solution consistent with company standards.
As needed, participate in the design and testing phases, including design and testing of prototypes and sign-off on acceptance test results to ensure design integrity.
Collaborate with Operations and Account teams to understand documentation and training needs. Work with the appropriate teams to deliver the needed materials.
Gain an understanding of implementation issues and product improvement opportunities.
Provide leadership to the Business Analysis discipline including best practices.
Working with other relevant stakeholders, help define standard work and processes and help roll these out to the organization
Write Agile style requirements documentation, including features, user stories, epics, use cases, etc.
This is an office based position in an IBM location in either Cambridge, MA or Raleigh, NC, ONLY!

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience/Understanding in the Healthcare IT industry, Business Analysis discipline and Agile product development environments, including software development life cycle and related management tools
Think creatively and contribute to both strategic and tactical decisions.
Think analytically, define problems and frame solutions.
Understand and interact with technically-oriented team members.
Interact with internal and external customers to interpret product requirements.
Demonstrated leadership skills, including experience in facilitation, influencing, and conflict resolution.
Detail oriented, proactive, able to set realistic client expectations, take vague directions/guidance and create meaningful outcomes, and deliver at or above expectations
Juggle competing priorities, multi-task, and continue to meet all deadlines
Create accurate spreadsheets in Excel and presentations in PowerPoint.
Eagerness to learn new skills and tackle new problems.
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

0-2 years experience work experience
Master's in Computer Engineering or similar discipline

As DMI continues to future-cast what consumers want and their expectations of agriculture and food, particularly in a global environment where climate impacts are top-of-mind in purchase decisions, we must prepare farmers and the dairy community for accelerated adoption and acceptance of technology-enabled farm systems and supply chains. Employees with education and background in data science will serve critical roles and complement the current DMI science and technology team.
This new position requires a candidate with strong data science skills who is extremely confident in Excel-based data analysis and data visualization. Responsible for the curation and development of analytical tools. Serves as an integral member of the Dairy Scale for Good initiative team, reporting to the Director, Dairy Sustainability System Technology, Dairy Scale for Good initiative.
Lead data analysis for the Dairy Scale for Good initiative. A strategic component of U.S. Dairy’s broader 2050 Environmental Goals and Net Zero initiative, this initiative is the successful integration and demonstration of advanced dairy farming technologies and practices designed to maximize the carbon sequestration potential of the nation’s largest dairy farms. This role will work collaboratively with developers, product vendors and Universities in the analysis and scale-up of national demonstration dairies and their environmental and economic benefits.
Execute on the initiative’s vision and mission
Build, refine, and maintain economic models accounting for the full cost of advanced technology implementation on-farm
Build and refine economic models of farmer cost and economic benefit from adoption of advanced technologies
Build and refine greenhouse gas projection models based on research and data collected from Dairy Scale for Good pilot farms
Report and share information with Dairy Scale for Good initiative team and the Net Zero Initiative project team
Undertake responsibilities as assigned by the Executive Director (and/or at the request of CEO, President or EVP/Global Environmental Strategy) relating to broader environmental strategy, direction, and goals.
Requirements
Education & Experience (Minimum Qualifications):
Bachelor’s Degree in data science or engineering (electrical, mechanical, industrial)
5+ years of industry experience in data science
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Strong analytical skills
Strong knowledge of engineering and manufacturing operations
Ability to work well in a complex and evolving team environment
Ability to conduct end-to-end database administration to data analysis to data visualization in Excel

Benefits
Dairy Management Inc. offers competitive medical and dental benefits and a generous 401(k). Our Rosemont office is conveniently located across from O’Hare Airport and accessible to the CTA Blue Line and Metra.
Dairy Management Inc.™ (DMI) is funded by America’s 31,000-plus dairy farmers, as well as dairy importers. Created to help increase sales and demand for dairy products, DMI and its related organizations work to increase demand for dairy through research, education and innovation, and to maintain confidence in dairy foods, farms and businesses. DMI manages National Dairy Council and the American Dairy Association and founded the U.S. Dairy Export Council and the Innovation Center for U.S. Dairy. DMI works with state and regional promotion organizations to implement these programs across the country.

About the role:

Are you looking for a challenge? Do you want to be a part of the leading FinTech companies in Chicago? Come join Enova as the Market Intelligence Analyst to help bring fast, trustworthy credit to consumers and businesses. Enova is searching for an analyst with experience working with market research and examining competitor products and marketing. In this role you will engage with senior leadership, product managers, marketing and engineering to conduct analysis in support of decision-making based on market trends, industry analysts, customer preferences, and competitive dynamics.

What you'll be doing:

Gather and integrate information and analyses on markets, competitors, and customers to inform business decisions; make this information easily accessible for the business.
Provide insights on competitor strategies, including strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats analysis.
Provide analyses for business planning efforts, and effectively communicate insights to senior leaders and team members across Enova.
Prepare industry, market and competitive intelligence assessments, with business implications and actionable recommendations, and present to each businesses four times a year.
Monitor and report market and competitor events and implications.
Conduct market sizing and market opportunity analysis.
Identify and analyze new business opportunities in existing, adjacent or new markets and businesses.
Contribute to the execution of market, competitor, and customer research and conduct analysis to identify opportunities for Enova businesses to win in the market.
Conduct primary and secondary research
Develop/design research approaches that fit business issues; work across the product journey (marketing, product design and customer experience)
Complete all steps of research studies – example design approach, program survey, analyze data, and present to leadership
Gather information from the business and industry to support primary market research across target audiences.
Identify and study secondary data sources and produce analysis that can be used to develop comprehensive market, customer and competitive insights.

We're excited about you if you:

Bachelor's degree in marketing, economics, or business.
2+ years of experience in market intelligence or financial/management/strategy consulting, preferably with some financial services experience.
Strong analytic skills and expert knowledge of tools like Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, statistical software, and Microsoft SQL Server a plus.
Solid understanding of survey-based research, quantitative skills and mastery of key tools for competitive intelligence and big data analysis; Knowledge of Qualtrics or willingness to learn the Qualtrics platform.

The Marketing Team:

Enova's marketing department owns the brand identity, customer acquisition, and customer engagement efforts for Enova's portfolio of brands which serve consumer and small business market segments in the US and Brazil. We invest in a robust marketing mix which includes offline (TV, radio, print), partner marketing, digital (Programmatic, CTV, Social), and direct marketing tactics (mail, email, SMS) to drive new customer growth and deepen customer engagement. We've built a data driven, test and learn culture where individuals at all levels own programs that have a measurable, bottom line impact. Individuals who value solving problems, continuous learning, and collaborating with colleagues across product, analytics, and operations will find infinite opportunities to broaden their skill set and grow their career by rotating through brands and functions within marketing or even the broader Enova organization.
About Enova:
Enova is a leading financial technology company providing online financial services through its AI and machine learning powered lending platform. Enova serves the needs of non-prime consumers and small businesses, who are frequently underserved by traditional banks. Enova has provided more than 7 million customers with over $40 billion in loans and financing with market leading products that provide a path for them to improve their financial health. Want to learn more? Just ask any of our almost 1,500 employees.

Our goal at Enova, we believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Successfully manage the relationship with all stakeholders
Perform risk management to minimize project risks
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation

Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office. Experienced in data analytics and highly proficient in Excel, Tableau (or power VI), SQL, data visualization, modeling, data prep
Bachelor's degree required with at least 2 years experience in financial services

The Data Visualization Specialist will be responsible for supporting the analysis of internal and external datasets and the development of clear, compelling data products to inform evidence-based strategies for climate change mitigation, sustainability trends, and parametric design outputs. These data products may include reproducible figures, reports and presentations as well as interactive data visualizations and dashboards to be shared in SOM offices globally.
Under the supervision of the Sustainable Engineering Studio, a successful candidate will collaborate closely with Sustainability specialists and data analysis staff with SOM’s Office of Technology to translate analytical outputs into data products that directly inform design. While this position is not solely responsible for publishing original research, the Data Visualization Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining reproducible data workflows that facilitate collaborative analysis with SOM design teams worldwide.
The specific responsibilities and scope of work for this role are evolving. Key responsibilities are likely to include, but are not limited to, the following:
Updating annual and real time visualizations of firmwide data.
Working with project teams to visualize multi-object parametric optimizations.
Synthesis of large and complex external datasets, to support internal analyses, e.g., carbon, energy, and water reduction and projections.
Development of clear, compelling data visualization products, including figures, reports and presentations.
Development of decision-support tools and products, including dashboards and interactive visualizations.
Develop and maintain reproducible data workflows for both external and internal datasets, utilizing open source protocols like GitHub.
Performs large batch analysis of at least one of the following sustainable analysis: energy, daylighting, or solar radiation for building and master planning projects.
Remains current on issues related to sustainable and green building design.
Develops and works towards sharing visualization findings via an internal sustainability curriculum for the firm as a whole.
Other duties as required
Please note this job description contains only a partial listing of duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Qualifications :
Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Urban Design or Planning.
Be comfortable and knowledgeable of a wide range of reporting and visualization technologies, including Tableau and Adobe Creative Suite.
Experience analyzing large data sets using Excel (pivot tables, charts, formulas)
Demonstrated knowledge of sustainable and green building design and/or construction.
Demonstrated ability to perform independent research on sustainable strategies for building design, construction and operation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and commitment to work within the integrated design team structure
2-4 years of experience which reflects increasing responsibility in all phases of design/technical architecture and/or engineering.
Coursework, certificate, or boot camp in Data Visualization and Analytics preferred.
LEED accredited preferred.
BEMP accredited preferred.

We are adding a Senior Data Analyst to our team in Chicago, IL.

HNI Corporation (NYSE: HNI) is a manufacturer of workplace furnishings and building products, operating under two segments. As one of the larger employers in Iowa, HNI Corporation has been ranked by Industry Week magazine as one of the “Top 100 Best Managed Companies in the World”, by Fortune magazine as “The Most Admired Company” in the furniture industry; and named by Chief Executive Magazine as one of the world’s best companies for leadership development.

At Argo Group, our team members are critical to our long-term success – so wherever in the world they work, everyone works together. Within our Data Team, we are looking for a Senior Data Warehouse Analyst.

We are seeking a Senior Data Warehouse Analyst to serve as a liaison between business units and the current IT Data Team to gain in-depth understanding of data linked to each business process. The role will report to the Director of Data and will be key in understanding the business needs and aligning them with data team's strategy and architecture.

The focus of this position is to work closely with both the onshore and offshore data teams to ensure accurate and timely closing of the financial period and successful loading of data to the General Ledger. This role will also be responsible for developing a strong relationship with the finance team who we partner with the on the load of financial information.

What does the Senior Data Warehouse Analyst workday look like?
Facilitate process design by conducting business and systems process analysis; focusing on quality improvement and data management ensuring reliability and validity of data.
Collaborate closely with business teams to develop and implement technical requirements.
Guide team thru process of creating SQL Queries that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.
Research data issues in financial data warehouse and communicate the result of that research to stakeholders, and key business leaders.
Lead the process of loading externally sourced data to our financial data warehouse for posting to the general ledger monthly.
Work closely with offshore leadership team to align resources for month end processing and raising data flow processes when issues arise.
Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations.
Identify, develop and execute data control requirements, i.e. Reconciliations and validations.
Organize complex problems into simple solutions and precise business and technical requirements.
Ensure Balance and controls are in place for each data movement point, additionally responsible for reviewing those controls with the finance team to obtain sign off for posting to ledger.

What is required for the position?

Required Skills

5+ years of Structured data analysis and data requirements development experience is required.
3+ years of data analysis experience is required.
Strong SQL and Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytics tools
Prior experience with database and model design is preferred.
Experience with documenting data architecture, data flows, and business process flows is required
Ability to communicate complex information to others in a way they can understand.
Strong communication and negotiation skills are required.
Ability to work in fast paced, rapidly changing environment.

Experience

Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, mathematics, and statistics, or equivalent work experience.
Experience with documenting data architecture, data flows, and business process flows.
5+ years' experience with SQL databases, Snowflake experience is a plus.
3+ years ETL experience, Talend experience preferred
Leading Scrum/Agile teams is preferred, working knowledge of Agile is required.
3+ years of relevant work experience.
Experience with Oracle databases is a plus.
Insurance ideal, but not required.
Accounting/Finance experience is a plus.

Generate, maintain, and monitor key performance metrics and driving indicators that support business levers and operations.

Mentor less experienced analysts on standards and techniques to improve their accuracy and efficiency.

Advanced skills using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint.

Business Analyst

Job Location: Chicago, IL


Join our team


Centric Consulting is a management consulting firm that guides clients in the search for answers to complex digital, business and technology problems. We help clients conquer change, optimize processes, elevate technology, and best compete in a digital world. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. Headquartered in Ohio, with locations across the country and India, Centric has earned annual recognition by Forbes as one of America’s Best Management Consulting Firms since 2016. Visit our website to learn more. We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team.


In this role, you will:


Work with business subject matter experts and technical teams to gather project needs and translate them into functional and technical documentation.
Act as a general liaison between business and technical teams.
Create reference manuals, training material, and other technical documents as necessary.
Assist in the training of new users for the solution.
Work with test teams to enable the creation of test scenarios and plans.
Coordinate user acceptance testing with users.
Work with implementation teams to analyze and triage defects.
Work on agile projects (so, it’s a plus if you have experience writing user stories, creating acceptance criteria, stand-ups, product review sessions, backlog grooming meetings, retrospectives, sprint planning processes, and of automated testing processes).


A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:

At least 10+ years professional experience within a BA function
Previous top-tier management consulting experience (preferred)
Ability to lead client engagements and build stakeholder relationships and expectations
Ability to create unmatched experiences, for both clients and employees, is what we do. You should revel in doing the unexpected and extraordinary for others.
A learning mindset, ready to experience new ideas and situations regularly.
Consulting experience is strongly preferred. That said, you will also be considered if you have a strong industry background. We like to work in the communities we live in.
We want someone who likes to solve problems. Clients don’t come to us when the problem is easy. You should enjoy taking on the hard stuff.
And because we work with clients, excellent communication skills are important – both written and verbal. Translating technical concepts into layman’s terms is an essential skill.
Initiative is important. We don’t hand hold – you should be comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment. That said, collaboration is equally important. Our Chicago team and other [technologists or consultants] at Centric will give you an amazing support system. You will lean on them daily.


What makes Centric different?


Special Culture – Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each other. Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.
Growth opportunities – As a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.
Impact – We think of ourselves as a big company with a small company feel – a local player with global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences – We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Innovation – We value passion, determination, perseverance, and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good – We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.


Our core purpose at Centric Consulting is to bring unmatched experiences to clients and employees. These aren't just words we use — it's how we became a company and who we are today. Providing an unmatched experience means we approach each other as human beings and lead with empathy and humility. It means we work diligently to ensure our company is a place where everyone can create a sense of belonging and feel respected for who they are.

We know that creating and sustaining an authentically welcoming culture requires that we all play a part in fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion, from our business practice to how we show up for employees and communities. At Centric, we seek out and embrace candidates of all backgrounds and identities who have a hunger for learning, collaborating, and generating unmatched experiences. This is how we bring our mission and core values to life, working together to provide the highest value and quality services to our clients while enabling our employees to reach their full potential.

We value personal attributes such as integrity, work ethic, attitude and aptitude.

Provide guidance on and apply current best-practices for developing data models

Various data level tasks that pertain to the reporting including QA
Requirements

1-2 years developing data models for reporting and analysis

1-2 years performance tuning data models

Experience with GIT

Strong knowledge writing SQL queries with experience writing SAP SQL scripts and stored procedures

Experience using analytic privileges to restrict data in calculation views

Familiarity with an agile programming environment

An interest and aptitude for applications development

Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced environment

Experience with front-end SAP development using UI5 and Fiori elements and a good understanding of how queries are generated from the UI. *

Experience SAP development environments (WebIDE, BAS) *

Experience with SAP HANA, especially on Business Technology Platform *


Preferred, not required

About CONTAX

CONTAX is an SAP Gold Partner with nine offices in USA, Canada, Australia and The Netherlands and one of the fastest-growing SAP solutions companies in the world.

We provide challenging and meaningful careers for our team members, where we can learn and grow while working with purpose and meaning. We encourage each other to work hard and together we celebrate our successes.

We strive for excellence in everything we do and, while results matter, we also have to allow others the opportunity to make mistakes, as it's a critical part of the learning process. We are an entrepreneurial environment where everyone is given the opportunity to try, and take calculated risks where appropriate.

We strive to be good global citizens and make a positive impact in the communities in which we live and work.

We believe we have the most talented and dedicated team of SAP professionals in the industry. We're always hiring and always growing; and we'll hire talented people even when an opening doesn't exist. We plan to get bigger, better and stronger; and we're always looking for great people to join us on the journey.

Levelwing holds true to its core principles of Fundamentals, Transparency and Expectations. We seek out team members who embody what it means to be team players, intellectually curious, resilient, innovative, strategic and results driven. We invest in our employees’ personal and professional development producing marketing leaders and promoting from within. We do this while staying true to our purpose: to connect people to that which is valued.
SUMMARY:
The genesis of Levelwing nearly two decades ago was Analytics and Data Mining, forming the basis of our fundamentals-first approach. This initial rigorous focus on data was crucial in defining standards and processes that created tremendous media efficiency and great depth of insight. And while we have evolved into a multidisciplinary agency, this approach remains critical to everything we do.
Today, the Analytics Department services our clients through the pillars of data collection, data management, insight & analysis, and data science solutions. Permeating across all four pillars is our emphasis to translate an impactful and effective narrative through data storytelling. This data narrative focus lends well to our team’s purpose statement “to hold data to its highest potential through activation.”

As one of the larger employers in Iowa, HNI Corporation has been ranked by Industry Week magazine as one of the “Top 100 Best Managed Companies in the World”, by Fortune magazine as “The Most Admired Company” in the furniture industry; and named by Chief Executive Magazine as one of the world’s best companies for leadership development.
We invite you to visit us at www.HNICorp.com for the best visual overview of our organization.

The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will be part of the Enterprise Data Analytics team in the Information Technology department. The analyst will support the needs of Shirley Ryan AbilityLab researchers by utilizing the Enterprise Data Warehouse, REDCap, and interfaces between the two systems. The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will work with cross-functional stakeholders at the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab to help facilitate data requests, data engineering, and data collection for our researchers.


The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will consistently demonstrate support of the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab statement of Vision, Mission and Core Values by striving for excellence, contributing to the team efforts and showing respect and compassion for patients and their families, fellow employees, and all others with whom there is contact at or in the interest of the institute.


The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will demonstrate Shirley Ryan AbilityLab Core Attributes: Communication, Accountability, Flexibility/Adaptability, Judgment/Problem Solving, Customer Service and Core Values (Hope, Compassion, Discovery, Collaboration, & Commitment to Excellence) while fulfilling job duties.


Principal Responsibilities


Gathers, profiles, and analyzes data to support research requirements for data engineering and data collection.
Collaborates with research experts and staff from multiple business units to understand and implement research requirements.
Generates reports that ensure data integrity by applying data extraction and processing methods.
Performs data manipulation on large sets of data to facilitate identification of potential research participants and to produce data sets for statistical analysis.
Combines data from different sources and conducts source to target mapping.
Identifies trends and patterns in data and creates data visualizations.
Performs complex analysis including statistical regression and forecasting.
Drives analytical rigor across the organization to guide decision making in the context of research projects.
Performs other duties that may be assigned in the best interest of the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab.

Reporting Relationships

Reports to the Manager of Data Analytics in the Information Technology department.


Working Conditions

Normal office environment with little or no exposure to dust or extreme temperature.

Required Skills

Required Experience


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering or related field. Masters preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of related experience with a comprehensive knowledge of data modeling, database tools, and database concepts (e.g. relational databases, Enterprise Data Warehouses, data modeling for research etc.) and continues developing professional expertise.
Minimum of 2 years of SQL scripting experience required. PostgreSQL experience preferred.
Data cleaning, engineering, and munging experience with scripting and programming languages such as Python, PERL, Ruby, PHP, Java, R/Shiny, etc., as well as building interfaces using APIs. Strong preference for Python experience.
Hands-on Experience with the Research Electronic Data Capture (REDCap) application and the REDCap API.
Healthcare experience highly desired, especially familiarity with ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT, and other healthcare vocabularies, as well as HIPAA regulations as they relate to research.
Hands-on Experience with compiling data sets for research purposes and statistical analysis.
Hands-on Experience with clinical and behavioral research methods.
Hands-on Experience with electronic medical/health record systems (EMRs/EHRs), with preference for Cerner.
Hands-on experience with statistical software packages and data mining tools (e.g. R, Python, SPSS, Weka, etc.).
Hands-on experience with industry leading data visualization and BI tools (e.g. Business Objects, Microsoft PowerBI, Cognos, Tableau, OBIEE, Qlikview, Knowi, etc.).
Strong strategic, analytical, technical, and project management skills.
Demonstrated ability in engaging and communicating with stakeholders, across both business and technology functions.

Cúram Business Analyst – Chicago
Company Description
RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.
RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.
We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.
The Role
RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a Cúram Business Analyst as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a Business Analysts you will provide system analysis, development and production support as part of a large Cúram implementation project.
The Cúram Business Analyst will design functional approaches to customize functionality using the IBM Cúram Business Application Suite. The Business Analyst is also a lead team member in the planning and execution of testing, training, support of user testing and customer support post implementation.
Skills & Role Requirements
Must have experience using Cúram Business Application Suite

Experience in planning and leading JAD sessions and creating design documents

Lead requirement gathering sessions, according to agreed upon project scope for various areas of the application.

Participate in /lead systems analysis and gap analysis.

Produce client-approved deliverables required in standard project development including functional requirements, training content, job aids, use cases, requirements traceability matrix, test cases and plans.

Support team members through the development and testing of your functional designs.

Provide status reporting, quality assurance monitoring and ensure adherence to procedures

Excellent interpersonal skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Cúram certification preferred

Understanding of design and development concepts and familiarity with design patterns and the SDLC
All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:
A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.

A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.
Travel Requirements
The position offers the opportunity to travel, averaging from 35% to 55%. Project travel will vary throughout the project life cycle, being higher in the design and final testing and implementation phases. The position is based at our office in Chicago and our projects are located throughout the United States, and the Caribbean.
We Offer You
RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.
We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.
Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.

positionName: Finance Data and Rebates Senior Analyst - Work from Home Flexible
description:
CVS Health, a Fortune 5 company is hiring a Finance Data and Rebates Senior Analyst who will be responsible for supporting, investigating, and responding to internal and external manufacturer invoicing rebate questions for product application support (Data Reporting Portal) and for contract invoicing related data issues and trends.


This Finance Data and Rebates Senior Analyst will be a subject matter expert on all processes related to answering data-specific manufacturer rebate questions and producing specific reporting from a manufacturer rebate perspective. You will collaborate with key personnel and leaders in functional areas, not limited to the Manufacturer, DRP Customer Support Team, & Trade Org on questions along with when support ticket requests are initiated.


You will gain heavy insight into complex, varying contract terms and our data environment to be able to accurately help many of the initiatives. You will also be responsible for leading the successful roll out of additional process improvements, and projects related to the application.

Required Qualifications
2 or more years of experience (inclusive of internship experience) in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Analytics, Rebates, and/or related.

COVID Requirements
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.

If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Contract administration, financial and / or data analysis, and/or invoicing experienceProven problem solving and data analysis skillsKnowledge of pharmaceutical industry (PBM), drug products, and manufacturer rebate contractsProficiency using SQL, MicroStrategy, Teradata, and other business intelligence or reporting tools (Tableau)Proficiency using Microsoft Excel skills with the ability to work with large data sets

Education
Bachelor's Degree Required

Business Overview
At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

We Are Hiring:

We are hiring for a Pharmacy Finance Data Analyst at AMITA Health. This position will work partially remote but, travel to AMITA facilites will be required occassionally.
What You Will Do:

Collect and analyze data from multiple sources for the development of reports and statistical information.
Compile analytical and statistical reports as needed.
Formulate, define and recommend scope and format of reports.
Oversee provision of ad hoc management reports.
Review information for accuracy and reconciles data on a regular basis.
Provide support and education to staff on how to access reports and interpret the data.
Identify data trends and make recommendations for quality improvement.
What You Will Need:

Licensure / Certification / Registration:
Education:
High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required.
Additional Preferences:
Pharmacy claims experience preferred
Advanced Excel experience preferred
Retail or Hospital Pharmacy experience preferred
Why Join Our Team:

AMITA Health, one of the largest health systems in Illinois, is comprised of 19 hospitals and more than 230 sites of care. With more than 900 providers in its medical groups, 26,000 associates and 7,000 physician partners, AMITA Health serves over 6.6 million residents in the greater Chicagoland area.


We are committed to improving accessibility to healthcare in the communities we serve. We hold ourselves accountable to our patients and one another, and we work hard to treat the whole person, body, mind and spirit. Our compassionate, talented team members are the source of our strength, and we invest heavily in their well-being. We offer significant professional opportunities, career advancement potential, comprehensive training and competitive wages.

What We'll Bring:
At TransUnion, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We are consistently exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.


Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.
What You'll Bring:
3-6+ years of technical QA experience
2+ years of experience testing ETL processes or experience with data analytics platforms
2+ years of experience working on Linux or Unix systems
Experienced with test automation for ETL and analytics applications
Strong SQL skills
