Job: MARKETING
Organization: North America
Schedule: FULL_TIME
Req ID: 729

Description
SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time
Your innovation. Our impact. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater health for our communities, and greater experiences for our customers. Innovation is a top priority. Here, you’ll have an opportunity to work in a collaborative environment that brings together industry leaders and technology experts, so together we can drive the future of health care.
This is an exceptional opportunity to create solutions and programs that can truly make a difference at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
Senior Analyst, Data and Finance
**Position may be located within 50 miles of any Anthem Office**
As a Senior Analyst, Data and Finance, you’ll help shape the team’s portfolio and direction by applying financial and data analysis knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to directly influence the success of solutions and services that are transforming healthcare. You will work cross functionally across Innovation, engaging with every program and project to gather, inform, track, and refine their strategies, budgets, resources, as well as calculate and track ROI to ensure their success.
This is an execution focused role for someone who is skilled in aspects of data and financial analysis including areas such as statistical analysis, ROI analysis, forecasting, and managing complex datasets. Key to your success will be grit, the ability to navigate the complexities of a large organization, and a relentless drive to see solutions scale across the enterprise. You will be looked to as a trusted partner and problem solver, determinedly helping all stakeholders overcome obstacles and guiding solutions forward.
Responsibilities:
Own critical comprehensive analysis functions using statistical and financial techniques to create and manipulate complex datasets to identify trends, issues, opportunities, and anomalies, develop business cases, performance reports, financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and internal management reports.
Identify resource, risk, quality, cost, ROI, and develop program/project tracking plans in partnership with initiative leaders to scale high value, technology-enabled solutions and services from MVP through deployment at scale.
Conduct and document complex financial and business-related analysis and translate them into periodic and ad hoc reports, using numbers to present fact-based narratives and enable data-driven decision making.
Adept at managing timelines, presenting and communicating progress to executive teams.
Establish and maintain collaborative relationships to drive results.
Prioritize and execute multiple major projects/programs with broad scope and strategic business impact with minimal oversight.
Work collaboratively across a matrixed, cross-functional structure, and collaborate with a high-performance team.
Track outcomes and manage activities and program performance in accordance with budget and strategic direction.

Skills needed to thrive in this role:
Relentless focus on execution. Strong record of business, financial, and/or data analysis of complex, high-value technology-enabled solutions, ideally in the healthcare, insurance, financial, or technology sectors.
Skilled at presenting the results of complex statistical and financial modeling through data visualization in table and graphic format.
Excellent communication with an eye for detail, an ear for important items, and a focus on the concise and accurate analysis and presentation of data across emails, spreadsheets, presentations, meetings, and reports.
Strategic mindset and the ability to see and act within the bigger picture while connecting dots and finding opportunities for collaboration.
Skillful at building consensus and making thoughtful, data-driven recommendations for project / program prioritization, solution design, issue management, risk identification and mitigation
Excellent business judgment and a practical, common-sense approach to getting things done
Cross-functional communication to ensure all technical and non-technical. stakeholders can collaborate effectively and stay engaged throughout the lifecycle of a project
A “radar” for identifying when you or a struggling project needs additional guidance from leadership and being able to escalate it appropriately.
Ability to effectively collaborate and win the respect of your peers and stakeholders.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 5 years overall; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
3+ years of experience in driving data analysis, financial planning, statistical analysis.

Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated results with progressively increasing responsibilities and proven ability to manage multiple tasks, projects, and work with a geographically distributed team.
High proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with statistical/financial tools and modeling.

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

positionName: Data Analyst, Office of Student Support and Engagement
description:
Data Analyst, Office of Student Support and Engagement
Employer
Chicago Public Schools - CPS-1
Location
Chicago, IL, US
Salary
Competitive
Closing date
Oct 16, 2021
Job Category
Product, Services & Policy, Data / Analysis

Job Details
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments - student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.


The Office of Student Support & Engagement (OSSE) supports reform efforts to better engage families through the Community Schools Initiative, Out-of-School Time programming, and Attendance & Truancy procedures; and provides specific supports to engage historically marginalized and disenfranchised student populations: homeless students, youth in care, out-of-school and chronically absent students, and those with involvement in the juvenile justice system. The Data Analyst will assist in developing and implementing analysis to support the development and implementation of OSSE programming . The OSSE Data Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:


Typical Duties/Responsibilities:


Ensure data quality and integrity across OSSE Departments
Gather, analyze and track data for the development of on-going progress management of strategic plans
Track data for grant requirements for multiple federal and state grants and donations
Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council
Support analytic project planning, design and implementation across a variety of topic areas
Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques
Communicate with broad spectrum of stakeholders at varying levels
Participate in District's Data Analyst User Group
Perform related duties as required


In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the OSSE Data Analyst must possess the following qualifications:


Type of Education Required:


A bachelor's degree in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or related field including quantitative coursework;
Master's degree preferred


Type of Experience Required:


A minimum of five (5) years of professional experience in a role requiring data analysis, relationship management, and consultative skills


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


Must work with approved enterprise analytic toolsets (SAS or SQL)
Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS, R, SPSS, STATA, etc.) and the ability to use or learn SAS required
Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines
Ability to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across departmental boundaries
Flexibility to meet changing departmental needs and priorities
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously


Residency Requirement:


As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and must maintain residency throughout their employment with the district.

positionName: Avail - Business Intelligence (BI) Manager (Remote Home Based Worker)
description:
Avail is a car sharing service to help people get where they want to go–whether that’s to run errands, take an unforgettable road trip, or explore a new city–while helping locals earn cash from their unused cars. We are passionate about making shared transportation safe, simple, and affordable, and redefining what it means to own a car.
We’ve assembled some of the sharpest folks from across industries to compete against the antiquated system of traditional car rental. We put ideas into action and learn along the way in an open, collaborative work environment. As a part of Avail, you’ll make a direct impact and help build a business from the ground up. No matter where you’ve been, we’re always looking for fresh thinking and new perspectives.
Job Summary
The Business Intelligence Manager is responsible for influencing business strategy through data and analytics. The position is also responsible for anticipating change and proactively introducing and leading innovative data and analytics solutions. In particular, they will be a key leader on our Go-to-market and Marketplace Operations team, driving forward data-driven decisions that govern our marketplace dynamics. This team owns both the underlying analytics as well as the decision making on core marketplace questions like price and supply dynamics, making this an exciting opportunity to see projects from the analytical phase straight through to the implementation of your work
Key Responsibilities
Drive pricing, promotional, and owner payout analytics (among other topics) to directly inform company strategy
Partner closely with our Data Engineering team on the design and implementation of marketplace governing models that inform pricing, supply availability, and risk assessment of our customer base
Communicate business insights derived from data and analytics to those without technical skills
Lead projects from scoping straight through to execution and implementation of innovative data and analytics solutions to support business unit objectives
Provide data and analytics expertise to support and collaborate across functional units
Anticipate challenges to the business that can be addressed with data and analytics and develop proactive solutions
Preferred Qualifications
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Finance, Business, Economics, IT or related field, or equivalent experience7 years of data and analytics experience
Functional Skills
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience in different programming languages, including SQL and Excel (required), R experience a plusStrong communication skills, both written and verbal; in particular, able to synthesize and communicate complex analytical work to a broad audienceBonus: Experience with pricing and marketplaces are a big plus
Compensation Data
Compensation range for this position is $91,800 -$159,300 per year, based on experience and qualifications. Other compensation includes a yearly targeted bonus.
That’s the day to day, here’s the bigger picture.
Avail was founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2018. But you’ll be working for (and at) Avail. Our work environment blends the ingenuity and flexibility of a startup with the scale and strengths of a Fortune 100 company. Perks include a generous PTO policy, flexible working options, and a focus on leadership, wellness, and culture. We also offer 401k, health insurance, and other employment benefits for your future.
See a job you love? We encourage you to apply, even if your experience isn’t a perfect match.
Learn more about life at Avail. Connect with us on Instagram and LinkedIn.

Ashling Partners is at the forefront of the hyperautomation revolution! We help clients improve productivity and employee engagement by leveraging intelligent process automation, RPA, Process Intelligence, data capture/OCR and Machine Learning technologies. Our team leverages lean agile principles to make automation gains sustainable and a driving force for digital innovation. As a Business Analyst for Ashling Partners, you will serve as primary point of contact with assigned Intelligent Automation customers and liaise between customers and developers to ensure we deliver quality, excellence and value!

Founded by business process improvement & technology industry veterans, Ashling Partners values meaningful work for our employees while driving real value for our clients in a sustainable and continuous manner. We will always value progress over perfection. While doing so, we strive to continually build a positive, appreciative, and fun culture for our organization. Find us on the INC Best Workplace list for 2021!

Our rapidly growing organization is taking the world by storm, quickly becoming THE global boutique in intelligent automation. We are looking for life-long learners and servant-leaders who are passionate about innovation and the future of work. If this sounds like a place for you, we would love to meet you!


What You Will Do:

Serve as primary point of contact with assigned Intelligent Automation customers and liaise between customers and developers
Support customers by providing answers, expertise, and insights as needed
Conduct site visits to customers, travel up to 25% when warranted
Create Business Cases and ROI for all automation projects
Collaborate with the developers to ensure customers' development requirements are accurately captured for automation projects
Be informed on intelligent automation solutions and use cases to better inform customers on capabilities
Support the governance of the lifecycle/process
Develop and track metrics and financial projections for each automation/solution
Facilitate email communications between clients
Accountable for high client NPS (net promoter score) to ensure we deliver quality, excellence and value
Support sales team by defining project complexity and total hours needed from Business Analyst resources for new projects


What You Will Bring:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Experience with RPA Tools such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism a plus
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Advanced knowledge in generating process documentation including process flows, as-is/to-be documentation, and process design documents (pdds)
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Lifelong learner mindset
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and management skills
Understanding of Agile SDLC


Why Ashling Partners:

At Ashling Partners, we strive to provide meaningful work in a positive, appreciative and fun culture for our own team. All firm members are referred to as "Ohana," the Hawaiian word for family, with regards to extended family beyond relatives. The concept emphasizes that extended families are bound together by a common belief, attitude or purpose and members must cooperate and remember one another.

Lifelong Learning - In the intelligent automation space change happens fast, in order to support that change, Ashling has developed a culture that enables lifelong learners to continuously develop their skill sets
Consistently Innovate with Cutting Edge Technology – We offer a continuous model for performance improvement and the opportunity to work with best of breed automation technology stacks
Provide Servant-Based Leadership – We believe the leader's role is to serve the organization, not the other way around
Practice Stewardship – We work together as peers, regardless of a person's formal role or authority in the organization
Be Entrepreneurial in Management – We empower people to bring ideas and challenge them with the responsibility to make them successful
Offer Open-Book Finance – We give everyone the opportunity to see the books, how we are being measured and what our score is, so they can feel empowered to impact success
Provide the Best Service – We may not be the cheapest, but we will deliver the best value to our clients
Make Data-Driven Decisions – We are a data-driven organization internally and externally
Be a fun place to work - We provide a positive, appreciative and fun culture


What Sets Us Apart:

Quarterly book allotment (any book of your choice, no cap!)
Uncapped training allotment
Unlimited holidays
Unlimited PTO!
Immediate 401K contributions

The Role

We are looking for an exceptionally motivated Business Analyst to be part of a highly visible, strategic team focused on aligning strategic objectives with tactical demands. This role will be responsible for the business aspects of implementation, rollout, and support of MS Dynamics Supply Chain Management suite.

This role will collaborate with the MS Dynamics technology configuration team to ensure that the solution is configured to best meet the evolving needs of the business. This is a unique and "greenfield" opportunity to join a fast-paced organization and build an excellence center, with clear and tangible impacts on the future of Green Thumb. This role will be required to be on site in our Chicago and / or Rolling Meadows, IL offices and require up to 25% travel.

Responsibilities
Participate in solution definition workshops and collaborate with Green Thumb's various subject matter experts for business operations along with the MS Dynamics technical configuration team to define the overall business process from a technical configured solution perspective.
Work with the Green Thumb business and IT teams to collate existing legacy data that needs to be converted and uploaded to the new solution.
Collaborate with the functional and IT teams to convert legacy data into formats and content as required for the new solution.
Participate in business requirements and configuration workshops while learning business processes and related solution configurations for the global template to be used for rollout of the solution to all sites.
Work closely with Green Thumb's configuration team while implementing the initial corporate site and learning the GTI implementation process.
Participate and conduct user acceptance testing, when required, and guide the user base in creating test scripts and other solution artifacts.
Train business user groups on use of the new solution as per the documented business processes and configured solution.
Support the definition of the business processes through documentation, creating standard operating procedures and process flows.
Provide day-to-day functional support to the user groups to resolve issues, provide clarifications and be the initial point of contact, while taking ownership of the solution while escalating system issues to the solution provider as needed.
Maintain all aspects of the ERP system from a business use standpoint, including but not limited to facilitating system configuration, master data management and any related ad-hoc activities.
Effectively participate in all stages of the ERP software configuration and implementation lifecycles, followed by day-to-day functional support.
Conduct ad hoc analyses, special projects, and other duties as assigned.


Qualifications
BA/BS Degree with specialization in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Business, Information Systems or Operations
1+ years of experience with ERP Implementations, business process definition, supply chain management or similar role is preferred but not required
Business process analysis and mapping experience with excellent documentation skills
Self-starter with high motivation and passion to thrive and adapt in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment
Ability to assess and understand details of work product(s) or related business information
Customer-oriented, ability to self-manage and take ownership
Proficient written and verbal communication skills with the proven experience facilitating large stakeholder meetings
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Ability to work closely with stakeholders and determine acceptable solutions
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations
Planning, organizational, and time management skills
Competency in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams
Operates with a high level of professionalism and integrity, including dealing with confidential information
Must understand and comply with the rules, regulations, policies, and procedures of Green Thumb
Additional Requirements
Must pass any and all required background checks
Must be and remain compliant with all legal or company regulations for working in the industry
Must possess valid driver's license
Must be a minimum of 21 years of age

location: 1666 East Touhy Avenue, Des Plaines, IL 60018
description:
About the role:

This position collects and analyzes International and North America sales data on customer purchasing and out-the-door/tracing data activity. Performs North America sales commission calculations, researches sales data variances, identifies trends, communicates results interpretation and recommends course of action. Assists Marketing Commercial Sales Director, Marketing, Sales Management, Regional Managers, Accounting and School/Institution Account Managers in business activities related to sales analysis.
What you will do:
Track North American and International purchases and out-the-door sales, analyze data for the calculation of sales commission and commission forecasts. Work with accounting to audit results of commission calculations.
Measure North American sales team performance to plan monthly through Tableau dashboards. Calculate sales awards annually.
Work with Dealers to obtain accurate transfer sales data. Convert data into useful information and deliver a true picture of North American out-the-door territory sales.
Partner with IT and CRM Analyst on dealer end-user transactional data management.
Perform all Dealer rebate analysis/updates and recommend monthly accruals for these programs.
Track International sales and partner with CRM Analyst to report performance.
Support sales management with new territory breakout when needed and recommend territory sales volume.
Run and analyze trends of out-the-door sales reports by dealer by product line/material for sales/marketing team.
Run various monthly sales tracking reports, free good reports and distribute to the sales team, customer service, sales and marketing management, and the executive team on a monthly basis.
Assist in managing/reporting on external market share/competitive data.
Work with IT department to streamline monthly reporting processes.
Complete other duties as requested.
What we are looking for:
Minimum of 3 years sales or financial analyst experience required.
Bachelor’s degree required; Bachelor’s in Business, previous experience in Finance, IT, Marketing or Data Analytics a plus.
Strong analytical skills: Recognizing patterns in data, information, or events, drawing logical conclusions, and making recommendations action
Strong communication skills: Listening effectively transmitting information accurately, understandably, and actively seeking feedback non-defensively
Planning & organization: Anticipating and drawing inferences about the future and structuring resources and actions in a logical manner. Establishing a course of action to ensure work is efficiently completed.
Productivity: Taking the lead in getting the job done in an effective and efficient manner and accepting responsibility for personal actions, results and costs. Taking prompt action to go beyond what is expected.
Ability to work with teams: Building collaboration among individuals, sharing information and resources, and working to achieve group goals and outcomes.
Can work independently, self-motivated: Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks as committed; self-imposing standards.
Creativity: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and good in brainstorming setting.
Advanced PC skills: Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Information Systems
Detailed oriented
Working Conditions/Physical Demands
General office conditions apply. Sitting, standing, very little lifting (less than 10% of the time and no more than 20 lbs). Good lighting and no special vision requirements, although employees may spend significant amounts of time in front of a computer. Quiet conditions. No exposure to outside, extreme weather, or hazardous conditions.

Job Overview


As the Sales Analyst supporting the KDP Business, you will directly report to a Senior Sales Director and his team of National Account executives responsible for Albertsons. Company Overview
Make a difference... a big difference. You will have the opportunity, in a unique and dynamic culture, to be a part of something meaningful. We’re a disruptive startup with an inspiring mission. Learn and grow alongside our world-class team of print, operations, technology, and data leaders, dedicated to building a company that cares for all their clients like they were our own family. Our team and board members have decades of experience; with their support, we look forward to building on solid fundamentals.
The Role
Technology does amazing things in our daily lives, yet often is a source of pain and confusion within our industry. We want to empower Sepire to deliver a world-class customer experience with simple, flexible technical systems. If we need to delve into the murky underbelly of print and mailing to do that, we’re up for the challenge. We’re currently building with Angular, .Net Core, MSSQL, GraphQL, TypeScript, all on Azure; and we think it’s a pretty awesome stack.
We want product analyst-owners with the judgment to simultaneously solve for short and long-term business value. We’re looking for folks who have worked in complex domains and systems and come through it with some wisdom but most importantly humility. We want people who are passionate about building great technology to solve problems for users—our clients, our colleagues, and ourselves.
Whether you have a decade of experience or not, we are excited to learn from and share knowledge with you. Our leadership team includes seasoned alumni of digital print, consulting and technology organizations. Our founders deeply understand and care about good technology.
Responsibilities and Duties
Works to remove impediments or guide the team to remove impediments by finding the right personnel.
Manage and assist the team and product owners to groom and maintain the product backlog, including prioritization and additional opportunities.
Ensures observance of DOD (Definition of Done).
Forecasts the number of software enhancements possible in sprint, based on evidence and reliable source.
Collaborate on new training materials. Identifies need and integrates collaboration of cross functional training materials.
Assists in preparing communications to both inform and request action associated with delivering new capabilities and addresses problems. Provides coaching, training, conflict resolution and problem-solving assistance to digital team members.
Communicate status Feature/Sprint summary via weekly meeting and report.
Collaborate with internal and external business stakeholders.
Performs other related duties as assigned which may include:
Review, analyze, and evaluate customer needs to produce system requirement documentation for ecommerce systems.
Write user stories/requirements along with associated acceptance criteria.
Maintain use cases.
Work with business partners to design, develop, and execute user acceptance testing plans.
Attributes to Success
Experience coupled with a willingness to learn new things
Comfort with uncertainty and a desire to be close to business problems
Desire to contribute individually, with the ability both to self-direct work and to collaborate with others on the technology team
Understanding of many technologies down to first principles, and a desire to add more to the list
Desired Skills & Experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment
[3-8]+ years working as an individual contributor with an attention to details
Experience with our specific stack components a bonus but not required

description:
Shift: Full time, Days, Weekend as needed

Reporting to the Laboratory IT Manager, the Epic Beaker Application Analyst is responsible for application build, support , and project lead/participation related to Epic/LIS solutions for the laboratory.
Working with a highly skilled collaborative team this position will ensure the efficiency, stability, security and accessibility of all supported applications for the NCH laboratory users and their workflows/business processes according to agreed upon standards.


1. Collaborates with laboratory management and staff along with other Epic representatives within the NCH community to ensure our systems meet the organization’s business needs. Performs in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details, and other technical tasks associated with Epic software. Works closely with Epic representatives and other NCH Epic teams to fully understand integration, project-level decisions and standards. Monitors internal and external system processes daily for error correction and preventative maintenance. Creates reports to detect and diagnose application system problems. Reviews reports from the system for errors and preventative maintenance. Monitors system processes and files for errors, potential problems, and optimum functionality, including system and instrument interfaces.


2. Applies knowledge obtained in Epic training, to guide and complete application building and testing. Understands application specifications and end users’ preference while making build decisions. Analyzes business operations as they relate to build decisions. Prioritizes and implements requested changes to the system within change management structure and procedures. Analyzes new functionality in releases to determine how it should be used, collaborating with end user community to support workflow and business processes.


3. Reviews and tests each new release. Collects information regarding potential system enhancement needs. Prepares details of specifications as needed. Analyzes data conversion needs. Ensures that data coming across an interface into an Epic application meets the business need. Develops and documents internal procedures to use in conjunction with Epic applications.


4. Sets standards for naming and numbering conventions and security classifications using the Epic tools provided. Maintains rules for how each new version is released and establishes change control processes and procedures for the system.


5. Maintains data integrity for all supported systems. Continuously evaluates system(s) to ensure maximum use and efficiencies. Recommends system solutions that can aid in process improvement. Designs and conducts periodic data audits with users. Analyzes and recommends changes to realize the benefits derived from the system (s), and coordinates change management.


6. Supports other affected applications as appropriate. This includes communication and coordination with other vendors and/or IT staff related to 3rd party applications which may interact/interface with Epic.


7. Adheres to all Northwest Community Hospital standards, policies and procedures.

Qualifications
1. The level of knowledge usually obtained through the completion of a Bachelor’s degree in a computer related field, Healthcare related field or the equivalent work experience.

2. A minimum of two years relevant experience in a Laboratory IT environment. Medical Technologist and Laboratory IT experience preferred.

3. Strong knowledge/experience in one or more of the following preferred: Laboratory clinical workflows and processes, Laboratory IT application build, support, and maintenance.

4. Experience in continual improvement and best practices by identifying and diagnosing improvement opportunities preferred

6. Epic certification in Beaker. Must have or complete Epic Beaker certification within 90 days of hire to continue employment.

8. The ability to lead meetings, provide user training, prioritize, resolve conflicts, maintain issues lists, and follow a project plan.

9. Strong communication and follow-up skills; solid understanding of escalation processes.

10. The ability to probe for information about the underlying needs of the organization and user community, to optimize build of system and ultimately end user support.

11. The interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with users, vendors, external agencies, and NCH staff, providing positive customer.

12. The ability to handle difficult clients and situations in a professional and courteous manner.

13. The computer skills necessary to support PC and network based applications, and basic network concepts.

14. Strong problem solving skills; ability to deal with problems involving abstract variables in non-standard situations.

15. The ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.

16. The organizational skills necessary to multi-process in day to day activity and to concentrate and focus attention on the details of the task at hand.

17. The ability to read, write and comprehend detailed instructions, short correspondence, and memos.

18. The ability to present information effectively in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, other associates and management of Northwest Community Healthcare.

19. The ability to work a varied schedule, on-call hours, and be prepared to work long hours during crisis situations.

We’re looking for a Digital Marketing Data Analyst – Int. responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting relevant data to evaluate the effectiveness of the digital marketing team as well as identifying business trends and opportunities relevant to digital marketing. This role will ensure the integrity of such data, will generate reports that verify and document their accuracy and will work with business teams to ensure reporting needs are met. Types of data include, but are not limited to, website metrics, revenue, user experience, and various collateral.
Our corporate headquarters is located in Chicago, IL. Employees work two days in the corporate office and can work remotely the remaining three days of the workweek. We offer retirement benefits plus vision, dental and medical benefits, as well as a paid holiday and PTO package.
Responsibilities:
Ensures data is acquired on time, accurately, and that it is disseminated properly.
Creates and maintains ongoing reports based on key business metrics.
Interprets and analyzes results using statistical techniques.
Develops easy-to-understand and legible data visualizations for business users.
Identifies performance indicators and meets with program owners to determine the best courses of action.
Analyzes large amounts of data, identifies patterns, and reports on trends.
Forecasts using prediction models.
Engages with external vendors and internal customers to prioritize business and information needs.
Gathers program metrics from internal and external sources.
Optimizes and efficiently collects data by implementing a database collection system.
Defines processes and improvement opportunities regarding data collection and reporting.
Improves the quality of data collected from various sources and maintains clean databases.
Supports web tracking for programs, website improvements, and testing.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications & Requirements:
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in design or technology from a four-year college or university, plus five years' related experience and/or training, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technical prowess using a wide variety of analytical tools including, but not limited to, Excel, Tableau, Python, SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail.
Experienced with conducting queries, report writing, and presenting findings
Strong ability to write Excel formulas and apply statistical and analytical mathematical concepts to solve problems.
Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into system issues and products, as required.
Excellent people skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and interpersonal skills that foster good, mutually respectful working relationships.
Effective time-management skills; able to work individually and as part of a team under tight deadlines with changing priorities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience reporting on financial impacts of business initiatives and making presentations to management.
Organized and detailed-oriented, with a keen eye for quality control of work.
Proactive self-starter, with the ability to work independently with little supervision and accomplish goals promptly.
Experience with planning and implementing strategies for email programs.
Proficient in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Word.
Strong interest in the latest technologies and tools available for analytics.

Columbia College Chicago is an acclaimed undergraduate and graduate institution that provides a comprehensive education in the arts, communications and public relations. We constantly aim to reach our full potential as an educational innovator, incubator of new creative practice and generator of real-world success for young creatives. We are located in the heart of Chicago, across the street from historic Grant Park, and housed in some of the most iconic buildings in the South Loop.
Columbia College Chicago a private urban institution of over 6,000 undergraduate and graduate students, four-year College offering a distinctive curriculum that blends liberal arts, creative and media arts and business is currently searching for a Business Analyst.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Business Analyst is responsible for providing functional and technical support and guidance in the utilization of the college’s primary business system (PeopleSoft HCM and Peoplesoft Financials). The Business Analyst will partner with Controller’s Office, HR office, Budget office and Information Technology to optimize PeopleSoft application configurations and drive adoption of global best practices and standards.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBLITIES
Serve as primary liaison for assigned departments including Controller’s Office, Human Resources and Budget Reporting and Analysis. Provide technical and/or functional support, collaborate on projects and trouble shoot system related issues.
Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncover areas for improvement, develop, and implement solutions.
Assist with the management and support of integrations between PeopleSoft and external systems.
Assist in the configuration and maintenance of business system settings such as: look-up tables, workflow rules, PeopleSoft trees, security settings, etc.
Work with functional team leads to identify new functionalities and technical improvements.
Assist the Data and Analytics team in delivering report generation and data analysis.
Provide guidance and technical support to customers and stakeholders who want to use business tools provided (assisting with configuration and providing overviews of the tools).
Gather and document requirements from business owners and/or business analysts, prepares functional design documents.
Assist in the creation of process documentation and user tools; provide user support, training, and process improvement.
Develop database queries for business system databases as needed.
Assist with root cause analysis of production issues.
Review, prioritize and troubleshoot tickets submitted by other departments regarding issues with PeopleSoft. Re-assign tickets to the applicable support resource.
Provide support for system upgrades, enhancements, testing, validation and overall performance; analyze software releases to assess impact of new features.
Work closely with end-users to gather project requirements and ensure proper testing/validation.
Support user acceptance testing on project implementation.
Train end-users on business systems functional report generation and interpretation of data.
Perform other related duties and/or responsibilities as assigned or required.

Qualifications
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Analysis or related field or equivalent combination of experience, education and training.
Minimum of 5 years of technical experience with PeopleSoft applications.
A minimum of 5 years work-related database management and report writing experience.
Demonstrated project management, planning, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Extensive functional experience in the PeopleSoft Financials and HCM/Payroll product line.
Experience with PBCS a plus.
Experience with Taleo a plus.
Must possess strong query language skills (SQL, etc.).
Extensive experience with advanced PeopleSoft Query report writing.
Demonstrated project management, planning, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels and communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner with demonstrated ability to modify content based on the audience.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and individually.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to interact with cross functional teams to exchange information and create a positive and productive team dynamic.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee and is subject to change based on the needs of the department and/or college.
At Columbia, we offer a rewarding work environment for our faculty and staff. We take pride in offering competitive benefits with affordable health, dental and vision coverage; flexible spending accounts; commuter benefit program, life and accidental, death & dismemberment coverage; paid and unpaid leave options; work/life benefits; educational assistance programs; and retirement and financial planning benefits.
We invite you to join our talented faculty and staff and become part of our collective aspiration to ensure Columbia prepares students for success in their creative fields through innovation, engagement and real-world experiences.

Position subject to a background screening.
This is a non-union position.
This position is not overtime eligible.

Company Description
CapTech is a team of master builders, creators, and problem solvers who help clients grow efficient, successful businesses. We unite diverse skills and perspectives to transform how data, systems, and ingenuity enable each client to advance what’s possible in a changing world.
As perceptive partners, our U.S-based consultants find inspiration in the unknown and enjoy getting our hands dirty solving our clients’ myriad of challenges. Across industries and business goals, we fuse technical depth and analytical prowess with creative savvy to move clients forward. This drive helps each organization use technology, management, and insight to turn ideas into action. Together, we create outcomes that exceed the expected — which is one of the reasons we’ve been on the Inc. 500/5000 list for over a decade.

Job Description
Business System Analysts (BSA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BSAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration and modernization efforts spanning multiple lines of business. BSAs at CapTech bridge the gap between business and technology to ensure solutions provide the value the business needs as well as being scalable and maintainable to support the ever-changing needs of the organization. CapTech BSAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.
Specific responsibilities for the Business System Analyst position include:
Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.
Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.
Assist the technical team in solution design including data modeling, interface design, and state transition definition.
Analyze data to understand the current state data structures and quality and how the data might impact the business objectives of the client.
Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.
Evaluate the current state of an organization and work with the client to define the desired future state
Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.
Coordinate integration and user acceptance testing activities.
Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.

Qualifications
Specific qualifications for the Business System Analyst position include:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.
Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.
Experience creating sequence, data flow, and process flow diagrams that visualize the future state.
Awareness of object-oriented development practices and the ability to define objects within an organization and individual processes.
Understanding of modern IT architecture solutions (Cloud, APIs, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.
Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries required.
Software development work or education experience preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as agile project management software (e.g. JIRA).
Prior consulting experience preferred.
Additional Information
We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands-on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.
At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:
Competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunities
Single and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverage
Short-Term and Long-Term disability
Matching 401(k)
Competitive Paid Time Off
Training and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursement
Team building and social activities
Mentor program to help you develop your career
CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.
Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or “corp to corp” agreements). At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.
CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.
Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTech’s client locations.
All positions include the possibility of travel.
CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.

About You:

positionName: Senior Analyst - Digital & Marketing Product Management
description:
Job Summary:

Applies business knowledge and facilitative expertise to gather and create functional requirements and use cases to meet business initiatives. Analyzes business and user needs, documents requirements, and translates into solutions. Performs as the link between business users, Consumer Experience and Technology.

Job Responsibilities:

Plans and directs the analysis and gathering of functional requirements used in the design (e.g. use cases and process flows) of based on business requirements documents. Analyzes business and functional requirements to ensure that all requirements have been discovered and addressed. Works with cross functional teams to create uses case in conjunction with mobile product solutions.Schedules and conducts requirements gathering sessions and helps to coordinate the review and signoff of deliverables. Provides status reports and contributes to work plan updates.Provides expertise through the interpretation, synthesis and translation of business requirements throughout the development lifecycle. Provides expertise across Mobile Products area. Recommends ideas to solve business unit issues and add value and streamline processes which in effect contribute to the overall business unit’s strategy. Supports existing functionality and systems which require maintenance and support.Acts as liaison with IT, Consumer Experience and business groups to facilitate necessary discussions.Serves as testing liaison with the Quality Assurance area to support the testing efforts by data analysis and validation from functional tests. Assists in development of User Acceptance Test scripts and works with the business users to conduct UAT.Contributes and assists in the origination of training and communication documentation. Conducts training on new features and enhancements as neededAttends training and educational opportunities to continue employee growth and advancement.Gathers client, user and consultant feedback and analyzes data and proposes actionable items based on information.Leads, organizes and finalizes review sessions. Obtains sign-off of requirements documents and design with business clients, legal and privacy office. Conducts demonstrations prior to and following implementation to ensure that the requestors and stakeholders’ needs are fully addressed and will be fulfilled by the completion of this initiative.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and at least 3 years of experience with business analysis and/or reporting data OR a High School Diploma / GED and at least 6 years of experience with business analysis and reporting data

At least 3 years of experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results

Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems.

Experience building and maintaining relationships within a team.

Experience gathering/collecting business requirements, such as product search / browse, registration, and checkout in an Internet-based business environment

Experience in consumer-facing online commerce

Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Information System

Experience in the retail industry

Basic level skill in SQL (build queries, add, modify, and delete data; create and maintain tables, query and update databases using SQL statements, etc.)

Experience in digital health or the pharmaceutical/healthcare industry

Knowledge of mobile technologies

Experience working as a Business Analyst in an Internet-based business environment

Who We Are:
Atkore is forging a future where our brands, suppliers, employees, customers, partners, and communities are building better together – a future focused on empowering our customers while we power and protect the world.
Atkore is a leading manufacturer and distributor of electrical, mechanical, and safety infrastructure solutions. With approximately 3,900 employees and 65 manufacturing and distribution facilities worldwide, we manufacture electrical conduit, cable management systems, armored cable, metal framing, and security products and solutions.
Who We Are Looking For:
We’re looking for an experienced JD Edwards ERP Procure-to-Pay (P2P) expert to help us transform our North American operations to a single and common JD Edwards-enabled solution. The Sr. Business Analyst will be the primary contact person for everything related to the current JD Edwards ERP system, including becoming familiar with the business processes and requirements that drive how the ERP system is implemented, deployed and updated. Ultimately, this position is responsible for Atkore’s ongoing P2P system functionality, service and support. This person will report to the Senior Director of IT Applications and will work closely with all ERP user groups across Atkore International, including Sales, Finance, Customer Service, Production, Order Management, Warehousing and Distribution.
What You’ll Do:
ERP Digital Roadmap Support:
Act as IT leader responsible for the successful design, build, test, and implementation of Atkore’s North American P2P solution.
Support the incremental and phased implementation of the P2P solution across multiple facilities.
Become Atkore’s P2P solution expert for future digital roadmap efforts.
ERP Support and Implementation:
Initiate and lead ERP-related projects and enhancements in the Procure-to-Pay functions
Thoroughly understand company business practices and procedures in order to design, develop and maintain automated workflow processes.
Work with ERP systems users and management across the organization to determine appropriate system configuration and setup.
Create documentation and procedural guidelines for ERP systems users.
ERP Maintenance & Ongoing Development:
Provide day to day support to ERP users.
Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve ERP system issues reported by end users.
Design, develop and maintain reports used by ERP systems users.
Understand ERP security subsystem in order to assign appropriate system access to users at different levels throughout the organization and its partners.
Maintain current knowledge and understanding of ERP applications and computer hardware operating systems.
Conduct in-depth tests for modified and new systems or applications.
Produce user documentation for applications developed.
Customer Partnership and Support:
Participate in internal Lean and Kaizen events in customer areas.
Support customer initiatives and operational activities.
Attend customer KPI reviews and meetings as requested.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What You Bring:
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related/relevant field.
Strong business knowledge of the J.D. Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.1 (“JDE ERP”) package with specific focus on Procure-to-Pay (P2P), Transportation Management Systems (TMS) and Master Data supporting those functions.
At least 5 years’ experience implementing enterprise IT applications, defining and mapping business processes, and understanding integration between various applications. It’s also a plus if you have experience with distributed application development in a client/server environment.
A proven record of strong internal customer service, on-time and on-budget completion of projects and enhancements, and continuous improvement of the capabilities within your function.
Large scale, multi-site, program implementation experience and PMP certification (we aren’t requiring these, but we do prefer them).
A formal structured problem-solving certification such as Six Sigma (this would be a plus).
Strong business acumen and understanding of business operations, along with good communication and documentation skills, and experience working with all levels of staff to define business and technical requirements.
An ability to get support and buy-in for recommendations and decisions.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to deliver commitments while managing multiple priorities. This will require familiarity with the development life cycle and its implementation.
Within 3 Months, You’ll:
Complete your new hire “Immersion” so that you are ready to rock in your new role.
Have developed relationships with the key stakeholders for this role.
Be well-versed in Atkore’s procurement processes as well as business and IT solutions.
Be able to provide limited customer support for production down and continuous improvement activities.
Within 6 Months, You’ll:
Have started to become a subject matter expert for Atkore-specific business processes and IT solutions.
Be a competent problem-solver and providing full production support with limited assistance.
Be able to make recommendations regarding business processes and IT solutions.
Within 12 Months, You’ll:
Completely own Atkore’s P2P solution portfolio.
Autonomously make decisions regarding P2P solutions, and be seen as Atkore’s go-to person.
Be able to strategically identify needed improvements, changes, and modifications and turn those ideas into action.
Translate Atkore’s business strategy into needed IT capabilities for P2P.
Atkore is committed to creating an engaged and aligned workforce that drives collaborative culture. Our team strives for breakthrough results, stays focused on being standout leaders, and fully supports decisions of the Company. We consistently live the Atkore mission, strategic priorities, and behaviors, all in a way that’s consistent with our core values. Together, we build strong leaders that continually endeavor to move us forward.

Details
Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.
Position Summary:
Skilled and motivated Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join a team enabling Personal Auto and Homeowners insurance operations gain data driven insights. This team partners with product, underwriting, operations, sales and marketing to develop insights and analysis/reports and to facilitate the Personal Insurance business, including development and maintenance of underlying data tables to bring new and existing products to market. The team also designs and programs new processes and dashboards. This position is located at our corporate headquarters in downtown Chicago, IL.

Position Responsibilities:
Works with business partners through the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data using data querying and development
Designs and develops new reports, dashboards, data tables, etc. to provide speed-to-data insight
Enhances the efficiency, automation, and accuracy of existing reports
Works cross functionally on business solutions as directed to develop and deliver sophisticated analytic solutions that support strategic business initiatives
Follows best practices in data querying and manipulation to ensure data integrity
Effectively communicates information to technical and non-technical audiences

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
As a member of JLL/T Solutions team, the Senior Solutions Consultant will work collaboratively with cross-functional team members in the development and management of real estate and facility management solutions that we implement for key clients. Responsibilities include assisting with continuous improvement and enhancement efforts, operational support activities, troubleshooting, special projects, and ongoing business support. The successful candidate should have a strong foundational knowledge of real estate solutions and business processes, have a willingness to learn, possess a drive to exceed expectations, and be a great verbal and written communicator. In return, we offer a role that will keep you engaged and challenged in a fast-paced environment and provide broad experiences to help you further develop your professional skill set.
The JLL/T Solutions team delivers successful technology-based solutions to meet our clients' needs in a high-growth and fast-paced environment. The team’s mission is focused on accelerating technology adoption in the corporate real estate domain by bringing creative, innovative, and compelling technical solutions to solve large, complex problems for our customers.

What this job involves:
Have deep knowledge of the IWMS product (TRIRIGA)
Partner with the BA, solution architect and technical lead as needed to translate business requirements into a functional design for use in functional testing and measuring successful delivery
Verify solution requirements by partnering with development and testing teams
Create and maintain key documentation for project deliverables like functional design in JAMA or a FDD
Collaborate closely with the development team in implementing the solution
Responsible to develop and execute test cases or work with the QA team for the development & execution of test cases
Responsible for system testing and user acceptance testing project test phases
Ensure consistency and integrity of best practices for documentation by partnering with colleagues
Ensure delivered solution meets the project business requirements

Sound like you? Before you apply it’s worth knowing what we are looking for…

Experience:
Minimum 5 years’ experience with business analysis or functional real estate knowledge in a professional services industry
Experience and understanding of multiple real estate business process areas (e.g., site acquisition/build out/refurbishments, lease administration, occupancy planning or maintenance management, etc.)
Experience gathering and documenting requirements through facilitating working sessions with subject matter experts
Experience during the implementation of an IWMS/EAM system and understanding of the deployment lifecycle.
Strong technical aptitude including experience with cloud-based services and products and fundamental data analysis skills
Experience leading large meetings with many senior stakeholders
Experience creating and delivering presentations to senior client leadership

Self-starter with a passion for continuous improvement
High attention to detail and accuracy, and well organized
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, able to interact with all levels in the organization

Comfortable with constantly evolving and changing priorities, enjoys new challenges

positionName: Senior Data Analyst - Advanced Analytics - Remote
description:
Job Locations: US-IL-Lisle Your Opportunity:

As a Sr. Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics in the Finance Data Analytics department, you will be responsible for maintaining, improving, and building new data analytics models for cross-functional areas of the business. You will develop a deep understanding of operational processes and use what you learn to develop practical predictive models that have immediate business impact. You will partner with teams in various functional areas of the business. You will be responsible for building analytical models, uncovering insights, and explaining those insights to your business partners. You will also be involved in ad hoc analysis of large datasets to quickly provide information for decision making.
Employee will have the capacity to work 90-95% remote.
Core Responsibilities:
Develop predictive analytics models to uncover insights about the business, using advanced statistical methods and machine learning.
Build reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and other reporting tools to communicate results of analysis.
Build automated processes using scripting tools (Python/R/SQL/Alteryx)
Hold training sessions on how to use the various tools and reports created by the department
Communicate effectively with report stake holders to ensure strong understanding of the methodology behind all calculations
Perform ad hoc analysis using data from various systems and explain results of analysis to all levels of management
Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve processes, increase data integrity, and provide quality customer service to our business partners.
Provide comprehensive analytical and fact-based reporting to support and/or identify opportunities to impact operational results, make changes to processes, and support strategic initiatives.
Learn new technology quickly and help keep Smithfield aware of new cutting-edge technologies that are shaping the industry.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.
A Bachelor’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Machine Learning, AI, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Data Science) or equivalent professional or military experience working as a Data Scientist.
5+ years working in an analytical role
Knowledge and practical experience in several of the following areas: machine learning, statistics, NLP, deep learning, recommendation systems, information retrieval.
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities of data.
Experience designing experiments and ability to infer causal relationships.
Strong attention to detail and desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment.
Experience with Data analysis in Python using Pandas/Numpy/Jupyter Notebooks, preferred.
Ability to quickly learn new technology and business logic.
Strong experience with Power BI / Tableau, Power Pivot, SAP preferred
Careers and Benefits:

To learn more about Smithfield’s benefits, visit smithfieldfoods.com/careerbenefits.

PEOPLE MATTER
More than 63,000 employees globally drive our success. We strive to create a fair, ethical and rewarding work environment.

GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT
Working at Smithfield isn't just a job – it's the foundation for a lifelong career with training designed to help you advance professionally.

BENEFITS
Our people matter. That's why we offer excellent, comprehensive benefits packages to our full-time employees.

SUSTAINABILITY PLEDGE
Sustainability is ingrained in our culture and guides how we operate. We believe in innovating for the future.

About Smithfield Foods:

Headquartered in Smithfield, Va. since 1936, Smithfield Foods, Inc. is an American food company with agricultural roots and a global reach. Our 43,000 U.S. team members and 16,000 European employees are dedicated to producing “Good food. Responsibly.®” and have made us one of the world’s leading vertically integrated protein companies. We have pioneered sustainability standards for more than two decades, including our industry-leading commitments to become carbon negative in U.S. company-owned operations and reduce GHG emissions 30 percent across our entire U.S. value chain by 2030. We believe in the power of protein to end food insecurity and have donated hundreds of millions of food servings to our neighbors in need. Smithfield boasts a portfolio of high-quality iconic brands, such as Smithfield®, Eckrich® and Nathan’s Famous®, among many others. For more information, visit www.smithfieldfoods.com, and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.

positionName: Senior Analyst, Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales Marketing Operations
Job Details
Are you passionate about delivering easy-to-use solutions that bridge functions and address global challenges?

Do you enjoy learning, defining, and sharing new systems and processes? Are you an organized individual, with strong communication skills that have a knack for project management? If so, the Global Field Marketing Strategy team has an opening for an Analyst, on the Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail team . This role will manage several demand generation and marketing technology platforms and processes, with an emphasis on the Direct Mail channel. This position will wear multiple hats that require a blend of both technical and non-technical skill sets. The ability to communicate effectively across several key stakeholder teams is a critical function as well as the ability to analyze data to deliver informed inputs that drive global strategy to fuel growth, pipeline, and ACV.


About the Team:

We are champions of Success for Everyone, Everywhere. As the Global Field Marketing Strategy Team, we deliver easy-to-use solutions that bridge time zones and functions, address global challenges, and develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter as one team. We combine analytics with insights to create compelling data-driven executive narratives and communications that elevate the visibility of our business success. Through globally aligned tools & technology, we rapidly scale efficiency and the impact of our teams. In all things we do, we place the customer at the center of our solutions. We actively seek out differing perspectives , leverage and build upon our global diversity, and harness best practices to bring forward global marketing solutions that accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:
Support project intake and manage users on our technology platforms, specifically for Global Direct Mail Program
Onboard and enable new, and existing users on processes and tools (in partnership with vendors)
Collaborate and manage projects across the field marketing team, regions, stakeholders, and SMEs to build marketing pipeline, accelerate selling cycles, and drive ACV
Develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter
Track project milestones and tasks across multiple teams via robust documentation
Assist in data analytics, including but not limited to the development of program metrics, attribution, and overall analytics
Work collaboratively with Operations, Compliance, Legal, and other supporting technology groups to develop process and system solutions
Support international expansion, onboarding, and enablement of our technologies
Analyze current processes and determine ways to automate, and streamline, the experience
Assist with setting up Quarterly Business Reviews with our stakeholders
Facilitate team discussions and resolve conflicts quickly
Support other Top Initiatives for the Global Field Marketing organization including Performance Steering and Tiger Team management

Required Skills/Experience:
4-5 years of Marketing Operations and Marketing Analytics experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment while remaining flexible and calm under pressure
Experience working with remote and diverse teams across regions and departments
Proficient in MS Office, Google Docs, Quip, Slack, and virtual meeting software
Preferred experience with Marketing Operations tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau CRM
Aptitude to quickly understand systems and technical concepts in order to explain to business partners
Ability to identify, share, and align around project requirements, all while staying highly organized
Self-motivated and enthusiastic with proven creative and critical thinking capabilities
Strong verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to build effective presentations and project plans
Ability to lead productive calls, identify decisions made, and clearly state action items
Experience working with Sales and Marketing is highly preferred

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
