Who we are: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.
Job Description Summary: Our global sales transformation is in full swing. We embarked on a path of transforming and building a world class sales organization earlier this year. Our team helps to power PayPal’s high growth Sales organization by delivering actionable insights and business intelligence at scale to all levels of the business - our customers, our front-line Sales teams and our executive leadership team. In this role, you will lead a team to develop solutions for complex, ambiguous and high-visibility business challenges. You will set and execute on a vision for your team that reflects your deep analytical expertise. You will be a thought partner to sales leadership teams. You will partner with these teams to understand the insights they require to manage and grow their business and leverage cross-functional teams to develop and land solutions that meet their needs at scale. You are deeply curious and persistent in gaining knowledge about our products and go-to-market strategy. You will have exposure and visibility to PayPal sales executives, as you work with them to understand their needs and promote solutions that your team develops. We are a team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members. If you are a fast learner, are willing to learn and grow, have a can-do attitude and wants to solve problems in the most pragmatic way, we would like to talk with you
Job Description:
10+ years of experience in analytics, engineering or management consulting or equivalent analytical and project management experienceAccomplished team leader, with experience managing high-performing Data Scientists and Quantitative AnalystsExperience working within and driving strategy for large, global, complex organizations across multiple stakeholders and teamsExceptional problem-solving skills, with strong ability to drive towards action and impactExperience in managing analytics projects from inception to delivery, including developing structured solutions.Experience with visualizations, dashboards, and reportsExperience with data modeling, machine learning algorithms, and data science techniquesExperience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications to varied audiences and translating business objectives into analyses

For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

positionName: Voice of Customer Analyst, Contact Center Excellence
description:
Company: Oak Street Health
Title: Associate, Voice of Customer Analyst
Company Description
The mission of Oak Street Health is to rebuild healthcare as it should be.
We are a rapidly growing, innovative company of community-based healthcare centers delivering higher quality health and wellness care that improves outcomes, manages medical costs and provides an unmatched experience for adults on Medicare.
The Oak Street model integrates outstanding clinical expertise, technology, and teamwork to deliver improved care quality and cost savings. These cost savings are then reinvested into care in our communities, creating a virtuous cycle of improving community health.
We are a national organization serving over 100,000 patients and we are growing rapidly. We are a diverse team of care providers, service team members, technologists, community outreach experts, business professionals, and more - all dedicated to our Oaky Values and motivated by our mission. We’re looking forward to getting to know you!
For more information, visit www.oakstreethealth.com.
Role Description:
The Associate, Voice of Customer Analyst will be part of a contact center team of analysts responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that enable Oak Street Health to deliver an Unmatched Patient Experience. This role is for a strategic, creative, technically savvy individual with a strong background and interest in utilizing customer insights to drive changes in process, programs, operations and business priorities.
This role will become the advocate for the patient by generating patient feedback from all their preferred channels and synthesizing them to drive change. This individual will set up the voice of the customer program with the VOC manager and create a new function within Oak Street Health. The role will be a key contributor to creating a new center of expertise within Oak Street Health and will be a key partner for contact center leaders, clinical and center leaders and senior leaders.
The Associate, Voice of Customer Analyst will support the daily operational execution of the Voice of Customer program, provide administrative support to the team, and will partner with other members of the sales and service excellence teams to understand business challenges and design plans for capturing customer needs and desires to enhance service delivery.
Core Responsibilities:
Manage patient experience surveys and collect and organize information from the surveys
Listen to customer calls and text messages and other contact information and triangulate feedback into a cohesive customer voice
Provide reporting and analysis to OSH centers, clinics, medical directors, senior executives
Create patient experience dashboards, slides and other materials in partnership with Patient Experience and Patient Engagement team to showcase the aggregate picture and to convey the customer experience and operational metrics
Conduct monthly and quarterly reviews on patient experience insights and risks
Deploy new tools and capabilities to create journey analytics across the entire patient journey
Educate and engage business partners on the role of the VOC team and drive patient centric change across the organization
Conduct tactical deep dives into specific patient experience issues and take a project oriented approach to research and resolve issues
Present data and analysis in a clear and concise manner
Become a part of the Issue Resolution council to fix recurring issues, including root cause analysis, partnering with technical teams for systematic resolution in a timely manner
Manage relationships with vendor partners in the VOC space
Establish a process with operational leaders for service recovery for high impact patient issues and complaints
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business or a related field or relevant work experience in place of a degree required
Minimum of 2 years experience in Customer Success, Voice of Customer, or Customer Experience required
Proven track record of problem solving using data and insights
Deep experience in the domain and understanding of best practices in the industry
Deep understanding of common customer experience metrics and systems for key touch points
Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret results for insights
Ability to data mine, analyze data, and present insights in a meaningful way
Strong organization and project management skills
Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Experience with customer feedback channels and customer feedback solicitation tools
Experience designing surveys and looking at survey result data
Experience working with research / survey tools
US work authorization
Someone who embodies being “Oaky”
What does being “Oaky” look like?
Radiating positive energy
Assuming good intentions
Creating an unmatched patient experience
Driving clinical excellence
Taking ownership and delivering results
Being scrappy
Why Oak Street?
Oak Street Health offers our coworkers the opportunity to be at the forefront of a revolution in healthcare, as well as:
Collaborative and energetic culture
Fast-paced and innovative environment
Competitive benefits including paid vacation and sick time, generous 401K match with immediate vesting, and health benefits
Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

Overview:

The Supply Chain & Operations Analyst will perform analysis of key supply chain and operations metrics to help understand, predict, and improve operational processes resulting in increased cash flows, customer satisfaction and decreased operating costs.
Responsibilities:
Perform analysis of inventory and forecast to support management in stakeholder meetings
Provide analysis of key supply chain metrics such as forecast accuracy, days of supply, service levels, etc.
Perform variance analysis across consolidated beverage group including critical analysis of trends, variances, and key metrics with an eye towards improvement
Compile, review, and analyze data to produce reports and results in an organized and insightful way, validating and verifying information to ensure accuracy
Conduct business case and financial modeling
Serve as internal resource on supply chain planning software, Blue Ridge, for new user setups, system integrations, settings, and testing
Monitor Blue Ridge settings and SAP settings for key purchasing parameters
Support special projects as needed
Other duties, as assigned by the jobholder’s supervisor, may also be required
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Supply Chain/Logistics, Finance, Accounting) and/or equivalent training and work experience
1-3 years of professional experience in related field
Advanced PC skills using MS Office and other various computer programs including presentation software
Must be a results-oriented professional with verbal/written communication using diplomacy and discretion as well as customer service skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize requests, produce accurate outputs, work independently and with a team, pay attention to detail and meet deadlines
Analytic and Reporting skills
Sound judgement and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in fast-paced, high-volume, team environment
Utilize sound judgement, analytical and problem-solving skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge in advanced data analytic tools such as Hyperion Essbase, BI360, Alteryx, Business Objects, Power BI, Blue Ridge or other forecasting tools, WEBI
Knowledge of financial management concepts such as balance sheets, gross profit, etc.
Experience with SAP software
Physical Requirements:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, stand, sit; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone

We Are:
Being part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting means becoming an expert at making the New happen Now. To us, the New is all about the wise pivot that turns constant disruption to continuous reinvention. We are an innovation led company that works at the heart of our clients’ organizations so that no matter how complex the business challenge, we face the future with confidence.
If you love solving challenges and not just studying them, then Accenture Consulting is the right place for you. Join us to develop your ideas into provocative points of view and transformative insights that help shape industries. You’ll work with an amazing and diverse mix of world-class experts with access to one of the most robust portfolios of capabilities and ecosystem relationships in the industry. Together, you’ll do so much more than consult.
Coming here means future-proofing your career and going as far as your ambition takes you. Becoming a tech-savvy, well-rounded, multi-disciplined and market-relevant advisor doesn’t happen by chance. We invest in training and development in a big way, so you can build your future along with ours, creating an impactful career unique to you. Ultimately, we believe we is greater than me and that diverse perspectives lead to the best solutions. Joining Accenture Consulting means you will learn, innovate and lead, and together we will improve the way the world works and lives.
Accenture Strategy & Consulting, Utility Industry, Retail Energy and Customer Service Practice helps energy providers around the world to reimagine, transform and grow their business and create new value propositions, revenue streams, commercial models and ecosystems. We are powering the progress to a safe, connected and sustainable planet. Every day, we work with the largest electric, gas and water utilities to deliver innovative solutions and help them become more efficient, reliable, environmentally friendly and safer places to work. We co-create the future with our clients at Accenture Innovation Hubs around the world and work alongside our clients to bring the future to life in the core of our client's operations. We are the marketplace leader in modernizing the Customer Experience network, delivering next level of connectivity between marketing, operations and technology that goes beyond the commodity. Our utility clients are looking for bold solutions in the era of rapidly changing technology, policy and workforce innovations. Are you the leader who wants to reinvent the Utilities' Customer Experience and empower our clients to create a clean, sustainable and connected world? Join a team of industry practitioners with global footprint and local camaraderie. Visit our site to learn more about Accenture Strategy & Consulting Utilities Practice.
You Are:
A skilled utility industry practitioner who knows how to reinvent Customer Experience in the new digital world. You have experience designing and implementing digital transformation in a functional and/or technical capacity with CRM / Customer Care focus on business process improvement and/or supporting technical solutions (e.g. in the contact center, back office and strategic departments of a retail utility). You identify, target, and organize for intelligent customer and retail growth with new connected energy experiences. In fact, every day you are looking for opportunities to challenge the status quo and you are not satisfied with step change. You are a relentless storyteller, inspiring teams with your vision and new way of thinking. You have a proven track record of assembling diverse, high performing teams that harness people's strength and deliver radical insight. You understand that co-location with clients and teams is critical to innovation and you are ready to partner at client sites.
The Work:
Data scientist delivering analytics solutions tied to utility customer programs.
Understand client challenges and articulate the value of transformation in terms of business outcomes
Bring thought leadership on most critical issues Utilities face today, and in the future
Constantly learn and bring new technologies and innovative solutions to our clients
Be a role model and a coach for the next generation of Accenture analysts and consultants
Champion people on your team to succeed professionally and personally
Foster trusted advisor relationships with clients from strategy to technology; from the C-Suite to the front line; for business and IT
Integrate business data to discover new insight and enable evidence-based business decisions
Earn air miles and hotel points with weekly travel to client sites for recharging on epic personal adventures
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here's What You Need:
Minimum 3 years of experience in the Utility Industry required
Minimum 3 years of experience managing or implementing analytics solutions for utilities in a data scientist role
Minimum 3 years of experience building machine learning solutions
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
Our Commitment to You:
Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement. You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects. Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments, and collaborating with experts across the company. Access to leading-edge technology.
Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package including generous paid time off, an employee healthcare plan and a competitive 401K program. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits: Your Future Rewards & Benefits

Company Overview
We’re committed to excellence. That’s why we invest in great people—knowledgeable, customer-focused, collaborative and responsive—who are trained for today’s problems and tomorrow’s solutions. We offer competitive wages, excellent benefits, and a positive work environment designed around the commitment to mutual respect and the challenge of contributing to the continued success of our organization.
Summary
The Marketing Analyst will identify and perform a wide variety of analytical projects in order to achieve established sales and marketing goals. Projects will include building statistical models, customer profiles and segmentations, scoring customer and prospective universes, analyzing campaign results, and generating client reports/presentations with meaningful, insightful, and actionable findings.
This analyst will also be responsible for training junior staff, leading projects and taking control of large development and system maintenance functions. Project leadership and management will be key components of this analyst’s function and candidates must show experience doing so in major projects with demonstrated results.
The Analyst will also be responsible for developing new techniques in the areas of modeling, data integration (especially electronic data) and others. They must then publish the developed work internally into a fully functional and documented procedure, training staff in the execution of said procedures, ensuring the procedures are deployed properly and measuring the success of the executed procedures.
Responsibilities and Duties
Meet with sales team members to ascertain marketing objectives in verticals like healthcare and financial services and then use data to build analytic solutions that drive ROI.
Understands digital data in all its many forms and has experience integrating digital and physical data and developing real time analytic solutions to drive digital activity and visa versa.
Experience with AI and Machine Learning Techniques to improve model performance and production efficiency.
Provide NEW innovate techniques, models and products that can be scaled and provided to our clients.
Perform exploratory data analysis, look-a-like and response models, multi-staged models, clustering, segmentation, factor analysis, discriminant analysis and profiles all to drive profitable marketing solutions.
Must be an expert in using SAS (Base SAS, SAS STAT, SAS GRAPH, Enterprise Miner and other products as needed) and be able to conduct the required analytical functions using these tools rather than another front-end platform. Must know basic SQL and have at least cursory knowledge of R and Python.
Create client ready reports and presentations based upon findings to include objectives, methodology, findings, results, executive summary and recommendations.
Perform data hygiene and work with automated programs built to execute append/reverse append various data sets. Contribute ways to improve the process and reduce cycle time.
Assist in building additional automation and system process innovation.
Lead and manage analytic projects, be a mentor and act as a team lead to improve modeling by shorting timeframes and providing better results.
Present results in customer/client situations demonstrating expertise, professionalism and relatability.
Qualifications/Knowledge/Special Abilities Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, and Masters in Marketing, Statistics, Social Sciences, Mathematics or related field.
Proficient in modeling software tools (Base SAS, SAS Enterprise Miner) of more than 5 years.
Proficient in address hygiene, merge/purge of data sets, and establishing unique identification.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, and Word specifically), Power Point, and other Office products.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills required in order to convey insight, consumer behavior, and sales/campaign results.
Exceptional time management, critical thinking, attention to detail, and problem solving skills.
Ability to work well in a team environment to achieve a common goal.
Demonstrated strong work ethic
Professionalism
Reliability
Relevant analytical work experience in predictive modeling of at least 10 years preferred.
Working knowledge of advanced statistical analysis and research methodologies with both an academic and business understanding preferred.
Hours:
Monday - Friday: 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Flexibility with manager approval). Additional hours as business needs require to complete projects
Additional Information:
Amsive is Federal Contractor and this position may require government security clearance for certain projects.

positionName: Senior Business Analyst, Advisor Client Experience
description:
As part of Morningstar’s continued integration of our PlanPlus Global acquisition https://newsroom.morningstar.com/newsroom/news-archive/press-release-details/2020/Morningstar-to-Acquire-Software-Provider-PlanPlus-Global/default.aspx, we are looking for an inspired, detail-oriented Senior Business Analyst to help us develop advanced financial planning software for financial advisors in Canada, where we currently serve advisors and investors with such solutions, and worldwide as we strategically extend those capabilities to additional Morningstar platforms and markets. The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with their development squad under the guidance of the Senior Product Manager for advanced financial planning.


As a Senior Business Analyst, you act as a subject-matter expert on complex financial planning methodology, both internally and externally. You will collaborate with research, development, and QA teams to ensure successful product development and support.

We prefer for this position to be located in our Chicago or Toronto office but will consider candidates working remotely in the United States or Canada where Morningstar is registered to conduct business.
Responsibilities:
Translate product or functional requests from internal and external clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.
Integrate proprietary research into our advisor-facing software by working closely with thought leaders to bring intellectual property and new methodology to market.
Develop an in-depth understanding of financial planning software methodologies, inputs and outputs (e.g. forecasting/projections, calculation reconciliation, etc.).
Lead the documentation of complex methodologies.
Support internal and external clients through product demonstrations, troubleshooting, methodological proofs, and timely communication.
Step in and help with product testing, as needed. Everyone is responsible for quality!
Assist with support and maintenance of solutions that have been deployed to live environment.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, mathematics, engineering, computer science or related field. Formal Financial Planning-related education/certification is required (e.g. CFP designation). Master’s degree is preferred.
Advanced understanding of advisor financial planning process, competitive software landscape, and end-client experience with planning.
Understanding of both business and technical requirements, and the ability to serve as a conduit between product, research, and technology.
Excellent written communication, planning, and analytical skills.
Demonstrated experience in applying quantitative methods and data analysis.
Must be willing to work under tight deadlines across multiple teams and locations with off-hours engagement.

At GroupM, we believe that work is a part of life, not the other way around. ABOUT US
GroupM Data & Analytics Services is a marketing science, technology and consulting group specializing in fact-based business strategies and assessment. We combine adtech and martech platform strategy with data science & data engineering expertise to make advertising work better for clients and consumers.
ABOUT THE ROLE:
As a data analyst within the analytics team, you will work in an environment where everyone is passionate about data, analytics and self-development with a customer-centric focus. You will act as the primary day-to-day execution contact for client deliverables including but not limited to measurement planning, reporting, media and creative testing/analysis, as well as competitive research and analysis.
You will have an opportunity to learn how to employ advanced data engineering, data science tools and techniques to media analytics. The position will support the Analytics lead to ensure consistent quality output on all projects.
You will be expected to:
Consult with senior client marketing and business leaders to define and answer most important business questions to drive business growth
Analyze media performance utilizing cutting edge cloud tools and innovative analytics techniques that to create actionable insights
Perform storytelling from data and analyses; persuasively communicate insights to internal stakeholders and client
YOUR IMPACT:
Manipulate raw data to provide structured data sets for analysis
Analyze media performance data to uncover actionable insights which can be used to provide learnings and recommendations to the Client Leadership team
Use Statistical and Data Mining methods to project and explain client performance
Work with senior level Analytics team and Client Leadership teams to develop project timelines and deliverable schedules
Design and maintain dashboards for standard report delivery
Proactively communicate project progress, issues and deliverables to manager and director
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s or Graduate in Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science. Economics, Operations Research or related quantitative field
1-2 years experience of relevant work experience, media analytics preferred
Advance knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with the following technologies:
Data Visualization: Tableau, Power BI, Datorama
Web Analytics: Omniture, Google Analytics
Experience with relational databases (i.e. SQL, mySQL)
Familiarity with Python a plus
Knowledge of integrated marketing and CRM disciplines (including primary research, online advertising, customer segmentation, targeting, direct marketing, customer care)
Familiarity with online marketing, digital metrics and programmatic media
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills – a demonstrated ability to mine data for relevant and actionable insights
Inquisitive with a desire to tell a story using data
Exceptional organizational skills and detail oriented
Knowledge of visual techniques for data analysis and presentation
Excellent written, oral communication, project management and presentation skills
ABOUT GROUPM:
At the heart of the world’s leading media agency network is a future-facing product company, building the tools to make media work for everyone. In partnership with the globe’s leading clients, agency teams, media companies and technology platforms, we’re using our privileged position to help our customers ascend to vantage points unique in our industry.
Our teams bring together agile product management, cutting edge data science and enterprise scale engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of data driven marketing. We believe consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth and user experience are essential to performance and the sustainability of the advertising ecosystem and have assembled a global team with diverse skills and experience to help shape that future.

GroupM and all of its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

company: The University of Chicago Medicine Ingalls Memorial
description:
Job Description:

Join UChicago Medicine, as a Clinical Systems Analyst II in the Laboratory Department at Ingalls Memorial Hospital. This position offers some remote flexibility along with some requirement to be onsite at our Harvey location.
Job Summary
The Clinical Systems Analyst II- Laboratory will
Provides system support and ongoing maintenance for designated clinical and financial systems and system users.
Must maintain relationships with internal customers to identify their needs, implement new processes and systems, and support change management of key clinical and financial systems.
Performs system analysts activities and makes recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.
Must show competency resolving moderate to complex database issues associated with designated systems.
Provides direction and guidance in new software and functionality implementation to enhance processes and workflow with technology solutions.
Essential Job Functions
Stewardship
Support systems and applications to minimize outages avoiding cost to the hospital in overtime and non-productive time.
Analyzes data to proactively identify possible issues and create solutions for resolving problems before they occur.
Participate in root cause follow up on issues and identified problems to empower the customer in self-sufficient problem resolution and/or put in preventative steps to reduce problems.
Makes suggestions for support efficiencies and cost savings related to system integration and improvements.
Compassion
Works closely with customers to translate workflow and process needs into technology solutions.
Understands the skill and competency of the customer and assists in moving them in the direction of technology through education.
Clinical Excellence
Extensive knowledge of report writing using crystal reports, ODBC Access and/or SQL querries is essential. Ability to analyze and create stored procedures and build system views a must. Provide documentation of previous experience with these functions.
Participates in training classes as needed to maintain competency. Training may include technical education for clinical systems, office automation and network design. Training may also include education on such organizational issues as team work, project management, client service, etc.
Has extensive knowledge of systems and database structures
Assists in 3rd tier troubleshooting of issues such as system response time issues, application to server issues, printing and routing issues.
Performs upgrades or assists in vendor performed upgrade by coordinating downtimes and organizing resources and informing customers.
Analyses system issues and looks for ways to achieve greater efficiency and more stable systems.
Understands backup and recovering process for application servers.
Proficient in report writing using crystal reports, ODBC Access and/or SQL as appropriate to retrieve data from application systems.
Working with clients, defines and designs clinical applications to meet specified needs, both during implementations and ongoing enhancements.
Assists with the system design to meet project objectives.
Organizes assistance from other staff in the Information Technology division to provide design assistance, operations support, network support, etc.
Evaluates changes to forms, procedures, work station layout and work flow considerations.
Develops work plans and schedules to ensure proper resource utilization and adherence to project time lines.
Adheres to all Ingalls defined standards for form and screen design.
Works with IT management to identify appropriate vendor and IT technical resources for system support.
Develops and follows change management procedures when implementing additions and changes to information systems and business processes.
Reports to management on status of ongoing projects and escalates issues and roadblocks timely.
Performs key day-to-day project and problem management functions.
Monitors all clinical application projects and provides co-workers with project plan development and tracking assistance.
Assists co-workers with prioritization of projects as well as daily customer service issues.
Communicates and coordinates with other Analysts any tasks or problems which overlap skill sets.
Successful completion of Annual Competencies.
Service Excellence
Assists with production system problems and participates in the on-call rotation.
Responds to client requests and questions when contacted directly or notified by the Helpdesk. Opens tickets with Helpdesk as required.
Properly escalates problems to other IT staff as appropriate for prompt problem solution. Notifies both client and helpdesk of problem status and resolution.
Carry and respond to on call pager during assigned rotation to support a 24.7 365 day a year organization.
Documents operational backup procedures and troubleshooting techniques for newly developed or enhanced systems.
Maintains working relationships with clients in order to identify their support needs and issues.
Manages user expectations and maintains positive relationship with all customers.
Responds to email and voice-mail promptly and processes tickets requests as required by the SLA
Establishes good working relationships with other Information Technology staff and users.
Approaches each user, or client, contact from a service perspective, exercising courtesy and tact
Responds to client requests for information in a timely manner.
Works in conjunction with all IT staff to foster a team environment of knowledge transfer and support
Innovation
Meets with clients regularly to identify new needs, projects, programs, etc. which could be enhanced using information technology.
Maintains an awareness of current technology and assists with hardware and software problems. Such current technology includes information systems already installed or under evaluation and not yet in place.
Required Qualifications
Associate Degree or B.S. Degree in one of the sciences. If Medical Technology, inclusive of one year clinical training in an approved school of medical technology.
Five years of laboratory or hospital experience to include computers, including both hardware and software. Must be able to provide documentation of training/education specific to information systems.
Five years of general laboratory or hospital experience is required, to include familiarity with computer applications. Familiarity with CPT and ICD-9 coding, previous experience installing/implementing LIS preferred. Evidence of experience in training/education strongly preferred.
License/Certification: MT (ASCP), MLT (ASCP, or equivalent certification preferred.
Competencies: Lab Safety Test, Department Specific Competencies, Healthstream Education Requirements
Knowledge and experience of implementation, validation, and LIS systems application building, as well as troubleshooting to include the following systems: SOFTLAB/MIC SoftBank, SoftAr, SoftPath, Epic Beaker
Must possess analytical, problem solving and communication skills, as well as the ability to maintain working relationships with all levels of staff and management. Skills with office automation products are preferred. Must be self directed and able to manage workload to achieve project goals and timelines.
Position Details
Job Type/FTE: Full-time
Shift: Day
CBA Code: Non-Union
Location: Remote Flexibility and onsite in Harvey, IL
No Visa Sponsorship Available
Must comply with Ingalls Memorial Hospital's COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.
Why Join Us:

For nearly a century Ingalls Memorial has pioneered sophisticated clinical care and developed the area's most convenient network of comprehensive outpatient centers, all dedicated to improving the health and wellbeing of the community. Now, partnered with UChicago Medicine, we have expanded our network of expert physicians, convenient facilities and scope of service to speed your healing process and help navigate your path to wellness. A skilled Medical Staff and talented employees dedicated to prevention, diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of illness and injury provide a firm foundation for our reputation for quality. To accomplish this, we need employees with passion, talent and commitment… with patients and with each other. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. If you’d like to add enriching human life to your profile, UChicago Medicine Ingalls Memorial is for you. Here at Ingalls, we’re doing work that really matters. Join us!

Job Description:
The Data and Analytics (D&A) Specialist is able to create analytics proof-of-concepts in order to build conviction on the feasibility of applying analytics to solve business problems before committing a fully loaded analytics squad to build a production use case. The Specialist is an analytics generalist who can work closely with business leaders and is able to translate business problems into analytics problems identifying where analytics can be applied and where human intervention is needed. The Specialist builds proof-of-concepts to solve business problems through innovative application of analytics techniques. The Specialist reports to ABM’s VP and Head of Data and Analytics.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Collaborate with key business stakeholders to identify hypotheses on where analytics solutions can enable business impact (drive revenues, reduce costs, improve quality, improve client experience etc.)
Reformulate business problems as an analytics problem (prediction, classification etc.)
Identify datasets and specific techniques that can be applied to build an MVP rapidly
Develop a proof-of-concept analytics model using data extracts to test the potential for analytics with real datasets
Work with business stakeholders to identify where and how an at-scale version of the PoC would be helpful
Work with Product Owners to define the product in greater detail and identify next steps for agile delivery with a squad of data scientists, data engineers etc.

Location
This position is remote


Job Requirements:

4-7+ years of experience.
Deep knowledge of a wide range of analytics approaches including descriptive analytics and dashboarding, linear and nonlinear regression, machine learning, operations research / optimization
Can quickly dive deep on business challenges and formulate then as data and analytics problems that can be solved by standard approaching using descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics
Hunger for continuous improvement and a desire to be challenged.
Collaborative, work well within a small, high-performing team.
Travel required 10-25% (depending on location and return to normal activities). Currently virtual teaming.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, finance, engineering, business analytics, computer science or management information systems

TECHNICAL SKILLS
Deep expertise with descriptive analytics (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to combine data and uncover insights from dataset extracts
Knowledge of a wide range of analytics techniques; regression, classification, recommendation, forecasting, optimization and other statistical and analytics domains and ability to match the use case and problem statement with analytics approach
Experience and expertise in building predictive models using python, R, or proprietary analytics packages (e.g., H2O) to rapidly build proof-of-concept analytics models
Experience with cloud-based analytics platforms (e.g., DataBricks) and other big data technologies that can be leveraged to build automated analytics pipelines for at-scale robust analytics applications

Sonder is revolutionizing hospitality through innovative, tech-powered service and inspiring, thoughtfully designed accommodations combined into one seamlessly managed experience. Officially launched in 2014 and headquartered in San Francisco, Sonder is making a world of better stays open to all with a variety of accommodation options — from rooms to suites and apartments — found in more than 30 cities spanning eight countries and three continents. Sonder's innovative app empowers guests by making self-service features and 24/7 on-the-ground support just a tap away. From simple self check-in to boutique bathroom amenities, we bring the best of a hotel without any of the formality.

Considering Sonder's global expansion plans, there will be opportunities for extraordinary personal and professional growth for the right candidate.

The Market Execution Analyst will ensure the success of projects designed to elevate city operations, improve guest experience, and enhance our ability to scale.

You have the highest standards of quality and work to raise the bar across the company. You thrive in an environment of ambiguity and constant change. You can effectively think strategically about the business impact of your projects as well as dive into the details to drive improvements across digital and physical touchpoints with our guests. You are analytical and use data to make decisions. You are a highly motivated, independent thinker who can execute projects across the organization while collaborating with multiple stakeholders.

AT SONDER YOU WILL:

Collect and analyze data from Market Ops teams to identify targeted areas for action and quantify the expected costs and impacts of taking action
Prepare monthly memos to the senior leadership team to identify organizational roadblocks and communicate progress on active initiatives

Track and report on implementation progress of initiatives previously approved by the senior leadership team
Create communications plans for sharing details on new projects and initiatives with Market Ops team members
Coordinate the quarterly Market Ops OKR setting process
Support FP&A Quarterly Budgeting efforts as the lead Market Ops representative
Assist the Implementation Team with ad hoc analyses to identify guest experience improvements in select markets
Work closely with Senior Market Execution Managers to support cross-functional projects with ad hoc analyses and SOP development

WHAT WE LOOK FOR:

BA/BS Bachelor's Degree; advanced degree a plus
Minimum 3 years of experience in operations, project management, or consulting in a customer focused industry (hospitality experience a plus)
Someone who can perform detailed quantitative analysis to capture insights from data; experience with SQL a plus
Ability to communicate cross-functionally (both verbally and written) to share analysis insights with stakeholders across the organization
A systems thinker who understands the impact that decisions can have both up and downstream and is familiar with how different parts of the business operate and connect to each other
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to set and adhere to deadlines and move projects forward with minimal supervision
A creative thinker that challenges assumptions and wants to participate in changing the hospitality landscape
An individual who thrives in ambiguity and project-based work that will change frequently, depending on the needs of the company.
A consummate team player who cultivates a positive culture

Competitive salary

positionName: Senior Analyst, Merchant Experience Analytics - Home & Auto
description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
This role will be a critical member of the Home and Auto Merchant Experience Analytics team and will work closely with the analytics leader, merchant experience marketing and sales teams to develop analytical insights and strategies, design, track, & measure campaigns (acquisition, incentives, lifecycle, retention), optimize the merchant and store associate experiences, manage existing and new data/insight processes, and own other projects under a strong analytic mindset.
This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home. On occasion we may request for you to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events. We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility.
Essential Responsibilities:
Using data-driven analytical methods, develop and implement primarily B2B marketing strategies and campaigns, create measurable test plans, extract data from off-line and on-line systems, manage campaign reporting and analyses, prepare objective analyses, make recommendations, and present to peers plus senior management all in a timely manner
Institute a "test and learn" culture through ongoing assessment of existing and proposed initiatives, recommending segmentation, sample size, targeting, and forecasting strategies to improve campaign effectiveness, profitability, and portfolio strength
Influence marketers and marketing strategies by crafting compelling stories through the interpretation of diverse and complex information
Communicate analysis and recommendations in a concise manner to a variety of audiences
Serve as cross-functional liaison, cross-training with peers in United States and India, to share and implement best practices and bold new ideas under a continual improvement cycle
Manage critical data processes, including a multi-year, multi-client associate incentive campaign
Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned
Qualifications/Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in STEM or related quantitative field, OR in lieu of a degree, a high school diploma and 5+ years of marketing analytics experience in financial services, credit card and/or payments industries.
1+ years of analytics work experience including:
1+ years of experience with querying and analyzing large amounts of data
1+ years of experience with statistical tools such as SQL, SAS, R, Python, Tableau, etc. to manage data, analyze data, create reports
Desired Characteristics:
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills with ability to manage multiple priorities
Working knowledge of tools such as, SQL, R, Python, Power Pivot, and Power Query
Exposure to business intelligence tools like Tableau and Salesforce
Ability to clearly explain technical information to non-technical audiences
Experience measuring marketing campaigns and interpreting results
Proven success at influencing and directing people outside of their reporting structure
Knowledge of basic statistical techniques/concepts like confidence intervals, sampling design, t-tests, and multivariate regression

You must be 18 years or older
You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process

Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).

The Job
The Category Management Analyst II will leverage fact-based analytics and customer research to develop consumer-relevant retail assortments and planograms. Improving the store model is pillar of Ace’s long-term retail strategy, and developing the most efficient, productive and differentiated assortments/planograms for our Retailers is a critical element for success.
Category Scope: Category Management Analyst II will have responsibility over smaller volume & less complex categories
What you’ll do
Analyze data and information from best in class Ace stores, Ace Reward shoppers, competition, and industry to recommend a credible, customer centric assortment that delivers optimal space and inventory productivity, addresses both breadth and depth, while simplifying the shopping experience rooted in customer behavior and the path to purchase.
 Achieve alignment with Merchant on final space allocation and product assortment, meeting category review goals and Ace benchmarks. Manage all aspects of assortment and planograms, from analytics and recommendations to cross-functional alignment and execution.
Collaborate with multiple departments (e.g., Merchandising, Space Planning, Retail Pricing, Store Environment, Retail Analytics, Field Operations, Inventory, etc.) to ensure that assortment and space recommendations are “retail ready,” aligned with overall category strategy and communicated effectively.
Proactively monitor category KPI’s to identify opportunities to make assortment and/or space/planogram changes to improve category performance and to understand impact of prior changes made. Work with management to align on key actions to take based on results and work with cross-functional category team to act as needed.
Provide direct customer service to retailers as needed. Return phone calls and emails promptly exhibiting the willingness and expertise to answer questions and resolve issues as presented.
Complete special projects/requests as assigned by management team.
What you need to succeed
Experience and Technical Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or business-related field
3-5 years retail or consumer packaged goods experience
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
High degree of curiosity and structured problem-solving skills
Ability to analyze, evaluate and interpret complex data
Confident presenting in larger groups across multiple levels of the organization
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and written to various levels of corporate and retail management (e.g., manager through VP and store associate through owner)
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Knowledge of standard Category Management process and principles a plus
Must be able to lift 30lbs

Sr. Manager, Business Analyst
In just ten short years, Capital One’s Commercial Banking division vaulted from nothing into the top 10 list of national commercial banks after a multi-year strategic investment in transforming Commercial from a collection of small local banks into a strong regional player. Our transformation included a complete overhaul of supporting technology systems, building up a core data capability, standardizing processes, and proving out the value of Capital One strategic analytics applied within a Commercial business context. Having established a credible scale in this industry, Capital One leadership began considering the next big steps and looking for ways to go beyond traditional Commercial banking as the industry knows it. Part of that answer was to invest in building dedicated business line and product analytics teams to provide strategic guidance, creating capabilities that drive sustainable competitive advantage, and significantly enhance risk management practices.
As a Senior Business Manager in our Commercial Banking division, you’ll be exposed to financial solutions such as Commercial Lending, Capital Markets, Treasury Management and Deposit Services, and Corporate Credit Cards to a variety of industries including Commercial Real Estate, Healthcare, Financial Institutions, Energy, TMT, and to Middle Market companies around the country. In this role, you will set the vision for the team, initiate projects that can add value to that vision, and manage a team of analysts to execute against those projects. To be successful, it will be important to develop close relationships within the Lines of Business, other Marketing and Analysis teams, and partner functions.
Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Strategic & analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation, given that a large part of the business is based on rigorous analytics & credit risk management
Leadership: May manage and develop multiple analysts. Coaching and mentoring associates with a goal of developing and retaining talent at Capital One
Solid people leadership experience: Ability to build and leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise. They should foster innovation, drive critical decisions, hold business partners accountable, and be able to consistently deliver results
Product: Develop and implement new product and pricing strategies for various lending products; lead product level data modeling/analytics
Credit Risk: Drive step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis
Execution: Manage and sequence delivery of business intent, build business requirements and execute against the product strategy. Oversee multiple projects and programs concurrently
Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability
Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: They should be a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business
Strong executive communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals. They should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment
Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 5 years of experience in analysis
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree
At least 2 years of experience in financial services
At least 2 years of experience in consulting
At least 3 years of experience in people management

Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:
At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!
Job Description:
As a Project Manager at Crowe, you will have the responsibility to coordinate people and processes to ensure that our external client projects are delivered on time and produce the desired results within the applicable statement of work and budget. You will be the go-to person for everything involving a project’s organization and timeline. In this specialized role, you will work directly with external clients to lead short-term and long-term engagements with project teams of 2-5 people across various industries – manufacturing, healthcare, education, and others. You will proactively identify risks and create mitigation plans to prevent project issues. You will identify blockers and work with team members to remove them and keep projects on track with their timelines. As a member of the Data Analytics team, you will provide meaningful firm-wide contributions that uphold the team’s dedication to “One Crowe”. We strive for an unparalleled client experience and look to you to promote our success.
Additionally, you will work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution.
Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Manage Agile development sprints focused on building reporting and analytics solutions
Direct all aspects of project management including project planning, resource scheduling, budget management, and risk logging and mitigation
Build comprehensive project budgets that break down development activities by workstream, task, and resource
Maintain and present weekly status reports of the project and keep a record of the previous reports
Partner with clients to train and educate stakeholders on our analytics solutions
Articulate the value-add of the projects deliverable and activities to client executive stakeholders
Adapt to various industries and quickly learn the client’s context, language, and jargon to clearly document and translate business requirements to developers
Remove blockers from development work, mentor team members and drive towards efficient utilization of organizational resources to improve capacity for project work
Encourage and motivate team members with precise and well-framed feedback that elevates execution and encourages personal growth and development
Qualifications
Minimum of 7-10 years hands-on experience in a Project Management role in business intelligence or corporate setting for mid-market and/or enterprise-scale organizations
Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment
Technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in enterprise solutions for different industries
High-level knowledge of BI architecture or data warehousing
Awareness of how dynamic reporting is built in tools like Power BI or Tableau is strongly preferred
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Effectively managing multiple deliverables, clients and projects in a fast-paced environment
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Key Stakeholders This Role Interacts With:
Internal
Senior BI Analyst
Data Product Manager
BI Architect / Senior Architect
Database Developer
Report Developer (Power BI, Tableau)
External
C-Suite Executives (CEO, CFO, CIO, etc)
Clients Operations Leads and Mid-Level Managers
Data Owners, Data Stewards
Enterprise Information Management and Data Governance Team
IT Staff – Architects, DBAs, Developers, etc
Our Benefits:

At Crowe, we know that great people is what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you!

We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Your Style


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Unyielding desire to resolve problems and overcome challenges

Self-starting, goal-oriented data ninja.

SpotHero is looking for a number-loving, data-driven individual to support the day-to-day functions of SpotHero's analytics team. This person will work to improve our strategy across business units and support data infrastructure to drive actionable insights through data analysis.


Who we are:

SpotHero is one of transportation's hottest tech companies! We're rapidly growing with the mission of bringing the parking industry into the future through technology. Drivers across the nation use the SpotHero mobile app or website to reserve convenient, affordable parking in advance, on-the-go or through their connected cars, and parking companies rely on us to help them reach new customers while optimizing their business. We connect the dots with cutting-edge technology, delivering value to both sides of this exciting, evolving marketplace.


What you will do:

Partner with various business unit stakeholders to identify what data is needed to complete requests, determine if we have the necessary data, and work with engineering and product teams to operationalize it.
Develop reports and tools using our Business Intelligence tool (Looker) to help operationalize data and make insights visible.
Forecast ROI for relationships with new business partners and/or new initiatives.
Secure and safeguard data to preserve its integrity, reliability, and availability and ensure appropriate access levels are maintained.


You are:

Strategic. You pursue insights that provide thoughtful answers to complex problems.
Analytical. You use frameworks and tools to organize and employ unstructured data.
Organized. You have great follow through on tasks and superior organizational skills.
Diligent. You are extremely detailed oriented and don't get overwhelmed easily.
Dynamic. You embody resilience, drive, and energy that radiates throughout all interactions.


What we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent of 2-3 year experience in an analytics background
Proficient in Excel
Advanced in SQL, write optimal queries to pull and transform data
Data visualization skills and data presentation
Proficient in working with a BI dash-boarding tool, Looker is super helpful


What we are offering:

Career game changer – A truly unique experience to work for a fast-growing startup in a role with unlimited potential for growth.
Excellent benefits – We cover 90% of Medical Premiums, 50% of Dental & Vision Premiums, and offer company sponsored Life Insurance.
Flexible PTO policy, generous parental leave, and great work/life balance – We value and support each individual team member.
Fun perks like snacks, catered lunches, happy hours, wellness programs, and SpotHero swag.
Annual parking stipend (duh – we help people park!).
The opportunity to collaborate with fun, innovative, and passionate people in a casual, yet highly productive atmosphere.
A workplace recognized as the Best Consumer Web Company by Built in Chicago, Top Company Culture by Entrepreneur, a Top Workplace by Chicago Tribune, and one of Chicago's Best Places to Work for Women Under 35 by Crain's Chicago Business.


Steps to apply: Please include any GitHub account, LinkedIn profile, and any project that you're particularly proud of. We love seeing work that others loved working on.


At SpotHero, we Respect Fellow Drivers by providing an inclusive interview experience for everyone, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process. Please let our team know of your need when you apply or as you begin interviewing with our team.


SpotHero is an equal opportunity employer. We know that a diverse workforce is the strongest workforce, and are committed to building and supporting an inclusive environment for all.

Job Purpose

ICE Clear Credit, as subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange Inc., is the world’s largest systemically important Clearinghouse for Credit Default Swaps (CDS). It is an entrepreneurial and aggressive organization that implements world-class clearing solutions.

ICE Clear Credit is seeking a Lead Systems Analyst to work closely with our internal Business and Technology teams to define end-to-end systems requirements for initiatives related to Clearinghouse systems.

Leads systems analysis activities, processes, procedures, resources and teams that contribute to the design, development, support and compliance of complex application software solutions that add significant value and satisfy identified requirements for critical processes and functions across multiple business lines. Systems analysis and support responsibilities include the ongoing prioritization, scoping, requirements gathering and technical design of work requests and projects for new implementations, upgrades, and enhancements of business-critical applications in OTC Post-Trade Functionality including CDS Clearing. Possesses technical knowledge to support systems analysis and considers the business implications of the technology application to the current and future business environment. Support responsibilities include contributing to Systems Operations, incident resolution, and root cause analysis for a large application portfolio that consists of multiple, systemically important systems to the financial industry. Position will stay closely in sync with the needs and priorities of various business lines and be accountable for contributing to evaluations, business cases, and the design specifications for the development of solutions toward achieving business goals.

Responsibilities

Produce detailed business and functional requirement specifications from existing systems, previous drafts, and SME interviews

Leads implementation, enhancement, and support activities for complex data integrations and programmed business logic to ensure consistency with user requirements and functional specifications. Produces business requirements documentation and functional design and technical design specification documents.

Perform analysis including ‘pre-development’ Excel/VBA based tools and prototypes that cover various what-if scenarios and use-cases that will ultimately assist with development, testing and support

Effectively communicates across teams in business matters inclusive of those with technical content. Blends technical and non-technical perspectives in verbal and written communications, focusing on the underlying business benefit and/or impact of proposed action. Builds effective relationships with business users and departments to develop a “joint” vision.

Understand and identify dependencies/impacts to the entire ecosphere of ICCs Clearing Systems - proactively identify dependencies and impacts of changes to other clearing systems

Participate in overall technology architecture, design and implementation sessions with development team, resolving questions and issues around business/functional requirements

Hands on involvement with QA and UAT test plan reviews – ensuring the end product delivers to its critical business requirements and objectives – and ensures high end-user satisfaction

Respond to technical and functional product questions raised by internal and external stakeholders

Develop Subject Matter Expertise in at least one functional area and become a go-to for business and system related inquiries

Serve as second/third level escalation point for data integration and programmed business logic incident support.

Participate in the establishment of standards and guidelines for development of new applications as well as support for production applications.

Knowledge and Experience

Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree (Finance, Financial Engineering, Mathematical Finance etc.) preferred.

Data analysis - Must have advanced proficiency with SQL, Microsoft Excel-VBA or Maltab.

Must have 5 or more years of prior experience in business analysis and worked as a liaison between Business and Technology teams as part of the SDLC process.

Experience owning and driving business initiatives from initiation to implementation.

Experience with OTC Credit Derivatives and/or other OTC derivatives – Interest Rate, Structured Products, Options. Candidate with good understanding and experience in working with Pricing / Risk Management / Portfolio Margining Models and Systems is preferred.

Experience in the use of project management methodologies

Comfortable with Financial Mathematics – including basic statistics and calculus. Familiar with the use of statistical and stochastic models in pricing of financial derivatives. Comfortable with the use of Excel and VBA to generate prototypes of pricing and risk models.

Experience working within an integrated technology environment – using relational databases, end-points/APIs and UIs to read and analyze data. Comfortable with documenting business and system requirements including documentation of comprehensive use-cases and working within iterative software development environment. Most importantly, being an integral part of the technology organization.

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

Data Analytics Consultant-OPE00017H
Description


Job Summary
Be part of the Analytics and Data Model Office (ADMO) team to provides critical support to and directly partners with CNA’s Underwriting Operations organization in areas such as data, reporting and analytics. In this role you will help establish metrics, provide insightful data analyses, work on advanced statistical models and partner with operational leaders and data engineers to support Underwriting Operations’ intelligence needs. The successful candidate will have strong communication and technical skills, with excellent business acumen and the ability to multi-task, to ensure delivery of high-quality outputs and make impactful data-driven recommendations.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Play a key role in defining, analyzing, and monitoring health-of-business key metrics for Underwriting Operations’ partners. Recommend and execute scientific methodology to evaluate operational changes.
Establish and nurture relationships with Underwriting Operations’ professionals and leaders. Leverage these interactions and partnerships to identify opportunities for business improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to innovate and improve efficiency of managing and curating data, allowing for better scale, speed, and accuracy of producing analyses, metrics and insights.
Develop dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to Underwriting Operations’ Leadership team.
Partner with in-house data scientists to assist in the building, application, and monitoring of statistical models that aim to optimize productivity and maximize return to operational investments.
Demonstrate high level of empowerment and accountability by working independently and receiving minimal guidance; act as a resource for colleagues with less experience by providing instruction, guidance, and advice.
Respond to and fulfill ad-hoc requests. May perform additional duties as assigned.

Reporting Relationship
You will report to a Director (or above)

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
Solid analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Proficiency with SQL. Knowledge of R and Python a plus.
High degree of familiarity with applications such as Google BigQuery, ThoughtSpot, and Looker. Familiarity with Alteryx, Tableau, Qlikview and other business intelligence and visualization software a plus.
Experience with data mining and exploration, and use of statistical methods of analysis. AI/machine learning skills a big plus.
Knowledge of workflows, company systems, databases, and their integration. Background in Insurance a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; a keen ability to extract relevant insights and “tell the story” with complex data.
Strong project management, organization and planning skills; high level of comfort with ambiguity and limited resources.

Education & Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics, or related field.
Typically a minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
Operations Reporting & Data Analyst

This job is virtual and can be performed anywhere in the US, Asia Pacific or in Europe.

The Role
The Operations Data Analyst (DA) will be responsible for helping to monitor, measure and manage the overall JLLT Solutions’ business and drive efficiencies in the overall processes through automation and reporting improvements.
The DA will be expected to bring innovation and best practices to the team to help drive improvement and gain efficiencies, including automating processes. Key to the role will be the capability to perform requirements and business process analysis to identify, gather and transform the data before presenting it back through reporting technologies such as Tableau or Power BI. Additionally, the DA will help to drive the success of the business by summarizing key results, analyzing trends and assessing overall business risks.
As a member of the JLLT Solutions team, the ideal candidate will possess an analytical and process-driven mindset, strive in an agile and fast-growing environment, and have a proven track record of strong global stakeholder engagement.

What This Job Involves:
Identify opportunity to and execute the automation of processes involving data gathering, transformation, reporting and analysis to drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the team.
Gathering and documenting requirements and proposed solutions to operational process improvement
Deliver ad-hoc reporting solutions and resolve any issues related to this and document reporting solutions.
Work closely with stakeholders in multiple functions and geographic regions to ensure data quality standards.
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical colleagues.
Maintain and administer all solutions developed.
Help to measure and communicate key trends of business KPIs through data analysis.

Key Skills:
Fluent English speaker.
Experience in gathering business requirements and developing BI / data & analytics solutions
Working experience or interest in some of the following technologies: Tableau or Power BI, SQL. Experience or interest in tools like Power Apps, Alteryx will be a plus.
Interest in developing solutions to create operational efficiency and greater visibility and documenting all developed solutions.
Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions, and offer recommendations (strong analytics, business, and financial acumen will be a plus).
Strong communication skills.
Interest in topics related to BI, e.g. data visualization, data modelling, UX, design thinking: the role will often require suggesting solutions that include different aspects of BI.
What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

Overview:
