positionName: Agile Program & Project Management Senior Analyst
description:
We Are:
On time, on budget, on point. Accenture helps our clients drive quality and predictability in a volatile, fast paced world. We have distinguished positioning borne out of our more than 30-year investment in thought leadership, comprehensive methods, innovative assets and industry specialization that continually adapts with the speed of change.
You Are:
An Agile delivery professional that defines an adaptive delivery model based on greater collaboration and communication between teams. You support and promote the Agile impact on people, processes and tools, and based on iterative, time boxed and an incremental approach, where requirements and solutions evolve through collaboration between self-organizing and cross-function teams. You are an Agilist that promotes adaptive planning, evolutionary development and delivery and encourages a rapid and flexible response to change.
The Work:
The Agile Program & Project Management Consultant is responsible for bringing the latest innovation and technology ideas to plan, deliver and execute technology solutions for Accenture or its clients. Work to ensure appropriate resources are mobilized and delivery meets operational, contractual, and economic commitments.
Key Responsibilities:
Identification and implementation of innovation opportunities leveraging Agile capabilities to drive improved cost, quality, and speed.
Understand and translate customer needs into implementable business solutions to enable long-term success
Accountable for ensuring technology solutions represent current and future business requirements
Assist in origination and sales of new opportunities to help the client achieve organizational goals while growing Accenture’s portfolio of work
Develop, manage, and grow trust-based relationships with a client
Build and leverage deep understanding of the relevant market and industry to influence client strategies
Implement a continuous improvement approach to achieve expectations on delivery efficiency and effectiveness, balancing cost, and quality
Provide an oversight for the execution of delivery of technology solutions for the client
Manage financials targets for delivery including resource planning and profit and loss.
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here's What you Need:
A minimum of 2 years of experience in Program & Project Management & Client Relationship and/or Sales/Sales Support
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If associate degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)
As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Company Description
Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.

Job Description
Your Impact:
As a Senior Associate, you will function as part of a world class Data Analytics team to support experience optimization, data driven storytelling and digital insights.
Primarily responsible for digital analytics, A/B testing and multivariate testing and experimentation to optimize the customer experience - hands on Adobe Target/Optimizely/Site Spect experiment execution and analysis a must have
Leverage data to identify optimization opportunities and build the experiment pipeline
Deliver data-driven and actionable insights using Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics
Analyze customer journeys under an optimization-focused lens, interpret experimentation results to help clients evolve the products
Present insights to clients and account teams with recommendations backed by robust analysis
Guide the team through experimentation learning & best practices
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including creative, design and engineering to shape meaningful customer journeys and customer centric thinking

Company Description
Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.
With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.
Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside.

BA will continually seek opportunities to increase business satisfaction, deepen client relationships, and effectively manage customer expectations.


The ideal candidate:

7-10+ years of professional work experience with the latest 5-7+ years being in a role of Technical Business Analyst, Software Business Analyst, System Architect or similar. Will consider strong candidates with the latest 4-5 year in BA role.

Performed typical BA activities: gathering and documenting requirements, writing user stories and epics, refining tickets, defining acceptance criteria, creating flow diagrams (e.g. screens, data, process, sequence, business)

Produced typical BA deliverables: User Stories/use cases, Epics, diagrams (data, sequence, business), process models, wireframes, functional and technical specification, BRD/URD, Screen flow/Journey map, UAT/Demo

Exhibits strong soft skills typically required in a BA role (e.g. active listening, propose alternatives, communicate complex information, issues, and potential solutions, has strong problem-solving / analytical skills and techniques, strong written and verbal communication skills)

Has strong passion for BA line of work and shows curiosity, diligence and integrity

Understands business priorities (e.g., vision), trends (e.g., industry knowledge) and markets (e.g., existing/ planned)

Organized, detail-oriented, self-starter with the ability to prioritize work, self-manage and make trade-off decisions

Prior experience on the projects with Agile methodologies

Able to foster collaboration across disparate, cross-functional teams and to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence with colleagues and clients

Experienced in interaction with QA teams to triage and prioritize defects and formulate an action plan to closure.

Experience with UI Application

Experience working in a consumer-based application environment with front and back end exposure


Nice to have:

Highly desired to have domain knowledge of the mobile app, general knowledge of the mobile technology and familiarity with iOS/Android features.

Familiarity with McDonald’s account at Capgemini

Understanding of QSR or retail technologies

Experienced with large projects, large number of stakeholders, multi-locations/global footprint

Familiar with JIRA & Confluence

Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment.
Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini.

They are responsible for software-specific design and realization, as well as testing, deployment and release management, or technical and functional application management of client-specific package based solutions (e.g. SAP, ORACLE). Required Skills and Experience:
You focus on building solutions and on maintaining, optimizing and improving a client’s applications and systems. You may also be responsible for unit testing, contribute to integration testing, and/or be responsible for the design and delivery of end-user training.

The IT Auditor III/Data Analyst is accountable for contributing to operational, compliance, IT audit projects, and conducting controls testing. This includes leading pre and post- implementation reviews of system implementations or enhancements to provide assurance new systems are designed and operating effectively. The role is responsible for identifying technology risks, and independently evaluating the efficiency, design, and effectiveness of information technology controls, including cybersecurity controls. The IT Auditor III/Data Analyst will also employ data analytics techniques to provide insights and enhance the efficiency of internal audits, facilitate direct access to data, and support recurring as well as ad-hoc data analytics needs. The role will be a source for analytics that business units adopt to provide business insights or for continuous auditing. The role executes work in accordance with all organizational and professional ethical standards, including IIA IPPF and ISACA standards. The IT Auditor III/Data Analyst keeps abreast of emerging technology and works independently, under general supervision, with latitude for initiative and independent judgment.
Independently leads audits with support from the Internal Audit Director.
Prepares reports for board level and executive management audience.
Contributes to development of the audit scope, objectives, and work programs for assignments, including planned internal IT audits and other projects.
Identifies processes to consider within audits, drafts planning documentation, identifies key controls, selects appropriate audit tests, executes test procedures, completes high quality audit working papers, identifies test exceptions and root causes, drafts audit findings, and drafts the audit report in accordance with departmental procedures.
Performs walkthroughs with management and executes tests of IT general controls, application controls, and reports relied upon for performance of business controls.
Queries and mines large data sets to identify patterns, examine operational and financial data, and filter for targeted information.
Develops reusable queries/scripts and solutions that can be leveraged by other Internal Audit staff on their audit projects.
Provides input into the development of the annual audit plan and risk assessment, based on the results of continuous monitoring/data analytics.
Qualifications:
BA/BS in technology (e.g. Computer Science or Management Information Systems) and/or business (e.g. Accounting, Business Administration, Finance, Statistics, Applied Mathematics).
Combination of technology and business education and/or experience highly preferred.
Masters or other advanced degree in related areas preferred.
CISA, CISSP, and/or CISM or equivalent certification preferred (CPA and/or CIA are a strong plus).
5+ years of audit experience, with at least 3 years in IT Audit, in public accounting and/or audit departments for manufacturing companies, preferably within a PE-backed environment.
3+ years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within or directly supporting an Internal Audit, Risk Management, Internal Controls or Compliance organization.
Experience with data analytics tools and visualization tools and languages (e.g., IDEA, ACL, Tableau, Python, R).
Previous experience in analyzing business processes in a manufacturing environment.
Knowledge of COBIT, ISO, and NIST frameworks.
Experience auditing mainframe and Oracle and/or other ERP systems.
High level of proficiency in information technology control concepts, information security, and systems development methodologies, preferred.
Proven understanding of IT and business processes and internal controls.
Possesses proficiency in knowledge of data querying, cleansing, validation, analysis, and visualization techniques, and working knowledge of statistical modeling to explore and mine data.
Possesses proficiency in SQL programming language.
Strong knowledge and applied experience in data access and extraction from databases and enterprise-wide information systems preferred (e.g., Oracle/Linux OS).
Demonstrated record of successful, high impact data analysis projects and outcomes, including creating reusable queries and scripts for data analysis.
Knowledge of quantitative analytical or basic statistical skills (e.g., Correlation, Regression) and its application to data.
Strong analytical, interpersonal, and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Demonstrated ability to handle ambiguity skillfully and apply judgment.
Tact and diplomacy as well as ability to understand foreign cultures.
Ability to work in a changing environment with multiple priorities.
Good time management and organization skills.
Manufacturing industry experience preferred.

Key Responsibilities:
Review, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs and recommend improvements

positionName: Business Analyst, Public Real Estate Securities
description: Company DescriptionFounded in 1966, Heitman LLC is a global real estate investment management firm with over $44 billion in assets under management. Heitman’s real estate investment strategies include direct investments in the equity or debt capitalization of a property or in the securities of listed and publicly traded real estate companies. Heitman serves a global client base with clients from North American, European, Middle Eastern and Asia-Pacific institutions, pension plans, foundations and corporations and individual investors. Headquartered in Chicago, with additional offices in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific, Heitman’s more than 325 employees offer specialized expertise – from a specific discipline to local insight.This OpportunityBusiness Analyst role focuses on in-depth business knowledge as well as advanced skills in data manipulation to translate requirements into analysis and reporting. You will serve as a hub through which information is collated and disseminated. Additional responsibilities include providing data for RFP’s, consultant databases and client reporting requirements through the use of attribution analysis, performance data and index/benchmark analysis to name a few.The responsibilities of a Business Analyst include, but are not limited to: Compile data, commentary, and analytics for client reports on monthly and quarterly basisParticipate in research and analysis relating to new product development initiativesMaintain and update quarterly marketing materials to support internal & external consumers of dataAbility to run multiple requests and prioritize while still maintaining accuracy of dataInvestigate any data discrepancies, explore various corrective measures of resolution, and implement solutionsPerform a variety of data maintenance in the attribution system and maintain security database for proper grouping and identifications, i.e., StatPro Revolution, Benchmark data mining etc.Detail oriented and takes initiative to check data quality and integrity on complex datasetAutomate existing ad hoc processes into streamlined and scalable solutionsDedication and perseverance to overcome data, analytical, and/or technical challengesExperience working on open ended custom analytic requestsWe are seeking individuals who meet the following criteria: Bachelor’s degree in finance or Business or related field1 - 3 years of experience related to financeMinimum 1 year of hands-on industry use in SQL, a scripting language (Python, R), advanced Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, graphing)Strong communication and written skillsKnowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BIHighly organized with excellent time management skillsAdvanced analytical and problem-solving skillsInterest in the field of analytics and the drive to develop automated customized solutionsAbility to work cooperatively and effectively with various groups including Accounting, IT, Operations, Client Services and MarketingStock market/real estate knowledge / experience helpfulAbility and interest to understand complex calculation and technical subjectsInvestigative ability — passionate and persistent in seeking to understand new data sources and creative in their applicationEnjoys working with extensive amounts of dataThe Heitman Difference – CultureOur culture recognizes the importance of our biggest differentiator — our people. description:
Are you an analytical, project-driven professional looking for the next challenge in your career? Do you enjoy problem-solving and have a passion for strategic vision? If so, the American Society of Plastic Surgeons has the perfect opportunity for you!

A self-motivated individual can successfully perform this position from anywhere and this position is currently 100% remote, subject to potential adjustment post-COVID-19 pandemic for Chicagoland candidates. Our headquarters is located in Arlington Heights, IL.

What You Will Do

The Business Analyst is a highly motivated contributor and an essential part of the Business Technology team providing functional and systemic analysis to clarify scope. The role will work closely with society business users and developers to help them translate non-technical needs into technical requirements to facilitate successful delivery of projects. The Business Analyst is an excellent communicator who writes well, speaks well and, most importantly, listens well.

The Business Analyst is accountable for identifying, assessing and documenting end-user requirements in the form of user stories, use cases, requirements, business process mapping and term definition and translating user requirements into functional and non-functional specifications for use by technology resources.

Facilitates and leads meetings with business and technology teams to identify, define, analyze and record requirements
Conducts and facilitates user acceptance testing of new capabilities/solutions being released to production
Creates and maintains manuals and how-to documentation as needed
Assists with triaging and prioritizing support tickets through collaboration with the technology team and occasionally resolving issues directly as needed/appropriate
Participates in and/or manages consultant selections and outsourced effort, to providing additional breadth to technology team's delivery capabilities
Researches and analyzes issues. Summarize problem definition and potential solutions
Assists and leads internal team meetings and provide direction to the development team
Identifies test scenarios and assist with testing
Other Duties
Adopt and utilize Agile (Scrum) project management methodology
Anticipate the needs of the business and propose solutions that align with strategic initiatives
Support the creation of plans and test cases
What You Will Need
Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Experience

Minimum of 5 years of experience in business requirements gathering, documentation and implementation (including development of use cases, test cases, workflow development, data mapping, etc.)

Certifications: PMP and/or Scrum Master/Product Owner helpful, but not required

This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of all job functions that an employee in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.
Apply For This Position
For consideration for this position, please send your resume to hr_jobs@plasticsurgery.org and enter the job title in the subject line.

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
JOB DESCRIPTION: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Analytics, JLL Technologies
JLL Technologies Enterprise Data team is a central organization that oversees JLL’s data strategy. Enterprise Analytics is an internal consulting team that provides data driven expertise to various business and support functions. The Senior Analyst is an experienced role that combines data-driven story-telling and business process analysis. If you have a penchant for using data to drive insight which helps different functions within JLL frame decisions and drive action, then this is the role for you. The successful candidate is a curious problem-solver and self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities
Develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.
Analyze performance trends and identify areas of opportunity to solve a business problem. Prepare and present findings and analysis to stakeholders and ensure alignment with objectives and goals - drive faster, smarter data driven decisions.
Generate revenue or cost save opportunities through data-driven insights and proactively identify opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.
Keep track of new technologies to get ahead of competition and create analytics as a competitive advantage for JLL. Proactively identify new analytics techniques to develop differentiated analytics solutions to drive results.
Monitor data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives. This includes acquiring new data sources and performing data discovery to understand data values and relationships.
Ensure proper escalation, prioritization and remediation of data quality issues.
Explore and utilize new data mining and data visualization tools to conduct ad-hoc analysis as required.
Mentor less experienced analysts on standards and techniques to improve their accuracy and efficiency.

Qualifications

3-6 years of analytical work experience in areas such as real-estate, risk, audit, retail, healthcare, marketing, operations, finance or research.
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Econometrics or Data Science or Information Management. Advance degree preferred.
Extensive experience in descriptive, prescriptive and predictive analytics.
3-6 years of strong programming experience with SQL, Python, R or other data mining and analysis tools.
3-6 years of experience developing insights and dashboards using a BI tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Advanced skills using Excel and PowerPoint.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing to work with multiple cross- functional teams.
Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL and/or data warehousing deployed in a complex environment is a plus.
Experience with geospatial analysis tools, such as ArcGIS or MapIT, is a plus.
Experience in technologies including CRM (SalesForce, Microsoft Dynamics) and/or Advanced Analytics (Microsoft Azure, Databricks) is a plus.
Experience in analyzing corporate real-estate (CRE) data is a plus.

What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

positionName: Data Management Analyst - Data Risk & Governance
description:
Overview:

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution with 10 million personal banking, business, public sector and institutional clients. CIBC offers a full range of advice, solutions and services in the United States, across Canada and around the world. In the U.S., CIBC Bank USA provides commercial banking, private and personal banking and small business banking solutions and CIBC Private Wealth Management offers investment management, wealth strategies and legacy planning.
CIBC works to help you make your ambitions a reality with a team that is committed to being always professional, genuinely caring and collaborates to find simple solutions as we build our relationship-focused bank for the modern world.
Every year, CIBC is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives. We are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all of our team members can excel.
Responsibilities:
BUSINESS UNIT DESCRIPTION
The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.
Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:
Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes
Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost
Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Data Governance Lead for the US Region, the Analyst – Data Risk and Governance supports ongoing data governance risk and control activities. The incumbent will serve as a subject matter expert for data policies, standards, procedures and controls and will be responsible for fulfilling data risk assessment activities across the US Region. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
Coordinate with data-intensive projects to identify and analyze data risk and recommend mitigating actions and data controls
Provide advisory support to data-intensive projects for mitigating actions and data controls
Develop and implement mechanism to track and report on data risk activities and data incident management and resolution
Implement strategies to monitor ongoing compliance with and effectiveness of data policies, standards, procedures and controls
Maintain and recommend enhancements to data policies, standards, procedures and controls
Support data governance forums by managing agendas, compiling materials, taking minutes and following up on action items
Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS
3-5 years of related work experience in Risk Management or Data Governance
Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy
Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings
Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint
Ability to work flexibly in a team environment

Actuarial Analyst - Long Term Care-ACT0000P2
Description


Job Summary
An exciting opportunity for an actuarial or data analyst to help drive innovation as a member of CNA's Long Term Care Actuarial team! This role collaborates across our Actuarial teams, along with partnering with the LTC Finance & Analytics, Operations, and Inforce Management teams within the division.
Leveraging the latest technology in actuarial science (Moody’s AXIS, R, Python, Alteryx and Tableau), this role primarily supports the annual reserve review process and statutory asset adequacy analysis. This role will also support stress and scenario testing, plan forecasting, pricing and other strategic initiatives including the implementation of the new GAAP accounting standard for long duration contracts. A successful candidate will be technically strong, detail-oriented and naturally curious. This role offers full actuarial exam study support, flexible work options, and a focus on professional development via future job rotations!
 Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Collaborates with and supports team members in the development and modeling of actuarial assumptions as part of our annual reserve and asset adequacy testing, leveraging R, Python, Alteryx, Excel and Moody’s AXIS.
Leverage industry leading actuarial and data manipulation tools for experience analysis, analytical support and ad-hoc actuarial requests, including leveraging predictive analytic methods.
Analyzes financial and statistical data and performs actuarial calculations to influence and drive business decisions.
Develop process improvements in order to gain efficiencies and execution of automatic controls; creating well organized repeatable and auditable processes.
Works collaboratively with other teams to create and design analytical reports for better understanding of financial results.
May perform additional duties as assigned.

Reporting Relationship
Director or above
 Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
Strong knowledge of the core functions of an insurance company, including actuarial/statistical or data science concepts.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to effectively resolve ambiguous and challenging problems with a sense of urgency. Demonstrate attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of CNA's internal and external business partners.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to effectively resolve complex situations and issues.
Solid project management, organization, and planning skills.
Ability to work independently, as well in a team, manages time and resources to accomplish multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, data programing languages (R, Python or Alteryx) and other business-related software systems, including processing systems and applications.

Job Details
Description
JOB SUMMARY

The role of the Data Analyst is to support management decision-making processes through the provision of data and analyst regarding the proposal’s products and services, subsidiaries, joint ventures, and partnerships. The role includes utilizing various decision support databases including the data repository/data warehouse to obtain necessary data; active participation in the databases; and significant involvement in the development of cost of services. The analyst will also work alongside the Director of Project management for continually updating and managing the financial plan and will record all revenues, receivables, submissions, and the development of the annual operating and budgets for the subsidiaries, partnerships and joint community ventures, as needed; assisting in the accounting department through the provision of various reports identifying discounts, denials, free care or other receivables issues; as well as other projects assigned.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Essential Functions
 Assist with high-level financial analysis for financial support: decisions regarding growth or contraction of existing services; the development of new products and services; and profitability of joint ventures, partnerships, and contractual arrangements. This includes utilizing system, data repository and other systems to report on department, program, product or service historical financial performance and utilization; gather external data as required to assist with the analysis; utilizing financial models to estimate future performance or outcome based on a set of assumptions (including estimates for covered lives and assumptions from the 4.5 proposal financial plan); and measuring expected financial performance through the computation of rate of return.
 Responsible for the development of fully allocated fixed and variable costs for all proposal services on a timely basis, in accordance with established deadlines. This involves: obtaining all data and supporting documentation to feed into the cost accounting model; working with and updating the complex, macro-driven PC-based cost and overhead allocation models to compute both budgeted and actual costs for each major product line classification. Working with management to update the fixed and variable cost percentages as necessary; reconciling the total computed costs to financial statements; and managing the cost model update process with any outside community partners.
 Primary function is to develop and extract data through the utilization and creation of reports that report routine database; loading of cost factors; and appropriate table/queries; payment formulas; and reconciling revenues to the proposal’s associated financial statements.
 Compute and record estimates for contractual allowances on revenues as well as determine and record the net collectable valuation of accounts receivables. Responsible for making appropriate adjustments to the general ledger to record bad debts, contractual allowances and appropriate evaluation for each branch of reporting within the proposal.
 Provide daily and monthly reports reflecting the detail behind the denials, free care, discounts and other allowances to better assist with further analysis and follow-up on those issues. Will assume primary responsibility for being the person to provide detail behind monthly reports for accounts receivables, including analysis of changes within the proposal’s associated goals. Reporting and analysis of all account transfers on month to month basis.
 Complete surveys, data requests, and other projects as needed and appropriate
 Maintain working knowledge of all database programs utilized for the decision support system.
 Maintain working knowledge of healthcare reimbursement policies and procedures, including knowledge of managed care contract terms.
 Develop analysis and reporting capabilities alongside community leadership members.
 Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
 Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency, and quality. Acquire data from all data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
 Work with management to prioritize business and information needs and locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
 Demonstrates a commitment to the mission of Swedish Hospital and demonstrates a service orientation and adheres to all responsibilities and standards of the organization.

 Education: Bachelor’s Degree or 5+ Years’ Experience
 Certification: N/A

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION

N/A

INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL CONTACTS

Existing relationships with local community organizations a plus

ENVIRONMENT.

Sitting and works an computer more than 90% of the time.

Reporting & Analysis: Provide analysis and insights related to pipeline health including adds, wins, and pipeline conversion, support in data mapping and cleanup for Sales Operations and Finance teams in continued modifications and enhancements to PowerBI reporting, and complete any ad hoc pipeline and sales analysis at the request of Sales, Operations and Executive Leadership.

Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM tool required

positionName: Health Solutions Financial Management Consulting Analyst
description:
Posting Description:

Aon Is Looking For A Health Solutions Financial Management Consulting Analyst
As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting Health Analytics in either our Chicago, IL or Pittsburgh, PA office.
Your Impact As A Health Solutions Financial Management Consulting Analyst
Job Responsibilities:
Be responsible for all financial activities for assigned clients
Prepare regular (monthly or quarterly) financial reporting packages for clients, leveraging existing templates
Assist in collecting and completing input for various financial models such as Incurred But Not Reported Claims model, Actuarial Value Plan Model and Pricing Models
Analyze ad hoc data using advanced functions in Excel and effectively communicate findings with both internal client team and stakeholders at the client
Conduct ad-hoc projects as needed using appropriate resources (Health Care Reform impact modeling, plan changes, self-funded vs. fully insured analysis, etc.)
Develop executive summary on all key financial components of marketing and provide recommendations
Review financial caveats, deviations and other notes in proposals, add appropriate notes to the client RFP results presentation
Review insurance carrier renewal calculations for medical, dental, vision, life and disability and identify areas for negotiation
Collect and submit needed financial data for benchmarking projects
Prepare client budget and contribution scenarios
Maintain and manage open items lists to ensure each client receives the agreed upon deliverables
Prepare and present in meetings both internal and client facing
Provide cost estimates for Healthcare Reform expected fees or upcoming taxes
Assist in new business sales opportunities as needed
You Bring Knowledge and Expertise
Required Experience:
Two plus years of health and benefits underwriting or data analyst experience, preferably in a carrier or consulting environment.
Advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. Knowledge of MS Access, SQL a plus.
Strong project management experience
Self-starter who can work well in a fast-paced, team environment
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent experience
We offer you
A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.
Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.
About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.
Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. positionName: Data Science & Analytics Consultant, Financial Services
description:
What We'll Bring:
At TransUnion, we strive to build an environment where our associates are in the driver’s seat of their professional development, while having access to help along the way. We encourage everyone to pursue passions and take ownership of their careers. With the support of colleagues and mentors, our associates are given the tools needed to get where they want to go. Regardless of job titles, our associates have the opportunity to learn new things and be a leader every day.


Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.
What You'll Bring:
Master’s or PhD degree in statistics, applied mathematics, financial mathematics, computer science, engineering, operations research, or other highly quantitative field; or a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field with at least three (3) years of relevant professional experience. In either case, the candidate will demonstrate a consistent track record of academic excellence.
Experience and demonstrated success in client-facing roles over a period of at least two (2) years as well as at least two (2) years of professional experience performing analytic work, preferably in the Financial Services industry.
Ability to apply strong project and time management skills to lead multiple projects simultaneously with limited supervision in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
Versatile interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels within and outside the organization. Proven ability to operate effectively in a complex and dynamic, matrixed environment.
Advanced programming skills and aptitude; proficiency with statistical programs such as R or Python; experience with other programming and data manipulation languages (SQL, Hive, Spark, C/C++, Java, Ab Initio); high level of familiarity with Microsoft Office tools.
This role will require the ability to travel 10-20% of the time.
Impact You'll Make:
During the COVID-19 pandemic, TransUnion has several safety protocols in place to protect associates, customers, and visitors. You may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and/or to participate in certain work-related activities. Exemption is available to qualified candidates as a reasonable accommodation.
This position is responsible for supporting the development of analytic solutions through consulting engagements for TransUnion’s clients across a broad array of credit, fraud, insurance and marketing business applications. This position requires a good general understanding of US financial services risk management practices and familiarity with credit bureau data and solutions.
You will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams to drive new business initiatives and deliver long term, value-added solutions to TransUnion customers. These tasks will include –among others- the development of predictive models and business intelligence solutions for customers within the various industries served by TransUnion.
You will lead analytic client engagements involving descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analysis for a variety of business use cases leveraging multiple analytic techniques. As a project leader, you will take ownership of all aspects of the project from design, to development, to peer review, to client presentation, to implementation and audit.
You will have First Point of Contact responsibilities for a variety of clients, working to identify strategies and opportunities to test and adopt TransUnion’s analytic products and services. In this capacity, you will interact directly with TransUnion Sales and business unit partners and provide an analytic perspective and general support as needed. You will deliver analytic insights and recommendations in succinct and compelling presentations for internal and external customers representing a wide range of backgrounds and levels.
You will provide oversight and hands-on support for the development of analytic solutions using languages such as R, Python, SQL, Hive and Spark, formalizing some of these efforts into repeatable process improvements.
You will contribute to research and innovation initiatives in collaboration with other DSA peers and may lead small analytic research teams or manage research interns on a project basis, as needed.
You will participate in the mentoring and training of junior colleagues, fostering a high-performance culture and cultivating an environment that promotes excellence and reflects the TransUnion brand.
You may participate in the interviewing and evaluation of new talent.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

TransUnion's Internal Job Title:
Consultant, Data Science and Analytics

A top producing investment real estate sales team at Marcus & Millichap, the nation's leading commercial real estate investment sales company, is seeking a Data & Research Administrator to work in their Chicago Oak Brook office. This person will be responsible for a high volume of data management, market research, and general administrative tasks on a fast-paced commercial real estate team.
This is a full-time non-exempt/hourly position.
Specific Responsibilities:
Update and maintain client database based on retail development in planning, permitting, construction and recently completed phases.
Update database based on needs and leads of agent.
Update and optimize existing database software and
Implement processes to improve collection and use of data within the team.
Correctly categorizing properties and clients in database for sorting purposes.
Updating categorization of client records and/or adding notes to record tracking their current acquisitions, sales, and contact information changes.
Updating ownership and property information in database subsequent to a property sale, by using multiple online research tools.
Constructing research and call reports based on varying requests by agents, through collecting information from various online programs and current team database.
Conducting market research and comp info.
General administrative tasks assigned as needed.
Job Requirements:
Ability to prioritize critical tasks and work well in a deadline driven atmosphere.
Ability to communicate extremely well.
Possess a strong desire to learn new concepts and master new software applications.
Strong work ethic, verbally articulate and detail-oriented.
Strong knowledge of Salesforce, MS Office-Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Strong editing skills, i.e., spelling, grammar, punctuation.
Type 50+ WPM.
Basic real estate understanding/knowledge preferred but not required.
Data entry experience preferred.
Editing (Spelling, Grammar, Punctuation)
Experience with commercial real estate focused programs preferred but not required (CoStar, Loopnet, LexisNexis, etc.)
Our mission is to help our clients create and preserve wealth by providing the best real estate investment sales, financing, research, and advisory services available.
Founded in 1971, Marcus & Millichap (NYSE: MMI) is a leading commercial real estate brokerage firm focusing exclusively on investment sales, financing, research, and advisory services, with nearly 2,100 investment sales and financing professionals in 80+ offices throughout the United States and Canada.
Marcus & Millichap closes 4.5 transactions every business hour – more than any other real estate investment brokerage firm in the nation. In 2020, the firm closed 8,954 transactions with a sales volume of approximately $43.4 billion.
The firm has perfected a powerful property marketing system that integrates broker specialization by property type and market area; the industry’s most comprehensive investment research; a long-standing culture of information sharing; relationships with the largest pool of qualified investors; and state-of-the-art technology that matches buyers and sellers.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint Visio, SharePoint)

Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Strong inter-personal and relationship building skills
Negotiation, and relationship management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational and planning skills
Critical thinking, analysis skills and problem solving skills

CCBA (Certification of Capability in Business Analysis)

positionName: Commerce Business Analyst/Senior Commerce Business Analyst
description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint has been recognized among the top customer experience consultancies in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Experience Strategy Consulting Practices, Q4 2020.
Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.
Our Commitment to You
No matter who you are, where you come from, whom you love, what you believe, or what you geek out about, we bring people together to make great work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!
Intro
The Business Analyst is ultimately responsible and accountable for business, functional, technical, and operational requirements for a solution. The BA ensures that the final deliverable of a software development project meets the intended needs of the business. This person acts as the primary liaison and source of truth for solution requirements and is the primary business representative in the design and development of the solution.
What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make
Effectively and efficiently define, plan, and prioritize deliverables to meet project goals and scope of work.
Serve as the primary point of contact between client stakeholders and internal teams to partner and provide solution strategy.
Plan and manage tasks associated with collecting, communicating and documenting requirements for software development.
Structure stakeholder sessions, groom user stories, and coordinate with design, development and testing.
Integrate research, team ideas, and client feedback into solution requirements.
Partner with design and development peers to present work and gather feedback.
Communicate and document decisions, recommendations and needs clearly and consistently to teams, clients, and internal stakeholders.
Work with cross functional teams to create and deliver innovative solutions.
Actively monitor project progress, risks, and scope to anticipate and address issues before they arise.
Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are encouraged.
What We’d Love to See
You have worked business analyst, product management or another role where you were instrumental in defining and realizing solution requirements.
You are driven by attention to detail throughout strategic and tactical implementation phases.
You possess business and systems analysis skills, test planning, and experience with standard development environments, architectures and platforms such as Sitecore, Episerver and Adobe.
You have expertise in crafting wonderful experiences with mobile apps, websites, intranet, portals and client/server architectures.
You possess strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills and communicate clearly with clients, cross functional teams, and internal stakeholders verbally and in written correspondence.
You have demonstrated that you can easily work with everyone from designers to developers to business development.
You display diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through issues with clients or with project teams.
You are comfortable working in an agile/Scrum and waterfall software development environment and participating in Scrum ceremonies.
You maintain awareness of new and emerging technologies and the potential application on client engagements.
You have the ability to strategize initiatives with clients and help define their roadmap or improvements in their solutions.
Benefits and Perks at Rightpoint
Flexible PTO
Casual and open office environment
Flexible Work Schedule
Great insurance coverage and flexible spending accounts (Multiple Options)
401k with Company Matching
Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Volunteering, Game Nights, Cultural and Diversity Spotlights, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, etc.
Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
EEO Statement
Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

Customer Business Analyst - Retail
(Job Number: BUS01004X)
Primary Location US-IL-Northfield

JOB SUMMARY

The Customer Business Analyst role thrives on ensuring the customers’ compliance requirements are met and that our return on efforts is maximized. This role works closely with our customers and operations to ensure customer satisfaction. This role will drive a variety of analytical and process-related duties to manage the customer compliance interface with key customers, communicate changes of requirements, validate potential compliance chargebacks and work with various business resources to reduce/eliminate compliance issues.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Deliver year over year cost reduction through process definition, implementation and monitoring of KBI’s that measure the health of the Cost of Failure (CoF) process to drive customer improvements.

Conduct audit activities to analyze current processes and workflow improvements to reduce the costs of failure, i.e. fines, penalties, damages, shortages, and returns.

Monitor key customers for changes in requirements regarding fill rate, on-time delivery, compliance fines, packing slips, barcodes and other system changes

Handle customer dispute process in customers’ system for invalid claim, complete all necessary requirements to ensure pre-notification, customer notifications are tracked, traced and disputed if applicable.

Drive continuous improvement and interaction with other departments and contacts to foster greater communication – Sales, Customer Service, Finance, Distribution, and Customers.

Manage, daily, weekly, monthly reports that track compliance and cost of failure activity.

Review potential compliance issues to root cause, deliver customer resolutions and working with other leaders to develop solutions to prevent reoccurrence.

Assist management in developing strategic improvement plans; own the delivery and execution of those plans.

MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education

Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field.

Work Experience

At least 2 years of experience evaluating information to determine compliance with standards, laws, and regulations.

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

Ability to identify and define issues, develop criteria, and analyze complex business data.
Ability to lead improvement of both manual and automated systems.
Team-oriented and collaborative working style with demonstrated leadership and facilitation skills.
Good planning and problem-solving skills with proven track record in achieving results through teamwork.
Strong communication skills.
Strong relationship management skills with customers and personnel within the organization.
Must have strong ethics.
Advanced Excel User, required knowledge with building pivot tables, excel concatenate function and using “if” statement formulas

PREFERRED JOB REQUIREMENTS

Work Experience

Contract compliance experience.
Experience with CPG mass customer retail portals, Walmart, Amazon, CVS or Specialty sites.

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

Ability to manage projects and process improvement initiatives.

Chicago, IL

Product management operations

Communication development and support

Coordinate large scale communications in collaboration with marketing team

BS or BA degree required, financial or technical discipline preferred
5+ years’ experience with business analysis with both financial and product implications

Proactively identifies risks associated with a proposed solution in relation to the identified business requirements
Communicates clearly to both business and technical audiences at all levels, including financial data and documentation of technical requirements
Builds effective working relationships with internal and external team members; secures the trust of business stakeholders by demonstrating an understanding of their business

The American Medical Association is located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611 and is convenient to all public transportation in Chicago.

About The Opportunity:

We’re all about connecting hungry diners with our network of over 300,000 restaurants nationwide. Innovative technology, user-friendly platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities set us apart and make us an industry leader in the world of online food ordering. When you join our team, you become part of a community that works together to innovate, solve problems, grow, work hard and have a ton of fun in the process!
Why Work For Us
Grubhub is a place where authentically fun culture meets innovation and teamwork. We believe in empowering people and opening doors for new opportunities. If you’re looking for a place that values strong relationships, embraces diverse ideas–all while having fun together–Grubhub is the place for you!
Grubhub is looking for a bright, curious and energetic Senior Analyst of Product Analytics to join the data nerds on the Product Analytics and Experimentation Team at GrubHub. The team is the analytical engine of the company - we surface insights that drive strategy and optimal decision making for the Executive team and leaders across the organization. In this role, you will be responsible for understanding the ‘who, what, and whys’ of our business - working cross-functionally to dig into trends and surface value-creating opportunities.
The Impact You Will Make:
Collaborate with product management stakeholders to design and deliver analysis that informs our product roadmap
Build business cases that evaluate opportunities prior to changes being built/tested and validate impact post-launch
Provide ad-hoc analysis to isolate consumer pain points and identify potential solutions
Monitor KPIs and business drivers, highlighting trends and investigating underlying causes of discrepancies
Prepare KPI reports for the senior leadership teams
Be curious! Proactively surface insights and trends that improve our customer experience and help us grow faster!
What You Bring to the Table:
4-6 years of experience in data analytics or a closely related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of leveraging data insights to influence business decisions
Ability to independently communicate analyses to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior leadership
Skills to work with large datasets and perform custom aggregations and data cleaning to meet analysis needs; SQL proficiency required
Understanding of data visualization best practices and tools (Excel skills required and Tableau experience preferred)
Understanding of basic statistical concepts (statistical significance, confidence intervals, etc) preferred
Functional experience with one or more of the following: product analytics, loyalty/subscription program analytics, website/app UI/UX optimization, and/or A/B testing is a plus
Experience working in a fast-moving e-commerce or other consumer internet company is a plus
And Of Course, Perks!:

Flexible PTO/PTO. Grubhub employees enjoy a generous amount of time to recharge.
Health and Wellness. Excellent medical benefits, employee network groups and paid parental leave are just a few of our programs to support your overall well-being.
Competitive Pay. You’ll receive a competitive base salary with eligibility for generous incentives, bonuses, commission or RSUs (role-specific).
Learning and Career Growth. Your personal and professional development is a priority at Grubhub. We empower you to be a leader and grow your career through training, coaching and mentorship opportunities.
MealPerks. Get meals on us! Our employees get a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy and support local restaurants.
Fun. Every Grubhub office has an employee-led Culture Crew that connects people through fun, meaningful events and initiatives like Wellness Wednesdays, Slack competitions and virtual happy hours!
Social Impact. At Grubhub we believe in giving back through programs like the Grubhub Community Relief Fund and donating $1 million to the Equal Justice Initiative in 2020. Employees are also given paid time off each year to support the causes that are important to them.
COVID-19 Response. All of our employees are currently working from home and will be for the foreseeable future. We look forward to seeing everyone in-office when it’s safe to return.

Good presentation skills (ability to transform complex analyses into a simple story)

Extensive knowledge of Excel

Experience designing and developing business facing dashboards and data visualizations in BI platforms

Understanding of advanced statistical methodologies (regression, clustering, probability, etc.) and academic research methodologies

Interpersonal Skills:
Excellent customer relationship skills and ability to listen and communicate well at all levels of the company

Great attention to detail with solution-oriented attitude that focuses on continuous improvement and can navigate around ambiguity

High degree of professional judgment, professional maturity, integrity, credibility

Preferred experience in CRM applications including Salesforce and Service Cloud

Are you a math stats driven professional looking to work for a growing company? Do you like working remotely or in a corporate setting? Are you interested in the diverse environment of downtown Chicago? How about starting a career with a growing and financially stable Berkshire Hathaway Company?

Apply to be a Railcar Reliability Analyst in our Chicago, IL location!
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Railcar Reliability Analyst is responsible for managing the Fleet Reliability Program for the Union Tank Car railcar fleet and performing statistical analysis of data captured. This position collaborates with the Fleet Engineers ensuring that UTC captures data from all available internal and external sources to support the LBU's repair, inspection and quality programs. This position ensures that UTC has an effective reliability program that drives maintenance and qualification decisions for the UTC railcar fleet.
Primary responsibilities and/or essential functions include, but are not limited to:
Manages the fleet reliability program for the UTC owned railcar fleet.
Supports the Fleet Engineering repair, maintenance and quality programs by capturing and analyzing data from all available internal and external sources.
Analyzes data from inspection, repair and qualification records, as well as external data sources which report failure or inspection data.
Ensures that analyses are effectively documented and communicated to fleet engineers, engineering management and other stakeholders.
Works collectively with Fleet Engineers to identify and implement improvements to the maintenance, qualification and design of railcars based on findings of analyses.
Identifies trends and correlations of issues in design, defects, maintenance, components and commodity influence utilizing a reliability software tool.
Implements the collection of new data and refinement of existing data sources.
Validates the quality of existing data sources by performing audits.
Interprets results from analytical evaluation tools and effectively communicates the results to management.
Provides results of inquiries for fleet analyses requested by MBU, LBU, RBU and Procor.
Identifies opportunities for improvement in the data collected, analysis methodology and reporting.
Participates in and actively supports quality projects and activities and Responsible Care initiatives to ensure that the Company achieves its goals.

Skills/Specifications:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical and data gathering skills.
Detail orientated with the ability to multi-task and manage time effectively.
Comprehension of statistical life data analysis.
Competent in life data analysis software. Weibull++ preferred.
Proficient in developing and executing queries of data repositories.
Ability to travel outside of the normal place of work via car, train and/or airplane.

The incumbent works to meet internal and external customer expectations at all times by fully applying oneself to the task involved, preventing errors, and developing and implementing personal quality improvement projects. In addition, the incumbent is required to understand the Responsible Care Management System and actively participate in activities outlined therein.
Education/Experience/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering or related field required.
Minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience.
Professional certification such as Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE) is beneficial.

Job Profile

Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Loan Closing Analyst Senior - Mortgage within PNC's Mortgage operations organization, you will be based in Jacksonville, FL, Downers Grove, IL, or Pittsburgh, PA.

Job Description

Closes varied and more complex loans without supervision and disburses loan funds. Prepares and/or reviews all loan documents for completeness and accuracy.
Reviews documentation and verifies work processes to ensure completeness, accuracy and conformance to established service levels and applicable policies and procedures. Prepares and/or reviews more complex loan-closing documentation based on approval documentation. Responsible for sharing best practices with team members and recommending process improvement. Represents department on projects and initiatives.
Partners with internal and/or external business partners to route communications, documents or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately. May interact with customers and/or have assigned accounts.
Provides responses and documentation to inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes loan set up sheets and other necessary documentation for entry into the bank's loan system.
May schedule time frames for loan closings in light of loan commitments and customer needs.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Data Gathering and Analysis – Knowledge of data gathering and analysis tools, techniques and processes; ability to use these to gather and analyze data on the learning needs of a target population.

Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.

Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

Managing Multiple Priorities – Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.

Negotiating – Knowledge of successful negotiation concepts and techniques; ability to negotiate successfully across the organization and with external vendors and clients in a constructive and collaborative manner.

Operational Functions – Knowledge of major functional processes and associated operating requirements; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Planning and Organizing – Mobilizes both time and resources to get things done.

Problem Management Process – Knowledge of and ability to bring a reported problem to successful resolution.

Products and Services – Knowledge of major products and services and product and service groups; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Standard Operating Procedures – Knowledge of and ability to design, implement and evaluate standard operating procedures affecting daily and strategic business operations in order to increase operational efficiency.

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require an Associates or equivalent degree as well as related experience or product knowledge to accomplish primary duties. Typically requires 3+ years experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.

positionName: Revenue Integrity Analyst-Project Analytics Team, Full-time, Days
description:
Company Description
At Northwestern Medicine, every patient interaction makes a difference in cultivating a positive workplace. This patient-first approach is what sets us apart as a leader in the healthcare industry. As an integral part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to join our quest for better healthcare, no matter where you work within the Northwestern Medicine system. At Northwestern Medicine, we pride ourselves on providing competitive benefits: from tuition reimbursement and loan forgiveness to 401(k) matching and lifecycle benefits, we take care of our employees. Ready to join our quest for better?

Job Description
The Revenue Integrity Analyst reflects the mission, vision, and values of Northwestern Medicine, adheres to the organization’s Code of Ethics and Corporate Compliance Program, and complies with all relevant policies, procedures, guidelines and all other regulatory and accreditation standards.
The Revenue Integrity Analyst will be responsible for duties classified under one of five subgroups of Revenue Integrity; CDM/Pricing, Charge Capture, Data Analytics, Professional Billing, and Project Management as detailed in the addendum section. The Revenue Integrity Analyst will support Finance, Clinical Departments and Revenue Cycle to ensure accurate, fair and compliant billing for services.
Responsibilities:
Work and review the Revenue Integrity Account, Charge Review, Claim Edit, Router Review work queues for issue resolution; review for trends/recurring issues and identify required remediation efforts.
Review departmental front-end charge capture tools for accuracy. Take necessary action to ensure accurate charging on patient accounts.
Meet financial objectives by identifying and evaluating trends; analyzing variances; initiating any corrective actions or adjustments.
Provide support and analysis by querying appropriate data, preparing reports, making presentations of analysis, findings, and recommendations to management.
Research and understand changes in the healthcare regulatory environment and the potential impact on reporting.
Lead efforts to assess, modify, and/or develop and implement more timely and consistent processes/systems to increase efficiency, accuracy, and meaningfulness of information.
Complete special projects as directed by Revenue Integrity leadership
Act as a liaison for Clinical Operations, Finance, IT, and Revenue Cycle to identify and resolve charge issues and special projects
Effectively and professionally communicate results, challenges, and solutions through regular reports and monthly meetings with regional CFOs.
Stay abreast of regulatory changes on a national and local level.
Consistently delivers concrete, relevant results. Displays qualities of resiliency and resourcefulness while thinking strategically and practically when problem solving. In addition to results orientation, displays business knowledge, speed and decisiveness, and project management.
Research billing and coding regulations. Communicate and assist in implementing any necessary changes to impacted area that affect policy, financial, charge capture, patient care, billing, and coding operations.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, adopting and implementing industry best practices, and participating in professional societies.
Protect operations by keeping financial and patient information confidential.

Qualifications
Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Healthcare Management, HIM, Finance or related field or 10+ years of equivalent experience with progressive advancement.
3+ years of relevant experience
Excellent verbal and written communication, collaboration, analytical, and accounting skills
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
Proven facilitation / presentation skills
Moderate / Advanced understanding of CPT coding and third party billing requirements
Knowledge and experience with Medicare/Medicaid regulation
Minimum of one EPIC Certification or Certification must be obtained within six months of employment
Preferred:
EPIC Certification (CDM, HB, PB, Clarity, and/or Caboodle)
RHIA preferred or related health care credential (e.g. Radiology technician, RN, CPC, CPC-H, CCS, COC) or CPA or CHFP certification.
Clinical experience blended with Finance/Revenue Cycle experience is a plus
Experience in Healthcare Management, Business, MIS, Data Analytics, or related field.
Beginner to Moderate knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
#LI-RW1
