Senior BI Analyst
Become part of the WernerCo team.
WHY WERNER? BECAUSE WE ARE THE PRO'S CHOICE!
You will find our market leading products and brands on trucks and job sites all over the world. Our team is focused on building relationships, insights, category analysis, and ultimately servicing our customer. On jobsites across America and the world, WernerCo brands are most preferred.
WernerCo is looking for talented individuals that want to be a part of a digital transformation of a near 100-year-old company with a start-up feel. New leadership and a new business strategy have driven the need for technology upgrades across the global enterprise and we have been adding to the team to help achieve our new IT strategy.
Purpose of the Job:
As a Senior Business Analyst in WernerCo’s Global IT department you will be working in a challenging and rewarding role collaborating with business stakeholders and other IT team members to design, develop, and deploy Business Analytics dashboards. These solutions are core to WernerCo’s business strategy will enable data transformation across the enterprise and will utilize the latest technology.
Key Responsibilities (Essential Job Functions):
Analyze external data sources from various ERPs, CRM, PIM/PLM, and various other business applications to integrate with existing datasets and relate a comprehensive BI story.
Build compelling, interactive, and actionable reporting on top of structured data models that helps in deriving meaningful business insights from large, complex datasets.
Supporting the full BI lifecycle from requirements analysis through design & development, and through release and support/maintenance phases.
Populate a cloud data warehouse semantic layer using standard design patterns.
Collaborate on identified ad hoc business problem-solving requests.
Train team members/users on Power BI tool, dashboards, and reports.
Demonstrate intellectual curiosity to understand end to end business processes and assist in creating short and long-term solutions drive business productivity.
Experience & Education:
Required:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Business Studies/Administration/Management, Science & Technology, Commerce or equivalent in industry experience
5 year(s) of working experience in a corporate IT environment or in a role delivering technical solutions.
3-5 years of Business Intelligence or Data Analytics experience – experience with Snowflake and Microsoft Power BI preferred
Experience translating ERP transaction information into compelling data stories in a manufacturing environment.
ETL Experience is preferred (Matillion ETL Software a plus)
Business Analysis certification is preferred but not required (ECBA, CCBA, CBAP, CBATL)
Key Competencies:
Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry
Develops functional specifications and system design specifications for client engagements
Track requirement and task progress in Agile and Kanban processes (Microsoft Azure Dev-ops preferred)
Expert with industry standard Business Analysis tools, standards, and techniques
Familiarity with JD Edwards, SAP, and Salesforce a plus
Expert in Microsoft Office applications

We Are:
Accenture Interactive—a new breed of agency that’s all about the Experience. For us, customer experience is not an add-on; it’s foundational to who we are and how we empower our clients. As the world’s largest, most disruptive agency, we drive lasting growth for clients by helping them design, build, and run meaningful experiences that make people’s lives better, more productive, and more meaningful. We do this in three ways: by transforming organizations through standout products and services; by building and delivering award-winning campaigns so brands can engage and communicate creatively with customers at scale; and by using our top-notch skills to pilot, integrate, scale, and run the platforms that underpin the world’s greatest experiences. Visit us here to learn more about what makes us the Experience Agency.
The digital economy has caused a massive increase in the amount and importance of digital content. Digital content and the customer experiences it fuels are, together, a vital expression of a brand’s voice and purpose. We help leading brands create and deliver the right content for the right customer at the right time for immersive, relevant experiences. We offer an end-to-end approach to the content lifecycle and cut through the complexity for improved speed to market and relevance, at scale. Our unique tools and services organize, store and optimize content, including taxonomy, rights and asset management, analytics and quality assurance.
Job Description:
Do clients rely on your impressive ability to define and implement innovative, web-based solutions that transform their ability to acquire and engage customers? Or perhaps you’ve become the go-to thought leader for eCommerce and web content management systems? If driving the business and functional requirements of large-scale projects fits squarely within your digital wheelhouse, Accenture may be the perfect place to build your career.
The work:
Participate in the analysis, design, and implementation of relevant WCM platforms such as Adobe AEM (Sites and Assets), Sitecore, Acquia/Drupal, and Episerver
Apply specific functional knowledge of WCM and ecommerce applications to help guide the design and implementation of the solution
Manage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover work
Identify opportunities and show forward thinking approach in defining AEM components, templates, use cases, and opportunities for efficiencies
Prepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and work-flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle
Provide oversight and hands on within Adobe AEM (Sites, Assets) setup, taxonomy and configurations through SDLC
Supports client across SDLC in production and review of functional design, site demos, and hands-on training within AEM (content authoring, site assembly, DAM setup, AEM workflows, etc.)
Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios
Serve as the bridge between PM, QA, development and client teams
Prepare training materials (content authoring guides, etc.) appropriate for target audiences and develop solution and conduct training sessions
Assist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-concepts
Identify and raise project issues and risks over course of SDLC
Support the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team members
Showcase deliverables and demos across client teams
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need:
3+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements
2+ years of full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies
1+ year of implementing web content management and/or eCommerce applications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
Experience working with relevant Adobe Marketing Cloud solutions such as Adobe AEM Forms, Magento, Target, Analytics, AEP, Campaign or other best of breed products.
Experience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-cases
Ability to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stakeholders along with ability to walk stakeholders through AEM authoring, site assembly, DAM setup, etc.
Experience working with agile methodology
Experience in working with both backend (AEM) and front-end UI development teams in parallel as well as with creative design teams
Experience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation

Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. company: The Inland Real Estate Group of Companies, Inc
description:
The Business Analyst role helps align Inland Real Estate Investment Corp (IREIC) investment systems to support scalable growth and provide insight-focused analysis to support leadership decisions. This role will assist the Head of Investment System Strategies in implementing strategic business technology to improve operational speed and efficiency, creating more accessible and reliable systems, and establishing best practices for business analytics and data usage across several business entities.

The Business Analyst will actively engage with business leaders and subject matter experts (SMEs) to identify core business requirements, establish end-to-end business process workflows, and suggest modifications to improve accuracy and consistency of data and reports. On occasion, this position will work with Inland’s Information Technology team and other inland entities to implement and administer tools, and to assist with planning and implementing an effective approach to meeting Inland strategic initiatives. The role requires outstanding communications skills and the ability to establish good working relationships with individuals at all levels of the firm. We're looking for a self-starter, individual contributor with a passion for solving complex business problems.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Demonstrate highest standards of personal and professional integrity and adheres to the company’s policies and procedures and complies with applicable laws, government rules, and regulations.
Work with business partners to understand, analyze, and document detailed functional requirements to support business and project objectives.
Conduct stakeholder interviews to understand current state business processes and create workflow diagrams.
Work closely with business partners to understand project objectives, goals, milestones, and timelines; assist in preparing and delivering findings to leadership with comprehensive risk and impact assessment.
Perform analysis on large sets of data and derive insights to inform business requirements and objectives.
Work with key stakeholders to analyze and document strategic reporting and data visualization needs, translating those requirements to actionable project tasks.
Develop comprehensive end-to-end test cases at the application and multi-application levels. This includes performing quality assurance testing, test case creation, and defect logging and closure.
Assist in overseeing the implementation of approved process improvements, and participate in project meetings acting as a SME, providing guidance on business objectives.
Provide training sessions and workshops to guide relevant teams.
Collaborate with technical and business partners to implement, support, and integrate business solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and design integrated solutions for complex business problems.
Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:

Bachelor's degree in finance, mathematics, data science, computer science or related field required.
Advanced degree preferred.

Experience and skills:

This position requires at least 5+ years of experience in the Financial Services industry, preferably in Real Estate Asset Management.
Background in business analysis, requirements gathering and working with project teams, vendors, business stakeholders, and engineering to develop and design solutions
Strong technical and business analysis skills. Must be driven and focused on business outcomes and delivery of business value
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with all levels of an organization.
Conceptual mentality, learner, and effective problem solver.
Ability to translate user feedback to measurable items.
Ability to establish, cultivate and influence a network of data stewards and owners with winning solutions for all.
Detail, process-oriented, and skilled at developing auditable documentation or processes.
Experience with PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, and other Microsoft Office tools
Intermediate to advanced skills in SQL, R, Python, Tableau, or Google Analytics preferred.
Knowledge of Salesforce, HubSpot, Yardi, Front, and Dealpath are a plus.

Multicultural Statement

At DePaul University, we are looking for candidates who want to join us in our mission to provide access to education for all. Successful candidates welcome ideas and perspectives from colleagues and students representing a wide variety of cultures, backgrounds, religious beliefs, and experiences. We seek collaborative, open-minded, and hard-working professionals to work in a real-world urban learning environment. Are you exceptional, yet modest and open to challenges? We seek achievers and leaders that want to bring their passion and skills to our well-respected community of approachable colleagues. Build your career with us.


General Summary

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Process Improvement & Internal Control, the Sr. Analyst, Process Improvement & Internal Control is responsible for assisting with the university's strategic efforts to maintain effective and efficient business processes. In coordination with functional leaders throughout the Executive Vice President's Office, Financial Affairs, Information Systems, and the rest of the university, the Sr. Analyst will ensure business processes both within our ERP and in general, are developing as effectively as possible. This position is responsible for assisting with the design and implementation of business processes that maintain adequate controls, and are compliant with relevant university policies and procedures. The Sr. Analyst, under guidance from the Sr. Manager, will work with stakeholders throughout the university to identify weaknesses, develop existing processes and ensure utilization and effectiveness of our financial systems. New processes will also be developed to maintain compliance and provide additional value and service to end-users in functional areas and throughout the university. The Sr. Analyst will be responsible for internal consulting, research and solution development, review of internal controls, optimization, system maintenance, quarterly update management, and change implementation strategy.

Responsibilities & Duties
Review business processes to identify weaknesses and work closely with functional leads in relevant areas to identify solutions.
Collect suggestions and feedback.
Focus on value add activities to systematize manual processes, while documenting and maintaining efficient and effective internal controls (working closely with Internal Audit & Compliance).
Ensure the university is maximizing the utilization and effectiveness of Oracle Cloud and that existing business processes work coherently with our new system.
Conduct periodic reviews of business processes with functional areas.
Effectively research, implement, coordinate and participate in Quarterly Oracle ERP system updates. This includes understanding all aspects of required and optional changes, understanding the product road map, and ensuring functional areas are testing and understanding functionality.
Updates with a wider impact may also require communication and change management to the university community.
Provide general system maintenance and oversight to ensure all aspects of the new system are functional, including hierarchies, chart of accounts, cross-validation rules, allocation rules, the budget set up, report tables, etc.
Identify opportunities for efficiencies within these processes, and document the underlying concepts and processes.
Work closely with Budgets & Operational Reporting team to ensure the integrity of all hierarchies and rules.
Develop system-oriented KPIs and process observation metrics that will allow the Executive Vice President's Office to passively monitor operations and identify issues.
Document business processes in each functional area in the Executive Vice President's division, and ensure that as an area goes through structural changes or turnover, the integrity of systems, processes, and controls are maintained, and possibilities for efficiencies are explored. This may include short-term projects and assignments at the discretion of the Executive Vice President's Office.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Education & Experience
Strong analytic and financial skills, including knowledge of business processes and workflows.
Bachelor's degree in business, logistics or related field.
Minimum 5 years experience in financial operations or a closely related field.
Minimum 2 years experience relating to business process redesign, or process optimization.
Experience using ERP systems.
Preferred Requirements
 Advanced degree.
Managerial Responsibilities
Responsible for 1 full-time employee.
Ensures all employees are appropriately trained, receive professional development opportunities, and are properly managed.
If future vacancies are filled, supervisory responsibilities will be 20% of this role's responsibilities.
Financial Responsibilities
Responsible for assisting with the development of processes that are complicit with university policies and compliance guidelines.
Ensure system updates are tested and utilized to maintain the integrity of ERP and associated financial controls.
Develops and implements KPIs and general metrics to observe activity, identify inefficiencies, and propose solutions.
Coordinate with department functional leads to maximize process efficiencies and system utilization. Contacts - This position provides guidance on policies and procedures to individuals throughout the university, at executive and nonexecutive levels.
Information - This position requires access to information that is considered confidential. This may include employee, student, or university information.
Other Skills & Abilities Required
Resourceful, flexible, and able to anticipate and resolve problems effectively, with a capacity for understanding the relationship of specific tasks to the broader operations and administrative functions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to communicate with clarity, tact, and courtesy, and demonstrate judgment and discretion in the sharing of sensitive information.
Experience with identification, documentation, and assessment of risks and controls in financial and operational processes.
Highly organized and detail-oriented in order to track, manage, and resolve multiple ongoing projects and responsibilities in a timely, efficient, and accurate manner.
Ability to work effectively with a wide variety of constituents at a variety of levels throughout the University, and the ability to work independently as well as manage others.
Ability to translate operational objectives into strategic goals.
Ability to lead and provide oversight.
Advanced spreadsheet, database, and word processing skills, including the understanding of relational databases.
Additional Information
For consideration, please include a resume and cover letter.
As a salaried and degreed professional, evening or weekend work may be necessary when deadlines or projects need to be completed.
A criminal background check is required.

Overview

Rise Interactive (http://www.riseinteractive.com), a rapidly growing full service interactive advertising agency, is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst into our Innovation team in Chicago. We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly motivated individual contributor that is excited to contribute professionally to an entrepreneurial company with an expanding Fortune 500 client base.

Summary and Scope

The Senior Business Analyst is a functional Subject Matter Expert (SME) for one or more business systems that enable Rise Interactive to operate efficiently. You are key player in supporting the business and work on initiatives to define business processes and requirements and to lead the organization in identifying, selecting, implementing, and administering business technologies that lead to greater efficiencies and improved client responsiveness. Additionally, this position will work to ensure that all platform documentation is up to date, end users are trained to ensure they leverage the capabilities implemented for their benefit.. Our ideal candidate is someone who is detailed-oriented, has excellent communication skills, and can critically evaluate information from multiple sources.

 Responsibilities:
Work on projects to improve the core business processes and technologies across the organization.
Manages scope and business requirements at the project level
Works with business stakeholder to document business/project requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria needed to implement and deliver required capabilities to production.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with end users to analyze information needs and functional requirements and distill that information into appropriate deliverables (i.e. functional requirements, use cases, etc)
Conducts and facilitates user acceptance testing of new capabilities/systems being released to production
Evaluate and gather product KPI metrics for review with management and executives to ensure systems are support the business as expected
Leads and coordinates training sessions for end users leveraging Rise business systems
Evaluation of issues that have been escalated to the team.
Triage and prioritize defects for production business systems through collaboration with support teams and occasionally resolving issues directly with end users as needed/appropriate.
Assisting with the business case development for new initiatives to improve business operations
In collaboration with solution engineers, develops technical solutions to business problems by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements
Eliciting and organizing business / project requirements and communicating the alignment to scope clearly
In collaboration with solution engineers, develops technical solutions to business problems by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements
Assisting with the business case development for new initiatives to improve business operations

This list of essential responsibilities and functions is not exhaustive. Rise Interactive reserves the right to supplement this list, particularly if the scope of duties in this position changes.

 Required Skills:
4+ years' experience in business analysis in enterprise software implementations
Highly resourceful, confident under pressure, and professionally resourceful
Strong understanding of data management plans / client specifications and technical acumen for data entry, data integrations, API' s and EDI
Agile project management methodology experience, Scrum preferred
Strong communications skills including raising issues and risks appropriately
Strong understanding of software development lifecycle, ability to educate team on practices
Proficient working with all departments to gather, confirm and execute on business requirements
Disposition to gain trust, drive change, and lead a team to success
Expert business analysis skills, problem solving skills and ability to work in a team and collaborative environment
Proficient with Google productivity tools especially Slides, Spreadsheets & workflow tools such as LucidCharts or Visio
Great presentation and influencing skills
Detail-oriented individual
Effective at self-managing work and priorities; thrives and invents structure in an evolving, amorphous environment; high level of energy and drive for achievement
Ability to identify and resolve team impediments in an constructive a supportive manner

Education: Undergraduate degree in Computer Science related field or Masters with MBA preferred

Training: Scrum Product Owner training, Lean Six Sigma or similar accreditation a plus

Experience:

Minimum 4+ years' experience in business analysis in enterprise software implementations; special consideration given to candidates with experience implementing Salesforce and/or HR Systems such as Workday or ADP in a services or consulting business
Has written user stories or other functional and technical requirements artifacts (process flows, use cases, etc.)
Has developed and conducted end user training sessions ensuring adoption of business systems solutions

Physical and Medical Standards: Standing, walking, reaching, stooping, crouching, twisting, bending and crawling.

Working conditions and Environment: This is an office environment which requires periods of sitting, standing, bending and twisting.

EDI Analyst Job Description
Job Overview

T.NETWORK is look for a highly motivated and creative Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Analyst to facilitate the exchange of electronic data within our organization and between entities. This position is ideal for those who love to solve problems with a strong attention to detail.
About T.NETWORK

T.NETWORK is a private owned global logistics company with U.S. locations in Itasca Illinois and The Greater Los Angeles area. The company focuses on providing quality freight forwarding as well as providing services in international freight, freight procurement, global supply chain planning, contract logistics and solution design, and cross border eCommerce. T.NETWORK is guided by its core values of experience, innovation, trust, and passion. With these values, and a belief in a collaborative employee/customer experience, T.Network is dedicated to putting the fun back in freight forwarding!
Why Work with T.NETWORK?

Excellent opportunities for career growth with a growing company
Industry competitive earnings, benefits (Health, Vision, Dental, Employee Assistance Programs), and 401k.

Positive support-focused culture, collaborative work environment, strong core values that guide our mission.
Direct access to leadership.
A team-minded collaborative work environment.
The ability to see your impact on a daily basis with a small business startup.


Core Job Requirements

Translate Business Requirements into Technical Solutions
The core responsibility of an EDI analyst is to understand T.NETWORK’s needs and then develop and improve processes for the handling of EDI related matters that fulfills those requirements.
Serve as primary link with external parties to process and monitor all recurring inbound/outbound documents and creating guidelines and specifications for data exchange.
Testing Systems
 Test our systems for accuracy and get feedback on its functionality to ensure they’re set up for widespread use.
Coordinate and/or support EDI testing, implementations, upgrades and maintain EDI transactions.
Analyze and Suggest Improvements to Systems
EDI Analyst will analyze systems for accuracy and efficiency and suggest alterations to the system design and processes that will decrease errors or increase functionality.
Perform audits to ensure T.NETWORK’s quality standards are being met on a regular basis.

Provide Technical Support
Should any problems arise with the system or processes, EDI analysts troubleshoot it and create solutions. They provide documentation at every stage of the system’s life cycle so that its processes and details can easily be referenced by other analysts.
Provide additional technical expertise and support for EDI communications as needed.

EDI Analyst Skills and Qualifications

Successful candidates will have a solid understanding of information technology networking, system architecture, and coding. T.NETWORK is looking for strong problem-solvers who can think several steps ahead when developing processes and effectively communicate solutions to our team.
Qualifications

Although we will sometimes accept equivalent years of experience, they prefer candidates with a bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, or a related field.
Preferred to have 2 - 3 years of EDI experience along with the following skills:
Program Competency – Candidates are adept at using the various programming languages most commonly used to create systems that exchange electronic data
System design expertise – using strong software design and architecture principles, EDI analysts connect networks that work logically and efficiently
Troubleshooting – Candidates can leverage their understanding of system architecture and programming languages to identify the source of problems and make repairs
Analytical thinking – analyzing the strengths and weaknesses of a particular course of action is necessary at almost every stage of a system’s life cycle, whether it be the initial design process, testing, or troubleshooting
Communication skills – Successful applicants are active listeners who can translate the needs of a business or client into a technical solution, then communicate that solution back to them in a way that is easily understood
Experience with purchase order management, logistics, supply chain and/or customs strongly preferred
Highly efficient in Microsoft Suite and Visio (or comparable diagramming software)
A demonstrated ability to think strategically.
Adept at balancing priorities


What Makes T.NETWORK Different?

We don’t want to be the biggest. We want to be the best! T.NETWORK believes that providing a stable work environment for our employees and focusing on our clients and employees equally creates the perfect recipe for success. Our commitment to the employee and client experience drives us to be the number once choice for our clients and our people!
T.NETWORK is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v/so

Senior Financial & Sales Operations Analyst

Overview

Aspen Dental Management, Inc. (ADMI) is one of the largest and most trusted retail healthcare business support organizations in the U.S., supporting 15,000 healthcare professionals and team members at more than 1,000 health and wellness offices across 46 states in three distinct categories: Dental care, urgent care, and medical aesthetics. Working in partnership with independent practice owners and clinicians, the team is united by a single purpose: to prove that healthcare can be better and smarter for everyone. ADMI provides a comprehensive suite of centralized business support services that power the impact of four consumer-facing businesses: Aspen Dental, ClearChoice Dental Implant Centers, WellNow Urgent Care and Chapter Aesthetic Studio. Each brand has access to a deep community of experts, tools and resources to grow their practices, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-quality consumer healthcare experiences at scale. As a reflection of our current needs and planned growth we are very pleased to offer an opportunity to join our Finance team as a Senior Financial & Sales Operations Analyst.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Financial & Sales Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for:

Compile and analyze data over time to forecast business trends
Communicate with the Patient Financing and management team regularly
Review past business data to determine trends in productivity
Prepare accurate reports using data from internal and external sources
Evaluate third-party data to determine best practices for company success
Present actionable information and insights to team members and management
Gather and analyze data in order to understand problems and address them proactively
Collaborate with team members and members of other departments
Provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support to senior management
Identify patient financing opportunities for performance improvement across the organization related to patient financing
Develop models that help with decision-making around patient financing
Supporting the Patient Financing team through gathering and analyzing financial, metric and other data.
Creating ad hoc reports and analysis as requested
Support the Senior Vice President, Directors and Managers in Patient Financing during the budget process, including identifying outliers and proposing changes to ensure appropriate budgets
General support of the Patient Financing and FP&A management team as needed for large and small projects.
Includes modelling, forecasting, ROI and NPV calculations
Enforcing data integrity, accuracy and governance with internal and external data related to patient financing and management reporting


Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, marketing or related field; VPA or CMA a plus
Strong knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software
Ability to find and pull appropriate data, along with validating and reviewing data and reports for accuracy and completion. SQL knowledge is a plus.
Expertise in Tableau strongly desired
Advanced problem-solving and analysis skills
Superior oral and written communication skills
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative
Good attitude toward teamwork as well as the ability to work independently
Excellent time management and prioritize projects and work load
Ability to excel in fast paced environment, take direction, and handle multiple priorities
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required and must be a team player
About Aspen Dental Management, Inc.

Aspen Dental-branded practices are supported by ADMI, a dental support organization that provides non-clinical business support to licensed, independent dentists.

Available Locations
ADMI - Chicago, Illinois 60607 United States

Executes accurate, scheduled daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
Reconciles report data to ensure data integrity.
Audits processing errors or bad data points before releasing reports.
Maintains report contact database, controls user access to shared network drives and other common resources, and executes regular backups.
Maintains production reports, makes approved changes to report data by modifying Teradata SQL, formatting Excel macros, and Access databases.
Executes on demand processes and reports, adjusts input parameters, data, and formatting prior to execution, and validates report data prior to publishing results.
Assists in ad-hoc report development and execution, including modifying existing or developing new SQL, running reports, and formatting data using advanced Excel capabilities.

EXPERIENCE:
1 year required of related experience, preferably in distribution industry.
EDUCATION:
Bachelors’ Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics or a similar quantitative discipline.
APICS, CPFM, CPM preferred.
SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to follow established processes and schedule to deliver timely and consistent report execution.
Ability to work independently, check your results, troubleshoot problems and exercise judgment.
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including creating and editing macros and utilizing other advanced functionality.
Knowledge of Microsoft Access, including creating basic queries, code and reports.
Understanding of relational databases, including creating SQL statements.
Knowledge of other applications, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, proven ability to apply these in business environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of distribution industry, supply chain, purchasing, and inventory concepts, practices, and procedures.

positionName: Senior Manager Data Analytics – Consumer Data Science & Corporate Functions
description:
Company Description
McDonald’s new growth strategy, Accelerating the Arches, encompasses all aspects of our business as the leading global omni-channel restaurant brand. As the consumer landscape shifts we are using our competitive advantages to further strengthen our brand. One of our core growth strategies is to Double Down on the 3Ds (Delivery, Digital and Drive Thru). McDonald’s will accelerate technology innovation so 65M+ customers a day will experience a fast, easy experience, whether at one of our 25,000 and growing Drive Thrus, through McDelivery, dine-in or takeaway.

Job Description
We are in search of a talented Analytics professional to join our growing Data Science and Analytics organization. This role will be critical in helping modernize McDonald’s marketing, personalization, digital and corporate functions.
This dynamic individual will lead a small team of data scientists and data engineers and UX designers to deploy applied AI solutions into McDonald’s systems. This role will interact with both the central corporate headquarters as well as the various regional and global offices impacting all 118 countries.
We are looking for an experienced leader with a strong data science background and experience working with hardware and software teams to deploy AI solutions into corporate systems, across large, global markets, hands-on MLOps experienced is preferred. This will help the regions to drive and improve business results through data driven strategies, optimization, and automation.
In this role you will:
Display Leadership/Team Orientation - Work collaboratively to achieve organization’s success. Effectively uses position and interpersonal skills, mobilizes and inspires others to take action (situational leadership). Willing and able to lead beyond area of expertise. Manage/Coordinate work of direct reports, including talent development and performance management.
Coordinate with stakeholders within a specific business domain on use cases, including collaboration with IT and other corporate functions, markets and business groups. Achieve stretch results. Strong bias for action with sense of urgency and high energy. Practice collaborative working environment to achieve more.
Hold self and others to high standards, Strive to stay ahead of technical/professional expertise, is proactive and inspires others to stay current in areas of technical expertise. Perform code reviews, research, technical problem solving, solution architecture.
Business Management – Demonstrate sound business principles and planning processes and defines and measures results. Administrative, budgeting, etc.
Serve as a champion for data and analytics, enabling our teams to see the power of their story through data and providing the mentorship and support for each global team.
Maintain a focus on storytelling - understanding how data analytics can both tell, inform and drive improvement into the McDonald’s story.
Collaborate cross-functionally with every department and region in need of data driven analytics.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar technical fields
Master’s degree in Data Science, Math or Data Analytics preferred but not required
Technical knowledge in the analytics space and management of advanced analytics talent
Experience managing technical teams, preferably in Artifical Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, and Analytics
Experience in developing and deploying solutions at the edge and integrating with legacy systems, including hands-on MLOps experience
Previous corporate or consulting experience in managing analytical projects in large cross-functional organizations such as retail, restaurant or food service, CPG, financial services, etc.
Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and big data architecture; prior experience in partnering with IT to drive large data management initiatives
Proficiency with data science tools like Databricks, MLFlow, Sagemaker, Alteryx, Microstrategy and understanding of languages like R, Python and SQL
Background in managing and/or working with real-time, streaming data sources
Experience optimizing inference solutions for environments with limited compute power
Experience with varied data environments and data storytelling
Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI
Experience with regression and other supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning modeling techniques, with the ability to explain these complex principles in simple understandable language
Experience in natural language processing, voice recognition, and RPA automation highly preferred
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccination by date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination required.
Additional Information
McDonald’s is proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries that serve 70 million customers daily. As the global leader in the food service industry, our legacy of innovation and hard work continues to drive us.
From drive thru updates to delivery to mobile order and pay, we are innovating quickly and growing. Joining McDonald's means thinking big and preparing for a career that can have influence around the world.
At McDonald’s, we see every day as a chance to create positive impact. We lead through our values centered on inclusivity, service, integrity, community and family. From support of Ronald McDonald House Charities to our Youth Opportunity project and sustainability initiatives, our values keep us dedicated to using our scale for good: good for our customers, people, industry and planet. We also offer outstanding benefits including a sabbatical program, tuition assistance and flexible work arrangements.
While most of us are working remote during COVID-19, we're excited to get back to our state-of-the-art headquarters in the booming West Loop of downtown Chicago! It's set up to be a global hub that cultivates collaboration:
Take a class at Hamburger University
Sample future items in our Test Kitchen
Utilize the latest technology to connect with your team around the globe
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to the diversity of our crew members, staff, operators, and suppliers. We promote an inclusive work environment that creates feel-good moments for everyone. We are interested in people who enhance our company culture: Does this role interest you? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single requirement!
McDonald’s is committed to providing qualified individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to perform the essential functions of their jobs. Additionally, if you (or another applicant of whom you are aware) require assistance accessing or reading this job posting or otherwise seek assistance in the application process, please contact recruiting.supportteam@us.mcd.com

positionName: Sr. Manager, Customer Success Operations and Data Analyst
description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Sr. Manager, Customer Success Operations and Data Analyst
The Customer Success Business Operations Manager is a key role in the Splunk Customer Success Strategy and Operations organization. You will be part of a team chartered to drive a centralized operating motion across all Customer Success functions (CS Sales, Professional Services, CSM/Renewals, Support, and Education), and responsible for dramatically improving the scalability of our Global Customer Success Team. This is a highly visible role within CS, as your interactions will touch key leaders of all CS functions.
Responsibilities:
Role:
This Senior Manager role in Customer Success is key to the continued growth and scale of Splunk and our Customer Success Strategy. You will be part of a team chartered to drive a centralized operating motion across all Customer Success functions (CS Sales, Professional Services, CSM/Renewals, Support, and Education), and responsible for dramatically improving the scalability of our Global Customer Success Team. This is a highly visible role within CS, as your interactions will touch key leaders of all CS functions. Working cross functionally with a broad set of business partners, you will use keen business process understanding, appreciation for simplicity and quality, critical thinking, and a bit of elbow grease to craft holistic solutions that meet business and technology objectives while furthering Splunk’s long range goals.
Responsibilities:
Understand the key business/transformational processes of the functions, and their associated performance metrics- Assist the functional leaders with new metrics, better understanding of the performance, and using data to make decisions.
Work with the BI and Data Analytics teams to bring key, data-driven metric dashboards to the functions, and customer insights in the Adopt to Renew cycle.
Drive cross-functional processes around defining, prioritizing, and tracking action plans, and monitoring key metrics for CS.
Help manage the CS Centralized Ops operating cadence to ensure leadership meetings and other structures are appropriate and facilitate effective and timely communication.
Actively participate in creating and delivering key operational updates for CS leadership, executive leadership team, cross functional teams, and external audiences.
Identify and take on ad-hoc operational projects, closing gaps in business and operations.
Review CS central operations processes and policies to help enhance workflow and develop a stronger operating model.
Collaborate with CS operations leaders to drive effective cross-functional and cross-collaboration alignment to deliver CS-wide outcomes (eg Cost to serve coverage models, customer segmentation modeling and scale, CS Bookings pacing and trends)
Collaborate with the key partners to the CS Ops team (i.e IT/Biz Apps, HR, Comms, GTM, GBO, Finance, etc) to drive effective collaboration and delivery of work.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. MBA/Consulting experience preferred.
7+ years operating in a SaaS oriented Customer Success function (as outlined above), sales/business operations
Subject matter expertise in CS tools: Salesforce, Gainsight, G-Suite, Tableau, other SaaS tools.
Top-notch communication and presentation skills, including experience communicating insights through data with senior-level executives.
Self-starter and ability to own projects from initial question development to rollout.
Experience in planning, organizing, delivering business reviews, business improvements, process optimization, operational excellence, performance scorecards, KPIs.
Exceptional problem-solving, strategic, and analytical skills combined with excellent business acumen
Ability to create effective relationships, listen, communicate, influence, and collaborate cross-team at all organizational levels to deliver result
Relevant, progressive work experience applying analytical methods to business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes
Strong organizational skills, excellent execution, and follow-through skills
Ability to adapt and change with the needs of the organization and business\
Ideal Candidate:
Dedicated and relentless project leadership and execution. Independently capable of seeking information, solving conceptual problems, corralling resources and delivering results in challenging situations. You are known as someone who “gets stuff done.”
Structured thinker. Develop and leverage frameworks to help structure the team’s thinking, facilitate alignment on key strategic decisions among various stakeholders and identify the 80/20 opportunities to reach insightful, actionable answers without boiling the ocean with analysis overload.
Technology and Process Design. You are equally comfortable solving problems through technology as you are through operational excellence, and know when to employ the right tactic.
Great communicator. You connect easily with our culture and understand how our operations work, and you can influence a team and individuals to drive to conclusions in a heavily matrixed environment.
Fast Mover and flexible. We move fast...done is better than perfect, and continual iteration is important. You are ready and excited to learn on your feet and help build a growing business.
High-energy, positive standout colleague. This is a highly cross-functional role; egos are not welcome.
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

OVERVIEW
Authentic. Supportive. Fun. To experience human resources at Ulta Beauty is to step out of the mundane and into an environment alive with optimistic energy. After all, success breeds opportunity, and the opportunities to help drive an organization at the top of its game to even greater heights are as uncommon as they are satisfying.
It’s fast, it’s ambitious, it’s anchored in trust. With the chance to move or flex based on new or existing interests and passions. If you want that rare culture of lived values, where “team” truly means something. Where the drive for excellence is balanced with a genuine desire to help and encourage. And where the mark you make will be seen and recognized—we challenge you to dream bigger. To imagine the possibilities.
THE IMPACT YOU CAN HAVE:
The Lead HR Analytics Data Analyst will help lead the way in transforming HR into a truly data-driven organization through applying innovative approaches to optimize and further support our data extraction, manipulation, and security. This role will utilize, technologies, and the application of advanced mathematical techniques to enable HR with relevant insights through a wide variety of skills including data wrangling, visualization, statistical analysis, and the presentation of recommendations.
CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead the design, development, and maintenance of our HR data platform through collecting, aggregating, integrating, and organizing HR data from a variety of sources.
Utilizes Tableau Prep cleanse data for analysis and ensure data gets populated in the right manner and with the right cadence, frequency, and quality.
Frequently works with messy or incomplete data and makes decisions on how that data will be processed and maintained.
Maintain documentation related to datasets and ensures consistency on team with the data language, calculations, and definitions.
Ensures HR data users are able to access what they need, and that their queries’ outputs are generated in a timely fashion through managing the HR Tableau server site.
Create data visualizations that use a range of functionality and data from different sources and publish it to the Tableau server.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as a thought leader and mentor on HR data structuring and cleansing techniques.
Work as necessary with IT stakeholders to build and maintain SFTP setup and TIDAL jobs.
Outline and lead HR Analytics team members in data literacy, quality assurance and data management principals.
THE ESSENTIALS FOR SUCCESS:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
Proven knowledge and command of BI and data structuring and cleansing tools (i.e. Tableau Prep and Alteryx).
Experience in managing security and efficiency on a BI tool server (Tableau server a plus).
Strong database management skills including the ability to merge, clean and analyze large amounts of data
Ability to multi-task, manage work and execute tasks in a timely manner.
Ability to summarize/present analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:
Advanced degree in Analytic or Technological field (Data Analytics Engineering, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer science, Data Engineering, Software development)
Experience with SQL, Python, R or any other scripting language.
Background with HR systems, data, metrics, and KPIs strongly preferred.

ABOUT
At Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ: ULTA), the possibilities are beautiful. Ulta Beauty is the largest North American beauty retailer and the premier beauty destination for cosmetics, fragrance, skin care products, hair care products and salon services. We bring possibilities to life through the power of beauty each and every day in our stores and online with more than 25,000 products from approximately 500 well-established and emerging beauty brands across all categories and price points, including Ulta Beauty’s own private label. Ulta Beauty also offers a full-service salon in every store featuring—hair, skin, brow, and make-up services.

Overview:

The Business Analyst is an essential part of our product team by providing functional and systemic analysis to clarify scope. The role is a critical link between end users and our esteemed engineers. This team member brings a curious and empathic mindset to elicit the true requirements from business stakeholders. First and foremost, the Business Analyst is an excellent communicator who writes well, speaks well, and most importantly, listens well. The Business Analyst takes the time to understand why the current situation is ‘as it is’ and positions the team to deliver results.
An ideal candidate loves data, isn’t afraid to explore the data model, and run queries to more deeply understand. Data visualization is an important skill that the Business Analyst uses to better understand reality. The role is perfect for somebody with a learning mindset who is open to exploring a variety of technologies related to the supply chain.
Ultimately our Business Analysts are translators. They speak the languages of technology, business processes, and supply chain. They learn fast and have fun doing it!
Are you:
Comfortable with technology, including how to query and organize data?
Someone who welcomes the opportunity to speak up and ask questions?
Able to lead conversations to understand and document how our business works now and where we can improve?
Familiar with the Agile/Scrum framework?
Ok with moving quickly and shipping small, 'good enough' versions of done, knowing we'll iterate several times to find the best solution?
Someone with an appetite to learn new things, who is willing to share what you've learned with others?
If so, and if you have a demonstrated track record of delivering on your commitments, overcoming challenges, and creating an environment where team members are open and can do their best work, the BA position at KeHE may be the right next step for your career!
For more on our tech scene, check out KeHE Distributors on Built In Chicago, where we are named one of the Best Places to Work.
Primary Responsibilities:

What You’ll Be Doing:
Analyze existing business processes to identify gaps and areas of improvement.
Document as-is and to-be process scenarios.
Elicit, analyze and document functional and technical requirements as user stories.
Develop and maintain a customer-focused relationship with business stakeholders and Subject Matter Experts.
Solicit and prioritize feedback.
Ask very effective questions to understand motivations and root cause.
Research and analyze issues. Summarize problem definition and potential solutions.
Identify test scenarios and assist with testing.
Assist Product Owner with backlog grooming and user story prioritization.
Participate in Sprint Planning, User Story Workshop, Retrospectives and other Agile activities.
Essential Functions:

Major projects include (but not limited to)
A B2B e-commerce platform for retailers of the food industry
A B2B digital platform for suppliers of the food industry
A top-tier virtual marketing show experience built entirely online
Charity hackathons and contributions to "Make Lives Better"
Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, Aptitude:

What you bring:
Bachelor's Degree with at least 2 years of professional experience in related role.
Deep competency in the MS Office Suite including Excel, PowerBI, and Sharepoint.
Experience in an agile environment with an understanding of how each role performs to achieve team goals.
Proactive, persistent, flexible. Operates independently and reacts quickly.
Acts with empathy and curiosity. Listens and seeks to understand.
Flexible and able to handle a variety of assignments in various stages at the same time.
Strong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Enjoys interacting with others.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and proven business acumen.
Business transformation experience, Six Sigma a plus.
What you Get:
Competitive Salary, Profit Sharing, Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life/disability insurance, FSA & HSA, 401k, ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan), Wellness Program, Employee Assistance Program, Tuition Reimbursement

Contribute expertise to ensure overall alignment of compensation with business strategy and objectives; analyze compensation work streams and methodologies for effectiveness;
Design and implement compensation tools and communications to support future initiatives and current state;

Analyze effectiveness of existing compensation programs, policies, and procedures and recommend revisions and new programs consistent with trends and Argonne objectives.

Expert knowledge of compensation principles, theory, practices and trends.
Excellent quantitative and statistical skills with ability to analyze data and tell the story.
Excellent analytical, project management, problem resolution and customer service skills.
Experience designing and delivering compensation education.
Effective consulting capabilities, with strong relationship building skills, and interpersonal and communications (both written and verbal) skills.
Ability to advocate, influence and manage change.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Able to apply excellent business acumen and collaborative skills when resolving problems.

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third largest school district in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments - student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.

Want to work for a company that is reimagining distribution? Join Univar Solutions, the premier global distributor of chemicals and ingredients. Our goal is to function as a direct extension of our customers’ teams; to serve as an ally in their quest of business success.
At Univar Solutions, we’re building on our more than 90 years of experience and drawing on deep resources – inventory and logistics experts, scientists, PhDs, procurement, customer service, sales and marketers-to deliver consultative services and an unmatched portfolio to solve customers’ formulation and operational challenges. When you work for Univar Solutions, you’ll play an important role in shaping how we deliver more than chemical and ingredients.


Primary Purpose:
At Univar Solutions, our vision is to redefine distribution and be the most valued chemical and ingredient distributor on the planet. As part of our digital transformation, we are seeking a Lead Business Solutions Analyst (BSA) to join our team. This role works with business, digital, and IT stakeholders to solicit, analyze, understand, and document business requirements. They serve as an expert in their system to help the business manage efficient implementation of technology solutions. They turn business requirements into technical requirements via writing and refining user stories. The BSA will also be responsible for assisting with physical design, functional configuration, user testing, and user training. They contribute to technical project management activities, participate across agile ceremonies, perform day-to-day problem analysis and resolution, and offer general analytical support across the organization. The BSA serves as the main point of contact and functional expert for the system and its respective capabilities.

Key Deliverables:
Works on assignments where the problems, opportunities, and solutions may be undefined. Comfortable executing in a highly visible environment where many unknowns exist, where untested theories and approaches are required, and risk of failure are high.
Functional Configuration: Reviews and approves complex functional configurations.
Use Cases / User Stories: Facilitating/participating in agile ceremonies for capturing, authoring and prioritizing stories across multiple teams
Business Case (assistance): Defines and educates on the impact of opportunities and problems through financial and non-financial analysis.
Business Value Articulation: Ability to articulate the full breadth of impact of proposed changes to the system or systems
Problem Solving: Strong problem solving skills combined with a natural curiosity of how data and systems work together.
Communication: Must be comfortable communicating to large groups. Ability to tailor ‘the story’ based on the audience (business versus technical).
Coaching/Mentoring: Recommends and develops training programs targeting specific areas in need of improvement.

Education/Experience/Training:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, another relevant field or demonstrated work experience equivalent
6+ years industry experience
Scrum/Agile certifications a plus

Specialized Knowledge/Skills:
Require advanced skills in writing agile user stories
Prefer strong working knowledge of the Magento 2 platform
Experience with Jira for backlog, task, test, and defect management
Knowledge and experience working with MS Office Suite, with strong Excel skills
Knowledge and experience working with data query languages and tools
Strong oral and written communication skills

location: 125 E Oakton St, Des Plaines, IL 60018
description:
Data Analytics Manager
Feldco, a leading home renewal company in the Midwest that has delighted over 500,000 customers across four states, is looking for a motivated, creative, detail-oriented, and intellectually curious individual to fill our Data Analytics Manager Opening! The Data Analytics Manager will lead Feldco’s growing Data Analytics department and assist Feldco leadership with extracting and analyzing data used to make real-time business decisions within our growing organization. This is a hybrid role after training, with 2 days in the office per week.
Feldco is honored to have been named a top workplace in 2020 by the Chicago Tribune making us a 7-time award winner! Check out the article by searching “Feldco Top Workplace 2020” on Google!
Job Summary:
We are seeking a motivated, creative, detail-oriented, and intellectually curious Data Analytics Manager to join our fast-growing organization. In this role, you will be responsible setting the strategic direction of Feldco’s data analytics group, supporting the leadership team across multiple departments. You and your team will be responsible for extracting and analyzing both third-party data and proprietary data for further analysis, developing and maintaining custom reports and dashboards reviewed by the Feldco leadership team, and identifying and interpreting trends or patterns in complex datasets associated with our existing and prospective customers. You will oversee a small team of analysts and you will report to the Chief Financial Officer.
Data Analytics Manager Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop, monitor, and track KPIs relating to the marketing, sales, and fulfillment functions at Feldco, delivering clear communication on performance to leadership team and a proactive approach in understanding any deviations to trends for KPIs
Architect and manage the development of new reports created within business intelligence software that will provide actionable business insights to better understand Feldco’s customers and business processes
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies by using insights derived from collected data
Develop strategies to drive increased user adoption of reports and dashboards within Power BI platform
Lead a small team of data analysts in maintaining and enhancing current reports available to end users
Extract data from Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Microsoft Ads, integrating the extracted data into proprietary database for further analysis
Report to the Chief Financial Officer and working closely with other senior leaders at Feldco
Closely collaborate with in-house IT department around existing system architecture and how it relates to data extracted from existing SQL database
Strive for excellence in relation to Feldco’s Keys to Success: Customer Delight, Professionalism, Teamwork, Productivity and Accountability
Data Analytics Manager Requirements and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited university or college in data science, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance, engineering, or similar quantitative field
5+ years of relevant work experience with the Data Analytics and Business Intelligence field with 2+ year experience managing processes and/or direct reports
Demonstrated experience in linking large, complex datasets between multiple relational databases
Proficient with SQL, Power BI, and Microsoft Excel (SSRS and Tableau are also recommended)
Proficient in third party web analytics packages, primarily Google Analytics
High-level written and verbal communication skills
An analytical and intellectually curious mind and excellent critical thinking skills
Ability to effectively manage competing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced work environment

What We Can Offer You?
Leadership – We are the #1 Replacement Window, Door and Siding Company in America! We take great pride in our leadership and transformation of the home improvement market.
Growth – We have more than quadrupled our business over the past few years and are presently expanding into more new markets.
Advancement – We have recently promoted many internal staff members to senior management positions and offer external training.
Security – We operate profitably and are enhancing the benefits and care of our employees.
Professionalism – We are investing heavily in quality improvements and establishing industry-best operations.
Teamwork – We are focused on assisting each other and working together to take care of our customers.
Benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision, Voluntary Life, STD, LTD, 401K and Paid Time Off.

description:
As a member of the GCB US Consumer Bank (USCB) Data Governance organization, the Operational Risk Sr Analyst is a professional who stays current with developments in the field and contributes applicable knowledge to their role. The individual will collaborate with the Citi data governance offices, business, and technology teams to evaluate and assess overall USCB compliance to Citi Data Governance Policy. To meet business objectives, the role requires that the individual works seamlessly with team members and is flexible in their approach. The list of activities under Key Responsibilities is indicative of the nature of the role and may change over time.
Responsibilities:
Assess and report on the effectiveness of system data and cross-border privacy access, reference data, data transfers, retention, and resiliency.
Review and report on the effectiveness of data and system flow documentation and process maps
Assess authorized or approved systems adherence to the CDGP. Identify GAPs in adherence and ensure business remediates the GAP.
Perform due diligence for new product & acquisitions and other Project initiatives to assess impacts to data and data process flows to trusted sources.
Complete impact assessments for the US Consumer Bank Data Governance. This includes remediation of any situations identified during the analysis.
Assess and report on the overall business data owners and data consumers adherence to CDGP. Including the identification of GAPs requiring remediation.

Monitor and report on data quality within Business/Function/Region (e.g., define/ gather metrics, developing dashboards, deploying tools) as per the standards defined by ECDO
Promote ‘data as an asset’ and drive culture change to make the organization increasingly data informed

Resolves or escalates issues timely, communicate difficult information or resolve challenges or risk to project deadlines.
Support business data owners, data stewards, and consumers.

Demonstrated written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Collaborative problem-solving mindset. Able to work well across multiple functional areas.
Knowledge of data, reporting and analytic functions within a financial services organization.
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity and to interface with internal and external resources to define requirements
Demonstrated ability to succeed in a fast-paced, rapidly changing business environment
Problem-solving and critical thinking skills to recognize and comprehend data flows and designs.
Self-motivated and able to dynamically determine priorities.
Qualifications
Bachelor of Arts; Bachelor of Science or Graduate Degree7 years’ experience in Data Governance, Risk Management, Decision Management Technology, Operational Risk Management or Data/Database Management.
Experience with Financial Services data is a plus
Exposure to data governance and data management a plus
Relationship Management experience a plus
Project Management experience a plus
Strong PC skills including Word, Excel, Power Point., Microsoft Project

positionName: Middle Office Business Intelligence Analyst / Project Manager 5 - Chicago, IL
description:
At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.
Job Description
The Collateralized Debt Obligation Group (CDO) is a division within U.S. Bank Global Corporate Trust Services. CDOs or CLOs (Collateralized Loan Obligations) are structured finance vehicles that issue debt and equity liabilities, with the proceeds being used to buy a portfolio of collateral. Typical types of collateral include broadly syndicated bank loans, middle market bank loans, corporate bonds, asset-backed securities (ABS), mortgage-backed securities (MBS) and Mezzanine debt.
Participates in the identification, design, development and implementation of assigned projects which may be general or systems related in nature. Interfaces with internal and external resources to ensure successful and timely completion in accordance with user needs. Participates in training users and evaluating the project. Manages performance of the project team and evaluates overall team performance.
Ideal candidate has experience mining and aggregating data sets using SQL, VBA and other tools (Tableau, MS Office) in an effort to produce dashboards, scorecards and other control reports to communicate and manage business operations. Candidates need a well-rounded background to balance the line between IT and the business and be able to use technical skills to solution complex operational challenges and provide control and efficiency.
Existing experience with CLO operations including exposure to CDO Suite / Solvas, Wall Street Office (WSO), Markit ClearPar, Loan Closing / Trade Settlements or Bank Loan Administration / Compliance Modeling a plus.
Basic Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience

- Eight to ten years of experience in project management activities


Preferred Skills/Experience

- Considerable knowledge of assigned business line or functional area

- Demonstrated management and leadership skills

- Strong organizational and analytical skills

- Advanced knowledge of project management

- Ability to identify and resolve exceptions and to analyze data

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

- Master's degree preferred
Benefits:

Take care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.
Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visiting usbank.com/careers .

Overview:

WHO WE ARE
Revantage is a Blackstone Company that provides a highly skilled employee base, best-in-class processes, and state-of-the-art technology to multiple Blackstone real estate portfolio companies. Sectors include Hospitality, Industrial, Multi-Family, Office, Retail, Senior Housing, and Manufactured Homes.
Revantage, headquartered in Chicago, is one of three global offices that includes Revantage Asia and Revantage Europe.
WHAT WE VALUE: OUR CULTURE
Creating a culture that inspires change and momentum require the right team. We know what it takes to lead an industry, and are looking for leaders who seek constant growth, want to excel, and continuously improve upon themselves and the industry. The culture at Revantage is built on our shared core values and commitment to be:
Achievers – We expect high standards for ourselves and enable the success of our teams
Enthusiasts - We face challenges with optimism and believe anything is possible
Leaders - We commit to continuously improve our performance
Learners – We learn from our challenges and successes
Partners - We deliver value and positive impact to our partners
WHY THIS ROLE IS VALUABLE
You’ll help ensure success of our data endeavors and define the right problems to solve. Business Analysts are part of a team delivering data and analytics products to our customers. Working at the intersection of today’s challenges and tomorrow’s yet-to-be-defined solutions, you’ll be responsible for understanding business processes, assessing data, gathering and documenting requirements for product features, and collaborating with an Agile cross-functional team of designers, software developers and business stakeholders. This position will be based out of Revantage’s headquarters in Chicago, IL.
Responsibilities:

HOW YOU ADD VALUE
Represent our products and product team members by leading direct conversations with customers and subject matter experts
Develop a deep understanding of our customers, their businesses, and the challenge they face
Gather and document requirements based on customer inputs and feedback, including acceptance criteria
Interpret data and assess opportunities for use in solving business problems
Define epics, features, and stories in a system like Jira
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, architects, and other teams to bring specificity to our product definitions
Validate acceptance criteria for implemented solutions
Participate in the consistent execution of our product lifecycle from concept to launch
Qualifications:

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE
Required:
Bachelor’s Degree with passion for technology or related experience
Demonstrated interest in business, institutional finance/private equity, and real estate
Minimum 4 years relevant experience in business analysis, product management, software engineering, or related roles
Experience with Agile methodologies (like Scrum and Kanban)
Strong communication, writing and presentation skills
Preferred:
Experience with data products and SQL
PERKS FOR YOU
Competitive salary, overall compensation and 401(k)
Work-life balance offerings include:
Remote work policy
Productivity Hours – weekly meeting-free work time
Bi-weekly Summer Fridays
In-house and external learning & development opportunities
Generous health insurance and wellness benefits
