positionName: Data Science & Analytics Sr Consultant, Financial Services
description:
What We'll Bring:
At TransUnion, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation we’re – consistently exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.


The Financial Services Analytics team is an industry recognized, client-facing department that rewards an entrepreneurial spirit. We have deep technical expertise and an established reputation as an analytic solutions provider in the Financial Services industry. We have a wealth of data and industry experience within our large group of highly-trained analysts, statisticians, engineers, and economists. We also have a modern computing environment based on best-in-class “big data” technologies and the freedom to explore new data sources and statistical and machine learning methodologies. All of these resources will enable you to help us deliver next-generation analytic solutions for our customers.

Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.



You will apply your analytical skills to work on all aspects of the account lifecycle in the consumer credit domain on behalf of a diverse set of clients, ranging from marketing and propensity models for customer acquisition and retention, fraud detection solutions, credit risk models for acquisition and account management, cross-sell applications, portfolio models for regulatory applications, event-based trigger solutions, and strategy analyses of various kinds. You will also develop complex analytic solutions directly with TransUnion customers, business partners and other departments.


Advancement opportunities exist in both a technical and managerial track depending on the candidate’s desires and aptitudes.
What You'll Bring:
Master’s or PhD degree in statistics, applied mathematics, financial mathematics, engineering, operations research, or another highly quantitative field. A track record of academic excellence
At least four (4) years of professional experience performing analytic work in Financial Services or related industries
Multiple examples of demonstrated success in client-facing roles over a period of at least three (3) years
Advanced programming skills; mastery of a statistical language such as R or SAS; experience using other programming and data manipulation languages (SQL, Hive, Pig, Python, C/C++, Java); familiarity with relational, MPP, and/or Hadoop data management frameworks; proficiency with Microsoft Office tools
Versatile interpersonal and communication style with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels within and outside the organization; ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple assignments effectively
We'd Love to See:
An understanding of current industry challenges and trends at the level needed to proactively identify customers’ analytical needs and related business opportunities
This role will require the ability to travel 10-20%
Impact You'll Make:
This position is responsible for developing credit risk management and business intelligence analytic solutions through consulting engagements and research serving TransUnion’s clients. This position requires an understanding of US consumer lending and credit risk management practices.
You will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams to drive new business initiatives and deliver long term value-added product propositions for B2B customers in the US financial services segment at TransUnion. This includes but is not limited to the development of predictive risk management and business intelligence solutions for credit card issuers, auto & mortgage lenders, collections agencies and retail banks.
You will lead analytic client engagements involving descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analysis through the consumer lending portfolio lifecycle, leveraging a variety of techniques (e.g., segmentation, logistic regression, survival analysis, principal component analysis, Monte Carlo simulation, scenario and sensitivity analysis).
You will design and write programs for data extraction, segmentation and statistical analysis on large population datasets using languages such as R, SAS, SQL, Hive, and Pig on Linux, PC, and mainframe computing platforms.
You will deliver analytic insights and recommendations in succinct and compelling presentations for internal and external customers and an executive audience.
You will develop project proposals, sales presentations and promotional collateral to enable the adoption of integrated customer solutions supported by TransUnion.
You will identify strategies and opportunities for customers to test and adopt TransUnion’s analytic products and services.
You will provide mentorship and training to junior colleagues and maintain progress on all initiatives under limited direct supervision.
You will foster a high performance culture and cultivate an environment that promotes excellence and reflects the TransUnion brand.
#DICE
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, TransUnion has several safety protocols in place to protect associates, customers, and visitors. You may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and/or to participate in certain work-related activities. Exemption is available to qualified candidates as a reasonable accommodation.

Experience professional empowerment. With over 1,200 stores throughout the U.S., designs to expand internationally, and a thriving E-Commerce platform, Ulta Beauty provides its merchandise associates the bandwidth needed to set new trends, identify potential, and take calculated risks. Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models
Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
Gather and analyze data for potential business expansion
Identify specific business opportunities
Manages the administration of the Space and Floor Planning system including: reviewing and implementing changes in system parameters and formats; and coordinating and/or modifying system parameters, improvements and/or upgrades
PL/SQL and C# a plus

POSTING TITLE: Temporary Senior Business Information Analyst
POSITION SUMMARY:
We are looking for an energetic professional with strong conceptualization and analysis skills, as well as an interest in future management roles. This role is for an individual that spans between business and technology – solving for business opportunities and challenges using data as a tool. This is an individual who gains a deep understanding of an area of the business, helps design logical data structures to represent it holistically, and communicates those structures to technology teams who implement. This person works closely with business leaders, analysts, application developers, data warehouse developers, and architects to drive data-centric solutions and data-centric components of broader solutions from idea to implementation. This creates focused data solutions, such as marts and reporting layers, for its area of the business. A successful candidate in this role is goal-oriented, contextually-aware, collaborative, and open minded. A strong ability to articulate concepts in ways that are understood by both business and technology resources, and an ability to foster effective communication between business and technology resources are required for success.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Listen, understand, and internalize the business’ strategy and goals, becoming an individual who makes tactical decisions supporting their achievement
Understand the data landscape as it relates to the aligned business area
Maintain a working knowledge of the software and applications serving the aligned business area
Maintain deep knowledge of the data lifecycle for the aligned business area and its relationship to the business process and software generators of data
Collaborate with business leaders and functional resources to ideate the data-centric components of business solutions
Define logical data structures required for those solutions in a way that meets defined and anticipated needs
Drive toward holistic underlying data capture to ensure that data asset value is generated, and velocity of subsequent solutions accelerates
Collaborate with technology teams, in data architecture, application development and data warehouse development, to ensure that the technology teams internalize the business’ needs and that technical solutions meet the business’ needs
Create detailed requirements when required and work with others within the aligned business area to foster effective data-centric requirement creation
Work as a subject matter expert for business data within projects ranging from small efforts to major transformations
Work alongside analysts and data scientists to understand how the business needs to be analyzed and understood and translate those needs into underlying data design and requirements
Create custom focused data assets from approved sources for use by analysts and data scientists in the aligned business area (data marts, assets underlying BI layers and reports)
Identifies opportunities to obtain and leverage external data sources to solve business problems
Act as a driver of effective collaboration between business and technology teams by taking the role of facilitator and collaborative interpreter
Evaluates the results driven by data-centric solutions to ensure that investments in those solutions are yielding benefits
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:
The successful candidate will likely have some combination of these qualifications, experiences, and skills.
At least 5 years of experience in a similar position or in a role that performed many of the same functions – often has been an analyst, developer, data architect, or consultant delivering data-centric solutions, or has been the “person in the business who does data” regardless of formal role
A degree in a technical or a business field with a focus on quantitative sciences, analytics, or solutioning (Engineering, Finance, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.)
A combination of degrees in both technology and business fields is a plus
Reasonable proficiency in data manipulation skills in SQL, Python, or equivalent.
Experience using BI Tools such as Tableau, or equivalent
Demonstrated understanding of logical data architectural concepts
Understands business architecture concepts and is proficient in understanding business processes
Demonstrated ability to ideate and define solutions when presented with a business problem or concept
Effective at concise logical communication of ideas
Communicates in the language used by technology teams
Communicates in the language used by business teams
Able to foster constructive cross-disciplinary debate to attain a solution
Is comfortable speaking in front of audiences from executive level down
Comfortable with ambiguity
Possesses contextual awareness and can solve for both detailed needs and their contribution to the greater whole
Is very detail-oriented, identifying upstream prerequisites and downstream dependencies in data-centric efforts
Is assertive but open-minded
Is a motivated self-starter
Embraces change and is a change agent
Is business outcome oriented
Possesses an effective balance of idealism and practicality
Understands when to solve and when to leverage existing solutions – knows when to think “outside of the box” and when what is “in the box” generates an effective result
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. The incumbent must have the abilities or aptitudes to perform each essential function proficiently with or without reasonable accommodation. Our organization has a dynamic work environment where positions evolve and change. Therefore, the Company reserves the right to modify, delete, or add job duties, responsibilities and skills that are stated in this job description at any time.

Title: Business Intelligence Solutions Architect and Analyst
Department: Department of Information Services
Reports To: Manager, Data Analytics, Quality, and Reporting
Work Schedule: Full Time
Job Summary
The Business Intelligence Solutions Architect and Analyst (BI Architect/Analyst) will design, maintain, support, and enhance the enterprise-wide business intelligence data architecture that will serve to maximize potential data assets. The BI Architect/Analyst will fulfill a lead role in data administration, data integration, and data modeling of an enterprise-wide data repository/data lake, as well as localized data marts that support the BI program. The BI Architect/Analyst will also work with different business areas to capture BI requirements based on business objectives, and ensure these requirements are fully understood and solutions are delivered in simple and engaging ways. The position will utilize technologies in line with the Information Services (IS) vision for the ACGME to develop modern data and analytics capabilities that emphasize end user self-service while providing enterprise and departmental value.
Applications and Data Analysis Overview
The Department of Information Services’ Applications and Data Analysis group is responsible for the development and ongoing maintenance of all data collection systems for graduate medical education program and institution accreditation and outcomes, as well as for a recently launched Business Intelligence/Self Service Analytics initiative. The group also provides project management, quality assurance testing, analytical reporting, and support for these data systems and data acquisition tools. Currently the group is taking a leadership role in the visual display of data and its use enterprise-wide, as well as in accreditation.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Fulfill a lead role the development of the BI data architecture and systems integration.
Work closely with different business areas and end users to capture BI requirements, ensure requirements are well understood, and delivered solutions meet requirements and business objectives.
Design and develop reports and dashboards using BI Reporting tools, such as SSRS and Power BI.
Work as a member of cross-functional team developing Azure Cloud solutions for the ACGME, particularly for cloud capabilities that involve a BI architecture and data repositories, including an enterprise data lake and localized data marts.
Provide data that is accurate and reliable, ensuring the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.
Create conceptual, logical, and physical data models for an enterprise data repository/data lake as well as data marts.
Design a well-integrated BI data architecture that meets present and future needs.
Analyze information flow and recommend appropriate technical solutions within the context of business goals.
Perform data analysis activities to capture data requirements clearly, completely and correctly, and represent them through a logical data model.
Assist in performing BI systems testing, including data quality assurance, operations process, performance, and usability testing.
Develop and maintain complex data extraction, transformation, and load processes.
Assist in creating and maintaining relational and dimensional data structures within the BI data architecture to meet functional requirements and optimize performance.
Maintain a strong understanding of business workflow, processes, and events and how they are captured in transactional systems.
Education, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline.
10 years of experience performing duties similar to those listed.
Experience implementing or supporting large-scale production data systems.
Experience creating user documentation and providing user training.
Experience with a variety of Microsoft application development and database management tools.
Experience developing and supporting mission-critical applications.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse principles and practices, as well as ETL solutions.
Strong SQL, Power BI, and data extraction skills.
Working knowledge of designing and delivering cloud BI solutions using cloud-based data lakes, data marts, tools, and resources.
Experience defining and designing dimensional models and KPI metrics.
Experience with enterprise integration, advanced analytics, and data models that support BI solutions.
Experience with system design and integration tasks, comprising design and implementation of major systems, integration of systems elements, and related support systems.
Be detail oriented with the ability to pay close attention to accuracy of work.
Be able to manage multiple projects independently and prioritize tasks.
Preferred
Possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills with an ability to work closely with end users in different business areas, as well as be a team player.
Demonstrated leadership in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable with ambiguity, variability, and change in business requirements.
Possess the skills to generate multiple effective solutions that address specific data and analytic needs.
Be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously; must be able to shift priorities as organizational demands require.
Be able to communicate clearly, effectively and appropriately for the intended purpose and audience.
Equipment
Position requires the significant use of standard office equipment, such as a computer, keyboard, mouse, photo copier, fax machine, and telephone.
Working Conditions
Most of the work of the Business Intelligence Architect is done in the ACGME office with the typical physical demands of an office environment. During the COVID-19 pandemic, ACGME employees are working remotely until further notice. The BI Architect/Analyst will need to be able to efficiently and effectively work remotely.
Some travel may be required.
Physical Requirements
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the BIArchitect/Analyst:
Will frequently be required to sit and work for extended periods of time at computer terminal using various computer programs and other computer tools.
Must be willing and able to travel if required.

Sponsorship not available.We are seeking to fill a Data Analyst (Tableau/Power BI Developer) position. The position requires 5+ years of prior experience as a Business Intelligence Data Analyst. The position is a consultative technical position working with large enterprise customers who will implement end-to-end data management solutions on multiple BI platforms such as AWS, Azure, Snowflake, etc.Design, development, and implementation of end-to-end data management solutions will require, amongst other things, extensive knowledge and experience with Tableau and Power BI for dashboard development with advanced skills in data query and manipulation – data modeling, data blending, and data integration. Candidates must demonstrate proficiency in making useful inferences and driving improvement actions from large data sets that are messy and not easily understood.We are looking for a candidate who can interact directly with our clients to consult, solicit business rules, design, and build solutions to address the client’s business intelligence and/or data management challenges. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Our Global Enablement Technology Team is looking for a BA Lead to join our team and be a key player in transforming the way we enable our internal employees at Salesforce.


If you have a strong aptitude to understand business needs, capture project requirements, and collaborating/communicating with stakeholders to support the development and implementation of enablement technology solution this role is for you.


As the ideal candidate, you will have deep hands-on experience with the Salesforce platform and understand how to leverage data for practical business insights.


Responsibilities

You facilitate meetings to understand business pain points, synthesizing the discussion and circulate meeting decisions and action items with clear objectives and success measures.
You partner with business process experts to write business requirements and create process flows to translate into functional compensation design. Engage with project stakeholders for alignment and feedback.
You conduct gap analysis to provide recommendations, analytical insights, and process improvements to meet business needs through system automation.
You lead system-related projects focusing on key strategic initiatives related to Global Enablement technology systems and are responsible for end-to-end implementation planning
Lead, coach and mentor business analysts and business leaders in preparing for and sustaining change.
You can juggle multiple projects and tasks with complex dependencies with other team

Minimum requirements :
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience is required
Strong leadership skills with proven ability to facilitate cross-functionally at all levels of the organization (both business and technical-facing).
7+ years experience in business analysis or related consulting experience
5+ years of proven hands-on project management experience with the ability to take initiative and produce results, including a history in bringing projects successfully to completion
5+ years in complex business and technical environments
Proven Salesforce Platform hands-on configuration experience and associated certifications, including experience with Salesforce Reports and Dashboards (Required), Tableau CRM (Preferred), and Tableau, Excel
1+ Experience working and delivering products in an agile/lean environment
Preferred requirements:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - including presenting and deck work
Able to think independently and consider cross-functional and upstream/downstream impacts
Structured thinking and problem solving - ability to break down complex problems into composite parts and a naturally inquisitive mindset to properly investigate and resolve problems
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements, problem-solve, and produce results
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to articulate verbally and written, willingness to appropriately debate difficult issues; ability to think quickly
Ability to excel in a fast growing/fast paced environment delivering accuracy while managing to deadlines where adaptability is imperative
Ability to understand broader business and enablement issues, juggle multiple projects and tasks, and to work with deadlines and in a fast paced environment
Structured, organized, and a keen sense of urgency, and self-motivated
Strategic forward-thinking business operations thinker, supported by deep analytical capabilities and a data driven approach
Ability to work independently and thrive in a team environment
Ability to lead and coach your team to deliver value for our business

positionName: Audit Analytics Senior - Data Analytics Support Specialist
description:
Are you an individual with strong programming and analytical skills? Do you enjoy everything around data-coding, database structures, data transformations, business intelligence and big data? At Deloitte, we provide teams with a way to innovate their audit delivery to achieve greater effectiveness and consistency in executing the audit. In this role, the specialist will provide support experience, assessing and resolving challenging questions and issues while working closely with business stakeholders and internal clients.

Work you'll do

As an Audit Analytics Senior - Data Analytics Support Specialist, you will be responsible for resolving the issues and challenges pertaining to data with a strategic project to support the Audit practice and the development of tools and processes core to the business. You will be working with a team of experienced leads, developers and business resources to support and test key deliverables to promote audit quality and objectives. You will be part of a team working closely with senior leadership. You'll use your analytical, research and investigative
skills to:

Support the development and delivery of data models, data prep routines, analytics and other initiatives of our audit analytics platform.
Provide support on data transformations and to standardize content for engagements.
Manage ServiceNow ticket queue to promptly answer questions and resolve issues related to extraction, data model transformations and analytics.
Perform business validation and QA testing of audit analytics platform content.
Liaise and communicate effectively with cross-border teams.
Ensure the work performed is in accordance with quality standards of the organization.
Present technical solutions to team members and leadership.

The team

Our audits are fueled by more than just technology - what sets us apart are our insightful professionals, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation and continuous improvement. Our audit professionals apply a streamlined, intelligent approach to the audit, enabled by innovative tools and technologies. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar of quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.


Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, data science, analytics, statistics, applied mathematics or related discipline
6-7 years of overall experience, with a blend of data analytics and support experience
5+ years of experience in technology development and building/deploying technology solutions
5+ years of experience in designing and developing data visualizations using Tableau or PowerBi
5+ years of hands-on coding experience using at least one of the following programming languages: Java, R, SparkR, SQL and/or Python
5+ years of experience in relational databases, data frames, performing data transformations and data modelling
Experience with product support practices (ITIL) and testing methodologies.
Experience with performing functional and non-functional testing of technology solutions with associated documentation
Ability to write and produce technical documents (e.g. Knowledgebase Guides, Operational Metrics, Test Execution Reports, Status Reports, Dashboards, etc.)
Experience in demonstrating technical solutions to end-users
Excellent business communication skills (verbal and written in English) to articulate problems, make decisions and to independently engage with business stakeholders throughout various phases of the project
Preferred

Good understanding of audit and/or general accounting principles
Experience in using an enterprise ticketing solution (e.g. ServiceNow, Service Desk).
Preferred knowledge of web development concepts (e.g. HTML, CSS, etc.)
Experience in Agile methodologies using Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly VSTS)
Background in ETL and data wrangling tools (e.g., Informatica, Trifacta)
Experience working with scaled agile methodologies
Experience working independently on multiple assignments or engagements, even in a virtual environment

positionName: Risk and Compliance Senior Analyst Developer
description:
In Risk & Compliance the Senior Analyst is responsible for analysis, design, and development within the Accuity Suite of applications. This is a multi-hatted role and the incumbent is expected to be a SME who will analyze requirements and opportunities, create component level designs, and hands-on actively working on implementation (including coding and enhancing scripts, config as code, and debugging issues under production pressure). To be successful, candidate must have prior experience in implementing Accuity solutions, strong technical skills, and is responsible for enhancing and supporting data ingest/egress integrations within Compliance Applications.
Must have experience with modern software development, DevOps, AGILE, and production support. Must be hands-on developer and be an SME within the Accuity suite and be able to assist team with application development tasks. Must strive to continuously develop new and improved technical capabilities. Applicants must also possess clear oral and written communication skills and demonstrate flexibility while working on multiple projects and initiatives concurrently.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with SME and Business Analyst to build new End-to-End solution, lead tech team ensuring solutions meet all requirements, including operational SLAs.
Address and triage escalated issues, at off hours from time to time due to 24x6 operational nature.
Development experience in Accuity products: Fircosoft, SBS, SAM Safe Alert Manager.
Conduct sessions with Business and vendor in order to report and troubleshoot issues.
Lead operational escalations from incident origination to close, plus any root cause, remediation, and prevention.
Reporting of incidents to management and stakeholders during incident lifecycle.
Write and debug complex SQL queries from databases (such as Oracle).
Participate in peer design reviews and provide recommendations.
Improve operational stability via automation, such as autohealing where possible, and raise design changes to data analyst, SMEs and/or architects, as well as opportunities to application/service managers.
Ensure all data mapping, data lineage, functional spec, and any other technical documentation are detailed and up to date.
Ensure runbooks are fully up-to date and consistently improving the efficiency derived from automation.
Work some off hours as demanded by projects, operations, and need of the on-shore team and stakeholders, such as release, testing and/or critical bug resolutions.
Provide US/EMEA overnight support on critical processes in AML program, such as data feed batch jobs, reports, Tier 0 critical real time Accuity application, etc. in a follow the sun model.
Ensure handover of issues region to region with precise and concise handover daily shift notes.
Support incidents management during incident lifecycle by resolving service stoppage and remediation activities as well as any post mortem actions.
Support management in operational reporting on vendor issues, internal issues, partner team issues, and respective root causes.
Communicate with systems, vendors, and partners regarding new technology/systems issues that would enhance current practices/maintain system availability and SLAs.
Must have:
7+ years of overall industry experience
A College or University degree in Computer Science or related discipline
Solid technical background with at least 5 years of demonstrated track record in end-to-end software development life cycle and successful delivery of technical solutions using modern techniques
Current domain working experience in AML Applications
Experience in implementation, configuration, and upgrades of Accuity solutions – Firco Trust, Continuity, Firco Filter, SAM, Multiplexor
Experience configuring Accuity utilities FMF, FMM, FUM
Working experience with Accuity Professional Services and Product Support Teams
DevOps and CICD related experience
Knowledge of writing queries in SQL server and Accuity database schemas
Experience in Web Services and Accuity APIs
Solid experience with Unix scripting, low-code automation, and high-touch debugging and analysis of issues
Web application architecture exposure, at a minimum from operational support role
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Current hands-on experience with Control-M
High degree of independence and able to work effectively with low touch directions
Good written and verbal communication skills

Nice to have:
Current domain working experience in Fraud prevention applications
Good knowledge and/or hands-on experience with DataStage
JIRA, ServiceNow, and Confluence
Industry certification is preferred (such as PPM, ITIL, Agile, etc.)
Banking services experience is preferred

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager
location: 111 S. Wacker Drive Suite 1800, Chicago, IL 60606
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team

Analytics & Cognitive

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms
Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

Position Information
Hiring Manager:
Assistant Vice President
Department:
Technology Solutions
Sub-Department:
Back Office Technology
Title:
Senior Analyst
Function:
Business Analyst
Department Overview
The Technology Solutions Department is responsible for designing and delivering state of the art technology solutions that are designed to create efficiency, mitigate risk and grow revenue for the Firm. Technology Solutions is also responsible for defining, managing and executing a robust Cyber Security program following the NIST Cyber Security Framework. Technology Solutions focuses on technical excellence through innovative application designs, robust data integration and analytics, high availability infrastructure and gold level service for our key stakeholders with information security embedded throughout. Critical functions within Technology Solutions include Project Management, Vendor Management, Business Analysis, Enterprise Data Governance and Stewardship, Application Development and 3rd Party Integration, Strategic and Secure Infrastructure and Operations. The Technology Solutions Department collaborates closely with Firm leadership and business unit heads to develop plans in line with business objectives.
Position Responsibilities
This is a hands-on position in our Back Office Technology Team focused on our key third party vendor systems across several Accounting and Operations functions. The role includes functional design, system configuration, quality assurance, application support, vendor management and any other duties related to the development and usage of these applications. The ideal candidate has demonstrated recent experience in a similar role interacting heavily with users and 3rd party application vendors to deliver high quality functionality to the business. The candidate should have excellent problem-solving skills, an inquisitive nature, a passion for excellent service, the ability to self-start and be resourceful, and a very strong understanding of technology. Since this is a client-facing role, which requires communication with users at all levels, exceptional verbal and written communication skills are paramount.
Responsibilities include:
Become a subject matter expert in core line-of-business software platforms servicing back-office functions. Set up and configure systems in a distributed environment. Create custom reports to meet the needs of business partners. Develop and execute comprehensive test plans.
Provide support for applications by triaging support issues, identifying root cause, and managing issue resolution across business users, developers, and third-party vendors.
Work closely with development teams and vendors to clarify requirements and ensure application delivery meets all desired business specifications. Actively manage third-party vendors for application development, delivery, and support.
Ensure that all delivered solutions meet the highest quality standards and satisfy all specified business requirements, meet technical standards, and adhere to robust data security requirements through rigorous validation and testing
Analyze and understand complex business processes and present them in an understandable and logical format. Identify pain points and opportunities to further leverage technology to increase productivity, improve quality, and reduce risk.
Understand the relationships, dependencies, and impact of related business functions to your area of responsibility. Understand data organization and relationships and independently perform hands on data analysis using SQL, Excel, and other data extraction, analysis, and reporting methods.
Build strong and productive relationships with key business stakeholders, sponsors, and technology colleagues.
Demonstrate a sense of ownership for the deliverables and gain an understanding of the technology solution and business process changes associated with the project
Exhibit resourcefulness in proactively identifying and engaging available resources and subject matter experts in related areas to achieve your goals
Confidently facilitate meetings with all levels of the organization including senior business stakeholders and senior management
Demonstrate an ability to multitask and manage time and priorities under pressure and to meet deadlines
Candidate Requirements
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree is required.
3-5 year working experience in financial industry as a developer, system analyst or similar role working with enterprise-level applications is required.
Prior working knowledge of Azure DevOps or other similar work item management to manage and prioritize backlog items is a plus.
Experience developing custom code using .net, scripting, and/or SQL
Strong analytical skills to digest, document and translate business requirements for in-house development or customizing/configuring third-party software products.
Strong problem solving skills to troubleshoot issues, dissect calculations, and articulate solutions
Strong mathematical skills and/or experience with accounting systems is a plus.
Exceptional interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills.
COVID vaccinations required, subject to applicable local, state and federal law
Critical Competencies for Success
Our Gold Standards Model defines key behaviors and competencies across 4 dimensions: Leadership, Achieving Results, Personal Effectiveness and Thinking Critically. These behaviors and competencies drive our ability to win together.
Leadership : Role models in this area consistently focus on the right goals and priorities and continually develop themselves and others. Always team players, they influence and engage with others to contribute to a great culture.
Achieving Results : Role models in this area are high achievers who develop careful plans and execute consistently and effectively. They hold themselves and others accountable for delivering high quality results.
Thinking Critically : Role models in this area understand our business, rely on analytical reasoning to define and solve problems and make decisions effectively. They are forward thinking, anticipating issues and addressing them in advance.
Personal Effectiveness: Role models in this area build strong relationships and communicate effectively. They are driven to exceed expectations and adaptable to changing circumstances.
The department-specific competencies define the knowledge, skills and abilities that are needed to successfully perform the functional or technical work of this role.
Technical Support: Triages, troubleshoots and resolves technical support issues. Escalates issues as needed.
Software Development Principals: Utilizes software development, secure programming principles and a knowledge of programming languages to develop, configure and / or integrate new software and applications.
Business Needs Assessment: Identifies business needs across departments within the Firm to understand the challenges, goals and problems that the business needs to solve and identifies appropriate technical solutions.
Data Management and Information Security: Manipulates, restructures and / or queries data for various purposes, including reconciling issues in the database, designing database structures and / or generating reports. Adheres to governance principles and maintains data integrity and security.
Risk Management: Identifies, forecasts and articulates ways to pursue and manage informed risks in ambiguous, complex or uncertain situations based on sound value propositions and an analysis of potential rewards and costs.
Testing: Evaluates the functionality of an application, system or solution to ensure that requirements have been met and defects have been identified. Applies an understanding of end user requirements and usage in the end-to-end system to produce a quality product.
Industry Knowledge: Demonstrates an understanding of the Firm's position in the industry, including its complex structure and competitive advantage in the marketplace. Monitors industry trends and changes and recognizes their relevancy and implications.
Technical Communication and Documentation: Documents and communicates technical processes and procedures in area of specialty to stakeholders. Adapts the level of detail and specificity based on the needs of the intended audience.
Vendor Management: Manages and coordinates with external vendors. Researches and identifies new vendors as needed and monitors performance.
Relationship Management: Builds and maintains effective partnerships with internal clients and end users by advising on their needs and options, advocating for their business within the Technology Solutions department and managing expectations appropriately.
Project / Program Management: Manages Technology Solutions project elements considering conflicting priorities, interdependencies, business objectives, communications and available resources.
Innovative Mindset: Leverages an agile and creative mindset to drive innovative value creation, continuous process improvement and proactive learning through new technology, processes and people.
Compensation & Benefits
Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Golub Capital offers a full range of benefits which includes medical, dental, vision and 401(k).
Golub Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Areas of Accountability: The Manufacturing Applications (MFG) Business Analyst's (BA) role is to understand business processes and IT solutions to support and improve day-to-day manufacturing, inventory, purchasing, and shop floor activities. Ensure that end users understand and use applications to their full capabilities. Identify areas of improvement and work with business stakeholders to implement and understand suitable IT solutions. If the solution involves the development or modification of information systems, the MFG BA gathers, analyzes, and documents the business requirements and develops, maintains, and delivers corresponding user acceptance and training materials. This is a front-line, customer-facing role that requires a strong sense of ownership, urgency, and attention to detail. The role covers the following business functions:
Design-to-Production
Inventory
Manufacturing
Materials
Capacity Requirements Planning (CRP)
Distributed Requirements Planning (DRP)
Materials Requirements Planning (MRP)
Purchasing
Quality
Release Management
Subcontracting

Responsibilities: The MFG BA is responsible for Production Support and User Engagement, Requirements Gathering and Testing, and Training Development and Delivery as defined below.
Production Support and User Engagement:
Provide front-line support for inventory, manufacturing, materials and purchasing functions.
Implement hot production fixes along with technical team.
Perform root cause analysis and document permanent fix for production issues.
Leverage support incidents to educate users to become more self-sufficient.
Coordinate production fix development and deployment.
Advocate for business stakeholders. Analyze change requests and recommend appropriate actions.
Work with Applications Manager to:
Schedule and lead periodic sessions or workshops to review and discuss business initiatives, requirements, and developments.
Liaison with stakeholders to ensure delivered solutions are configurable to meet cross-divisional requirements.
Keep stakeholders up to date on implementation and upgrade schedules, patch deployment, and other new developments.
Requirements Gathering and Testing:
Contribute to all aspects of requirements definition activities for SDLC projects.
Understand business needs, and develop, present, and discuss IT solutions and scenarios that solve internal customers’ business problems.
Drive requirements from business stakeholders using techniques such as interviews, JAD sessions, surveys and/or other techniques to compile comprehensive solution requirements. Create detailed recommendations and specifications to support business process changes.
Proactively communicate with design and development personnel work efforts to ensure understanding and adherence with customer requirements.
Decompose, refine, and document requirements including Process Flow Diagrams and Functional Requirements Specifications.
Develop test plans and assist the business with development of user acceptance criteria.
Training Development and Delivery:
Develop and maintain end user training materials and job aides and lead end user training activities.
Develop and maintain standard MFG training curriculum for end users and IT personnel.
Introduces new products, functionality and upgrades to core team and end users.
Coordinate site-specific and company-wide training workshops.

Key Skills and Qualifications: The MFG Business Analyst will be an experienced IT professional with proven subject-matter-expertise in QAD functional areas, as follows:
Expert functional and industry knowledge in Manufacturing, Inventory & Shop Floor business processes
6+ years QAD end-user support and requirements analysis
Experience translating Value Stream and Process Maps to QAD solutions
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills
Strong sense of urgency, ownership, and attention to detail with ability to champion critical business projects
Ability to identify issues using root cause analysis methods (i.e., Global 8D)
Demonstrated experience managing customer requirements and demands effectively, meeting deliverable dates, leading a work group(s), and driving process improvements
Ability to interface with business and provide group and one-on-one support and training
Prior manufacturing experience required, automotive and/or trucking industry experience desired
QAD Manufacturing certification preferred
Professional certification such as CPIM or CSCP (or in process)
ITIL Foundation, Service Strategy and Service Design certifications preferredBachelor’s degree in business or computer-related field
Advanced degree in computer-related field or equivalent experience required
25% travel is required

positionName: Senior Data Analyst, Wealth Management Marketing
description:
The Senior Data Analyst operates at the intersection of business insights, marketing strategy and analytics. They will develop holistic measurement plans, analyze campaign data, develop insights and actionable recommendations, and report on marketing performance.
Working directly with the head of Performance Marketing Strategy and the Chief Marketing Officer, they will develop success measures, provide data-driven strategies and partner with cross-functional teams to support growth. They will contribute to storytelling that drives action and highlights the value of marketing.
Responsibilities:
Understanding results and having the ability to tell the right story to different levels of the organization. Ability to stay high-level and present key insights and strategy.
Advising the Digital team on implementing measurement infrastructures with end-to-end solutions to ensure tracking across multiple platforms for campaigns.
Managing the reporting process and develop dashboard to provide campaign observations, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders.
Create and maintain appropriate marketing key performance indicators and ROI metrics for marketing campaigns and out-of-campaign activities to determine effectiveness.
Collaborating with team members to trouble-shoot and problem-solve on measurement challenges. Able to support the team as a sounding board for their work and insights.
Consulting with third party vendors develop programs and ensure proper tracking and measurement.
Partnering with marketers and other stakeholders to establish strategic metrics measurement and consulting on how to track.
Advising and leading the internal team on advanced analytics topics.

Skills & Experience:
4-6 years of experience in analytics, marketing operations, and/or digital media.
Excellent data visualization and storytelling skills to communicate insights and recommendations.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio and PowerBI.
Experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics.
Deep understanding of paid media ecosystem (especially paid social, programmatic, and paid search).
Experience with customer relationship management systems, email marketing, and nurture campaigns.
Familiarity with Marketo and Salesforce Financial Services Cloud preferred.
Proven expertise in multi-tasking – serving multiple projects simultaneously.
Persuasive and effective written and verbal communications skills, along with strong listening skills.
About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust provides innovative financial services and guidance to corporations, institutions and affluent families and individuals globally. With over 130 years of financial experience and nearly 20,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, you will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture, which has a strong history of financial strength and stability. Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company that is committed to strengthening the communities we serve!
We recognize the value of inclusion and diversity in culture, in thought, and in experience, which is why we are honored to receive the following awards in 2021:
Gender Equality Index Member, Bloomberg
Top Financial & Banking Company, Black EOE Journal, Hispanic Network Magazine, Professional WOMAN'S Magazine

We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of America’s best banks and most sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today.

The Sr. Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring customer needs are understood, defined, and executed through successful technology and process solutions. This experienced contributor is expected to develop trusted partnerships with business leaders and provide variety of business analysis capabilities that contribute to the design and delivery of technology enabled business solutions, including process re-engineering, gap analysis, and requirements definition. Work with the business functions to simplify, standardize, automate, and share operational processes and workflows, through an ongoing learning and development loop of operationalizing, optimizing, and transforming. This key role will establish trust through relationship building and collaboration, both within IT and business functions. A candidate must rely on experience and judgment to manage and accomplish the goals of multiple strategic and operational initiatives concurrently. A wide degree of creativity and latitude to achieve these goals is expected.

Priorities for the role include:
Determine operational objectives by interacting with the business stakeholders and studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats

Manage and execute the creation and delivery of strong business requirements and functional requirements

Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions

Articulate business needs to document current state processes and support the documentation and implementation of new operational processes

Facilitate requirements elicitation; capture requirements in formal deliverables; prioritize; document user stories, build and manage backlogs

Responsible for understanding the project design, maintaining required artifacts to create an implementation plan and put it into practice

Present to variety of audiences, including executives, project teams, vendors, customer

Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential

Working with the Business Relationship Manager to define the business case (Scope) and Charter

Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues

Identifies impact of changes to the affected users, current workflows, and external business environment (i.e. Carrier Systems, Enterprise Applications).

Provides for and/or participates in user training in various functional organizations as required.

Develops system and functional verification tests for upgrades and updates; coordinates user acceptance testing; reviews test results with users and obtains user approvals.

Qualifications:
6+ Years of experience directly working as a B.A., facilitating requirements sessions with business stakeholders, documenting user stories, prioritizing features backlog; etc.

Familiarity and experience with project management processes & tools

Great relationship builder; record of building trust with critical stakeholders

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Strong written and verbal communications ability with empathetic listening skills

Critical Thinking and Problem Solving

Negotiation and Diplomacy through solid interpersonal skills

High aptitude with Industry standard methodologies and models (waterfall, Rapid Application Development, SCRUM, Kanban, etc.)

High aptitude with tools such as Visio, Atlassian Suite, Excel, Word, PowerPoint

Strong business acumen; ability to understand business models quickly

Familiar with design thinking

Familiar with business case development

Hands-on knowledge of Domain applications (e.g. Duck Creek, BenefitPoint, Zywave, Work Smart, Applied Epic, Retirement/Wealth platforms) is preferred but not required

Insurance brokerage operations knowledge is preferred

Due to the nature of this position, you may be required to work outside regular business hours

This position reports into Chicago and can be based anywhere in the U.S. (i.e. remote/virtual).

We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Job Overview
The ideal candidate will be an experienced, client-facing Business Analyst to serve as a cornerstone with our clients and blend their insurance domain knowledge with a thorough understanding of the Majesco software solutions. The Business Analyst will be a key liaison between the Insurance carrier and the Majesco software development teams.
Key Responsibilities
To assist clients in effectively gathering business requirements
To understand and analyze client’s documentation, identifying implications, issues, and risks
Maintain a Traceability Matrix for mapping the customer requirements to corresponding functions
To develop business rating requirements documentation from client specifications
To prioritize customer’s requirements throughout the release lifecycle
To analyze and evaluate existing and/or proposed insurance systems
To analyze underwriting and rating manuals to determine rating similarities and differences across states
To work with multiple stakeholders to support development of client’s core insurance software solution and business process
To create visual design diagrams for all audiences
To develop test plans & participate in the testing process to ensure high quality project deliverables
To review test cases created by the client
To interact with other team members and clients to ensure quality solution
To communicate with the client to track and debug testing issues, resolve them, and perform regression testing.
To act as a mentor to colleagues and the client
To train customers on solutions provided
To support development of detailed requirements, user stories and functional design documents that can be referenced by global delivery staff, respond to their questions, and reconcile the functionality of their deliverables to these documents.
Perform gap analysis for new requirements in case of product implementation. Manage scope of work and support to project team in query resolution
Act as a product owner and represent the customer and the business in a scrum team
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of experience in strategic BA role for large scale projects in IT
Strong Property & Casualty domain experience and expertise on Policy administration systems
Knowledge of ISO/NCCI rating (manuals)
5+ years of experience in requirements gathering and management of Commercial Lines web-based applications (e.g. Worker’s Compensation and Commercial Auto & other LOB’s) or Personal Lines web-based applications (e.g. Personal Auto, Homeowners Insurance & other LOB’s)
Experienced in processes in SAFe methodology (Scaled Agile Framework)
Work Experience
Overall 10+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with at least 5+ years of experience in Property & Casualty commercial lines.
Business Travel and Physical Demands
Preferably based in Morristown, NJ
Business travel of approximately 30% yearly is expected for this position.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree required
Majesco is a leading insurance solutions and services provider.
Majesco's software for core insurance functions include Policy Administration, Underwriting, New Business Processing, Billing, Claims, Product Modeling, Incentive Compensation and Producer Life cycle Management. Additionally, Majesco offers consulting and insurance specific IT services for testing, data conversion, data-warehousing/BI, mobility, enterprise integration and BPM. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
