The Mom Project is excited to post this role on behalf of our partner, the world's leading producer of cereal and snacks production.
We have an opening for you to grow with us as a Business Intelligence Analyst at our Global Corporate Headquarters in Battle Creek, MI, or Chicagoland area, but this role can work in a virtual setting currently, in a state in the US where our client is registered to do business. This critical role will collaborate with the business to answer questions and promote efficiencies by using data and advanced analytic techniques.
Please note the role is 100% remote currently but will shift to a hybrid model when offices re-open in 2022.
HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
This role will support the Senior Data Scientists across multiple levels of the business and leadership to better enable analytics and data across the organization by doing the following:

Assist with the design, development, and deployment of data-driven predictive models to solve business problems using the most appropriate techniques in data mining, machine learning, and statistical modeling

Prepare and distribute operational reporting to the business

Manage the processing of business models using appropriate analytical software

Data manipulation, validation & cleansing

Report/tool maintenance

Dive into large, noisy, and complex real-world data to produce an innovative analysis of historical patterns in customer behaviors and product performance

Communication with business and teammates

Provide Adhoc data as requested by various areas of the business

Collaborating with IT Delivery and Sustainment, IT Demand and Architecture counterparts to ensure that solutions are well-documented, strategically aligned, and sustainable

YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS

Required:
High School Diploma or GED plus related experience

Experience in data analysis, modeling, and data mining

Experience in report building and ad-hoc analysis

Experience using internal and external data sources (e.g. Nielsen, IRI) to create analytical reports

Experience with analytical software and technology (such as R/Python, RStudio, R Shiny, AWS Data & Analytics)

Experience with SQL, Hive, Presto, Hadoop, or other data querying languages.

Experience using data visualization tools (Eg. Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Effectively collaborate with people within a project team

Ability to identify and effectively resolve issues

Excellent communication and motivation skills, and ability to interact appropriately with all levels of the organization

Demonstrated experience translating complex and technical subject matter

Ability to work in conditions, which include multiple and sometimes conflicting priorities

Bonus Points:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Engineering or related field

Relevant Consumer Packaged Goods industry experience

Experience supporting large scale system implementations

Experience developing analytics solutions using “Big Data” tools and techniques

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience

positionName: W2 REMOTE Supply Chain BA (Blue Yonder Experience)
description:
The Business Analyst Blue Yonder serves as a liaison between the business and the IT organization. There will be a primary focus on the Blue Yonder Application including business analysis, application design, configuration and administrative support for the Blue Yonder SCPO (Demand & Fulfillment), S&OP, Luminate Control Tower as well as other solutions. The Business Analyst will gather and understand complex business problems and provide the appropriate translation into detailed IT requirements. The Business Analyst will also perform project management tasks and will guide the IT development team during the analysis, development, and testing phases.

Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
o Participates in requirements gathering, design workshops to understand applications functionality and support requirements for both Blue Yonder applications and integrations to other business systems.

o Works with business and technology leaders to further define the support and project functions needed within the organization.

o Application administrative support; manage Blue Yonder security including roles, workflows, permissions, and groups.

o Manage operational requests and reporting including analysis, issue troubleshooting, prioritization and resolution. Build custom Blue Yonder reports including BY FE pages, dashboards, and workflows.

o Work with internal change management team to develop training materials and provide training and support to Blue Yonder end users including vendors/suppliers.

o Evaluate new releases of Blue Yonder applications to determine functionality requirements and provide detailed information on how changes will apply to all affected departments/users.

o Create/update data dictionary, data modeling and flow diagrams as needed. Document business process/data flows for integrated supply chain planning systems across the full business landscape.

o Participate in solution design and testing activities as needed.

o Support the evaluation of additional Blue Yonder applications and partner solutions.

o Continuous improvement and innovation on the Blue Yonder SCPO/ABPP platform.

o Hands-on Blue Yonder configuration in BY Cloud environment for SCPO and ABPP.

o Other projects or duties as assigned.

o Experience in the Consumer Goods or Distribution industry

o Experience with EDI transactions.

o Blue Yonder Demand, Fulfillment, S&OP, and Luminate Control Tower certification.
o 3+ years as a Supply Chain Business Analyst

o Experience in Supply Chain Planning applications

o 3+ years experience with Blue Yonder (best practices and functionality)

o Experience with demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, purchase order creation and management, sales & operations planning, and supply chain visibility.

o Experience working with ERP / Supply Chain master and transactional data; understands the integration between the two.

o Blue Yonder Certifications: Functional and/or Implementation Certifications.

o Experience writing user stories, managing and prioritizing product backlog.

o Experience in system development lifecycle activities supporting migrations from test to production environment.

o Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to configure UDTs, UDCs, build FE pages, define custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity.

o Strong data management abilities.

Overview:

Data Analyst III - REMOTE
Company Overview:
CoventBridge Group is the leading worldwide full-service investigation solutions company providing: Surveillance, SIU and Compliance, Claims Investigation, Counter-Fraud Programs, Desktop Investigations, Social Media, Record Retrieval, Canvasses and Vendor Management programs. With offices in the UK and U.S. the company provides top tier data privacy and security practices, deploys robust case management technology customized to clients’ needs and delivers worldwide coverage via its 1000 employees and affiliates worldwide.
About the Opportunity:
The Data Analyst III Performs high-level complex evaluation and analysis of data to support potential fraud cases and requests for information using claims data across multiple Medicare/Medicaid benefit types. The potential fraud cases involve high dollar amounts, sensitive issues, or otherwise meet criteria for referral to law enforcement, recoupment of overpayment, and/or administrative action based on reactive and proactive data analysis. Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analyst associates and assists management with special projects.
In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting CoventBridge Group's objective: To provide services to our clients that exceed their expectations and contribute to improved healthcare delivery by identifying and eliminating fraud, waste and abuse.

The Data Analyst III position will report to the Data Supervisor and will work in our Grove City, OH office or if not local, remotely from a home office.
Responsibilities/ Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Work with local management, investigators, and analysts to provide reactive and proactive case development support and to fulfill law enforcement data requests.
Communicate effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.
Performs quality assurance and validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare or Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.
Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analysts.
Develops and documents new processes and procedures to improve staff efficiency and better meet department and contract goals.
Works with Statisticians and Data Analysts to ensure quality data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.
Prepares, develops, and participates in staff training as related to Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.
Proactively monitors data sources (claims data, internet, etc.) to identify new and emerging Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste, and abuse trends.
Comply with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.
Assists with special projects that require complex analysis of data.
Requirements:
A minimum of three (3) years of previous experience in healthcare data analytics, with preference given to candidates with Medicare/Medicaid program integrity experience
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data; specifically, Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM codes, physician specialty codes) is required.
Have high proficiency level with MS Office Products.
Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other software applications necessary to perform healthcare claims data analytics.
Full COVID-19 vaccination and documentation are required as this position directly or indirectly supports a Federal Government Contract. [2 doses of Moderna or Pfizer; 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson]. Medical and religious accommodations are considered for exemption.

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision plans
Life, LTD and STD paid by the employer
401(k) with company match up to 4%
Paid Time Off and company paid holidays
Tuition assistance after 1 year of service
*CoventBridge is proud to be an EEO-AA employer M/F/D/V.*

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG

Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook

Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience

Description and Requirements
JOB SUMMARY: The Senior Statistical Data Analyst II will be involved in all aspects of statistical data analysis from determining the best statistical approaches to applying advanced analytics and statistics to answer key business questions relating to R&D and Clinical productivity and operations. The Senior Statistical Data Analyst II will work closely with senior leadership to integrate advanced analytics into the KMR data platform and services including predictive and prescriptive models, constrained optimization, deep learning and other methods. The position documents and presents the constructs of the statistical approach in both an internal and client facing role. The position requires a passion for data analysis and problem solving.
VACCINATION REQUIREMENT:
To be considered for U.S.-based positions unless currently employed by WCG, where permitted by applicable law (including any applicable reasonable accommodation, medical or religious exemption), candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by start date.
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in applied statistics, mathematics, or related field preferred.
Degrees in related fields with sufficient mastery of statistical principles through coursework, internships, experience, or a combination of those, are acceptable.
QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:
Minimum 3-5 years of experience working with complex datasets in a statistical capacity
Proficient in statistical programming language such as R or Python; working knowledge of SQL preferred
Skill in creating mathematical models that utilize:
Constrained Optimization
Multivariate Analysis through Linear Statistical Modeling, Factor Analysis etc.
Machine Learning or Predictive Modeling
Expertise in delivering data-driven applications in the form of APIs, dashboards or software packages
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office especially Excel
Demonstrated experience with data analysis, interpretation, and presentation

positionName: Senior IT Business Analyst - Software & Mobile Video
description:
If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home.
We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters.

Department Overview
Our IT organization has a critical role in driving extraordinary business results. Through a strong partnership with other areas of our business, we bring innovative thinking to every conversation and deliver with integrity. We’re looking for people who bring great ideas and who make our partners’ ideas better. Intellectually curious advisors (not order takers) who focus on outcomes to creatively solve business problems. People who not only embrace change, but who accelerate it.

Job Description
We are seeking a Senior IT Business Analyst who is a lifetime student, passionate about the use of technology to achieve business goals. S/he is self-motivated, thrives on working across multiple teams, and can use technology to solve complex business problems. The role focuses on supporting the business areas of Software Enterprise and Mobile Video. This is a lead position which has strong business facing aspects as well as accountability for delivery and leading projects. You will be responsible for working with business to prioritize demand, plan roadmap and help applying technology to enable the growth of business. You will also have end to end accountability starting from business case development, to leading the implementation end to end.
Scope of Responsibilities / Expectations
Work with business partners across all business functional areas (primarily Software Enterprise and Mobile Video) to understand their requirements, develop creative solutions, and lead the development, testing and implementation.
Collaborate effectively with both business and IT partners to meet commitments. Work through issues and challenges to complete tasks on time and on budget.
Determine the objectives of an assignment, and exercise judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to achieve measurable business outcomes.
Use your business acumen, technical skills, and knowledge of Oracle applications to estimate effort, engage IT partners, and lead solution delivery.
Translate rapidly transforming business needs into functional requirements, including proposing alternative solutions or options for implementation. Work with the various IT development teams or IT external partners to manage software demonstrations and proof of concepts (POC) to aid quick business decision making.
Proactively manage conflicting priorities, and drive prioritization discussions using strategic value.
Evaluate business processes, uncover areas for improvement, and identify creative ways to grow our software subscription business
Strong leadership & partnering skills to lead strategic projects, manage business case development, prioritize projects, and manage resource staffing through implementation
Detail oriented, with the ability to trace problems at the root, whether the cause is data or system related. Implement rapid resolutions and manage customer expectations, including broad communications.
Desired Background/Knowledge/Skills
2+ years of experience in a delivery leadership role
Demonstrated IT experience in leading & delivering large complex efforts & a basic understanding of various IT applications
Strong communication, collaboration and influencing skills
A basic understanding of the IT applications from Quote to Cash
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional & geographically dispersed teams
Experience with Agile methodology for project delivery
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to communicate to a wide variety of audiences, both business and technical
Must be able to manage project task execution independently and get associated team members to deliver their tasks on time, both with and without direct authority
Self motivated, ability to work independently, and drive execution independently
Very strong team player. Should possess the ability to foster teamwork and a positive working environment for the project team, in light of changes and challenges.
Must be well rounded, and have the ability to quickly come up to speed when exposed to multiple business and technical functions
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and generate new ideas to improve our business with the latest technology!
Motorola Solutions is a U.S. Federal contractor and must comply with the recent U.S. Government Executive Order requiring that Federal contractors ensure that their U.S. employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by December 8, 2021. Accordingly, Motorola Solutions requires all US employees, even those working from home, to be fully vaccinated unless entitled to a reasonable accommodation based on a qualified medical condition or religious belief.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to a qualified medical condition or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation prior to moving forward with the recruitment process. As a part of this process you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, an offer for employment will not be made.

Basic Requirements
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline plus 10+ years of IT experience
OR Masters degree in related field plus 7+ years of IT experience

Travel Requirements
None

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
Experienced

Referral Payment Plan
Yes
Our U.S. Benefits include:
Incentive Bonus Plans
Medical, Dental, Vision benefits effective Day 1
401K with Company Match and Day 1 vesting
9 Paid Holidays
Generous Paid Time Off Packages
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Paid Parental & Family Leave
and more!

EEO Statement
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience
POSTING DETAILS
Posting Number: 51232
Hours of Work: Mon. - Fri., 8:30 AM - 5 PM
Job Code: 960
Location: Open to various locations
Reports to: Manager, Corp. HR
Working Conditions: Office Environment

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.

This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

Why Kelly®?

In a world where change is the only constant, our unparalleled connections and IT market expertise help you take your skills exactly where you want to go. We’re here to help you gain experience, keep learning, and move your career forward.
About Kelly®
At Kelly, we’re always thinking about what’s next and advising job seekers on new ways of working to reach their full potential. In fact, we’re a leading advocate for temporary/nontraditional workstyles, because we believe they allow flexibility and tremendous growth opportunities that enable a better way to work and live (plus, did we mention we provide a ton of benefits?). Connecting great people with great companies is what we do best, and our employment opportunities span a wide variety of workstyles, skill levels, and industries around the world.
Kelly is an equal opportunity employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process as required under its Employment Accommodation Policy. Kelly will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known to Kelly in advance.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

Kearney & Company is seeking a Senior Analyst to join the team remotely. The Business Analyst Consultant will support a cross-functional team applying federal finance regulations (e.g., OMB, FASB) to CFO operations improving business operations with a focus on process and data. Responsibilities:

Financial transaction lifecycles

Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar.
